loans.name: Kemsreang's Group

texts.en:
Kemsreang, living in Kampong Cham province, is aged 41 years old and a mother of three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is too young. Growing rice and soy bean farming are the sources of her family’s income for twenty-three years. The main challenge of her farming business is drought, which causes her to earn a very low income.

Due to having not enough working capital, she is now leading a group to take a Kiva loan, which is her first loan cycle via VisionFund. She is willing to use her loan portion to buy seed and take the rest of money to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that this loan will help her to have a good crop and increase her income, which allow her to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seed for good crop growth and increase her income, which allows her to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man, with 5 children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a posho mill where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of maize. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of maize for his posho mill

loans.name: Lailani

texts.en:
Lailani is engaged currently in different kinds of businesses. First is a business in which she buys and sells musical instruments, which she has been doing for quite some time now. She also sells books and has had a tailoring business for more than 10 years. She’s thankful for lenders who helped her financially and Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan. The amount was used to buy raw materials to make different types of ready-to-wear clothes.

Lailani earned a bachelor's degree in music, and that’s why, aside from selling musical instruments, she also teaches students how to read notes and play different kinds of musical instruments, including stringed, woodwind, and percussion. She’s thankful that God provided her knowledge on how to run those businesses. Moreover, God sent CCT, where they provide business mentoring to new entrepreneurs.

Lailani applied for a PHP 20,000 loan because she’s planning to add stringed instruments for her buy-and-sell business like violins and guitars, stock of books, and raw materials to make PE uniforms. She’s praying that once again lenders will consider her story, since the amount will really be of big help for the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Lailani spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy stringed instruments for her buy-and-sell business like violins and guitars, stock of books, and raw materials to make PE uniforms.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Kossiwa est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec neuf enfants à charge. Kossiwa est une femme qui se force pour travailler et avoir des revenus. De ce fait, Kossiwa s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché des produits alimentaires qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de tomates, des paquets de cubes et des plateaux d’œufs afin de gagner plus de revenus et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et pouvoir aider son mari à payer les frais scolaire de leurs enfants à la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a 51-year-old, married woman who lives in Agoè with nine children whom she supports.

Kossiwa is a woman who makes herself work and has an income. As a result, Kossiwa purchases food products at the market three times a month and resells them from the front window of her house.

Kossiwa is asking for this loan to order boxes of tomatoes, packages of seasoning and trays of eggs in order to increase her income and meet the needs of her customers. She will also be able to help her husband pay for school fees for their children for the next school year.

loans.use: to buy eight boxes of tomatoes, four packages of seasoning and ten trays of eggs.

loans.name: Tory's Group

texts.en: Tory’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Tory makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his taxi

loans.name: Norma Aracely

texts.es:
Norma de 28 años de edad, una joven muy dedicada a sus trabajo de enfermería en la unidad de salud de su comunidad, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable, también se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura.


Norma tiene una experiencia de 3 años de trabajar como empleada en la clínica de su comunidad y un año de experiencia en venta de productos de belleza como su propio negocio, actividad que aprendió de su tía quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería, motivada por su tía y las ganancias que genera las ventas  de estos productos ha decidido continuar. 
	

Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar perfumes, maquillajes, desodorantes entre otros productos de belleza para continuar con su negocio. 


Sus metas para un  futuro son de tener un bazar y una sala de belleza la cual le genere las ganancias suficientes para satisfacer sus necesidades, las de su familia, y sus compromisos crediticos.
texts.en:
Norma, 28, is very dedicated to her nursing job in the health clinic in her community. She's known as a very responsible person. She also works making catalog sales of beauty products. She lives with her parents, who are farmers.

Norma has three years of experience as an employee in the community clinic and one year with her own business selling beauty products. She learned this job from her aunt, who sells cosmetics and perfume. Motivated by her aunt and the earnings from selling these products, Norma has decided to continue with it.

She needs this loan to buy perfume, make-up, deodorant, and other beauty products so she can continue with her business.

Norma's goal for the future is to have a store and a beauty salon that will generate enough profits for her to satisfy her needs and her family's as well as her loan commitments.

loans.use: to buy perfume, make-up, deodorant, and other beauty products to continue with her business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée, Jeanne est une femme mariée avec cinq enfants à charge. Jeanne  est âgée de 38 ans et habite à Agoè où elle prépare et vend de la pâte bandée « kom » faite à base du maïs. Jeanne  achète le nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à la devanture de son domicile. Jeanne sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs  afin de gagner plus de bénéfices en vue de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de son foyer et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne is married and has five dependent children. She is 38 years old and lives in Agoè, where she prepares and sells “kom” corn mash. She purchases her necessary preparation supplies at the market two times per month and sells her product in front of her home.

Jeanne will use this loan to order bags of corn to earn more profit in order to help her husband with household needs and to improve everyday living conditions for their children.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of corn.

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.ru:
Илхомчон мужчина 27 лет. Он женат  и имеет двоих детей. Он с раннего возраста был приучен к труду. Окончив 9 классов школы, Илхомчон устроился на работу на сварщика, чтобы помогать родителям. Илхомчон трудолюбивый мужчина, он никогда не жаловался на свою работу, никогда не просил у родителей денег. Он наоборот всегда помогал им и растил свои младших братьев и сестер. Также он занимается животноводством. У него в стаде 5 коров и 10 баранов. Его жена доит коров и относит молоко на рынок. 
Илхомчон хочет расширить свой бизнес, купить 1 корову и барана. Но у него нет хватает собственных средств. Илхомчон обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Он благодарит за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Ilhomjon is a 27-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He has been accustomed to hard work from an early age. After finishing 9th grade, Ilhomjon got a job as a welder to help his parents. Ilhomjon is a hardworking man who never complains about his work or asks his parents for money. On the contrary, he always helps them and he raised his younger brothers and sisters. He also takes care of livestock. His herd includes five cows and ten rams. His wife milks the cows and takes the milk to the market. Ilhomjon wants to expand his business by buying a cow and a ram, but he does not have enough money. He applied for financial support with MDO Arvand and is thankful for the support and assistance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty lives with her spouse and two children; they are living in a rental apartment. She has a business sewing dresses to customers and also selling ready-to-sew dresses too, work she learned to do with the help of an aunt. Now she is independent and she has been serving her customers on her own for twelve years.

To increase the merchandise that she offers her customers, she has decided to ask for a loan, with which she will be able to purchase more materials that she will sew and sell to her customers. Her principal objective is that her customers purchase more and, so, to have more income to support the family expenses.

Her aspirations are to continue working to have a source of income that allows her to get her children ahead and to have a better quality of life in her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials, which she will sew and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en: Ron’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ron makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Eyanawa

texts.fr: Agée de 58 ans, Eyanawa est une femme divorcée et mère de trois enfants. Pour exercer ses activités, Eyanawa vit à Agoè et vend des casseroles en circulant les quartiers environnant pour ainsi gagner son revenu. Eyanawa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour des casseroles, Eyanawa demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et trouver un gain nécessaire pour aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Eyanawa, aged 58, is divorced and mother to three children. To run her business, Eyanawa lives in Agoè and sells her pots by circulating throughout the surrounding neighborhoods to make her income.

Eyanawa purchases her supplies four times per month at the market. For the pots, Eyanawa requests this loan to make her purchases and to make the necessary profit to help her children thrive and have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase seven pots.

loans.name: Rosa Miriam

texts.es:
Rosa, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada, junto a su actual pareja tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, pero de su relación anterior tiene dos hijas una de ellas vive con en su casa y la otra vive con su papá. 

Rosa, es ama de casa, vende tortillas y tiene una pequeña tienda, tiene muchos años realizando estas actividades, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, su hija mayor le ayuda a vender en la tarde cuando sale de estudiar. 

Rosa, necesita el dinero para comprar ropa, surtir su tienda y comprar maíz, para tener bien surtidos sus negocios porque espera vender más en estos días de feria de su pueblo.

Rosa, sueña con darle la oportunidad de estudiar a sus hijos y que su negocio siga prosperando para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 33 years old and has a fourth grade education. She is married and has two children, ages one and four, with her current partner. From a past relationship she has two daughters, one lives with her and the other lives with her father.

Rosa is a homemaker, she sells tortillas and she has a small store. She has been working these jobs for many years and she also makes a living selling clothes. Her oldest daughter helps her with sales in the afternoon when she is finished school.

Rosa needs the money to buy clothes, to stock her store and to buy corn. She wants her businesses to be well-stocked, because she hopes to sell more during the holidays in her town.

Rosa's dream is to give her children the opportunity to go to school and she hopes her business continues to prosper so she can give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, to stock her store and to buy corn.

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат женщина в возрасте 41 года проживающая в сельской местности. У Латофат большая и дружная семья. Сама Латофат с раннего возраста занимается разведением крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Отец Латофат был сельским пастухом и она ему часто помогала ухаживать за скотом. Постепенно она начала самостоятельно заниматься скотоводством. После замужества Латофат не бросила это занятие, а наоборот увеличила поголовье скота так как муж полностью поддерживал ее бизнес. Дети в свободное от учебы время помогают родителям по хозяйству и уходу за скотом. Для семьи Латофат животноводство является основным источником дохода. На данный момент цены на скот резко упали и продать взрослый скот Латофат не может, так как потеряет часть прибыли. Она решила обратиться в "АРВАНД" за кредитом. На полученные деньги Латофат хочет закупить молодой скот и корм для скота на зиму.
texts.en: Latofat is a 41-year-old woman who lives in a rural area. She has a large and close-knit family. Latofat has been raising cattle and small livestock since an early age. Her father was a farmer and she used to help him take care of the livestock. Slowly she started raising livestock on her own. After getting married, Latofat did not stop her activities—on the contrary, she increased her herd, as her husband fully supported her business. When they aren’t in school, the children help their parents on the farm and care for the animals. Livestock provides the main source of income for Latofat’s family. The price of cattle recently fell sharply and Latofat can’t sell grown livestock because she would lose money. She decided to apply for a loan with Arvand. She wants to use the money to buy young livestock and feed for the winter.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is 25 years old. He supports one child. He does motorcycle transportation. He has been in this business for the last six years. Right now, his monthly income is KES 12,000.

He is borrowing a loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 113,500, to purchase a new motorcycle for transportation of customers and goods, from one place to another. He would use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and buy spare parts for the motorcycle.

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. His hopes and dreams for his future business are to buy a motor vehicle and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation of customers and goods, from one place to another.

loans.name: Gulmastura

texts.ru: На фотографии добрая и приятная женщина по имени Гулмастура. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем и в браке имеет троих детей. Сыновьям 26 и 20 лет, а дочке красавице исполнилось 16 лет. Ее муж занимается животноводством, как и многие односельчане. Гулмастура решила заниматься шитьем женской одежды. Эту деятельность она продвигает уже несколько лет. Гулмастура все эти годы занималась шитьем на одной швейной машинке. Ее машинка со временем потеряла свою рабочую силу и скоро выйдет из строя. Гулмастура не хочет останавливать бизнес и просит помочь ей купить новую швейную машинку. Поддержите Гулмастуру.
texts.en:
In the photo you see a good and pleasant woman called Gulmastura. She is 49 years old. She is married with three children. Her sons are 26 and 20 years old, and her daughter is a beauty at the age of 16. Her husband works with livestock breeding, as many fellow villagers.

Gulmastura decided to work with sewing women's clothing. She has worked in this business for several years. Gulmastura has worked with sewing on the same sewing machine all these years. Her sewing machine has currently lost its power and will soon fail.

Gulmastura would not like to discontinue her business and requests help to purchase a new sewing machine. Please support her.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Harry

texts.en:
Harry is a 32 year old man, married with two kids between the ages of 4 and 10 years old. He is a hard working man who never gives up in life. He has a shop located in Achimota, Accra where he sells crates of assorted soft drinks and boxes of mineral water. 
He has been in the business for about two years now. Harry needs a loan of about GHS 1500 to buy more products to increase his daily sales to support his family and the other two people who depend on him for financial assistance.
It is his dream that he would be able to expand his business in the near future and also have a chain of other businesses. His problem however is getting financial aid to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat, an ambitious Palestinian widowed woman, lives with her son and daughter in a camp for Palestinian refugees located in the North of Lebanon. Hayat is 50 years old and never went to school, instead, she always worked hard to support her family financially. Three and a half years ago, she opened her grocery store in a busy street of the camp, where she sells all types of food, drinks and cleaning products. Since her husband died, the store is her only source of income which motivates her to keep expanding it to improve her sales.

For the first time, Hayat is asking for a 1,029,765 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa to buy new goods and products for her grocery store. Increasing the store's supply will allow Hayat to boost her sales and profits. This way, she will have more income to spend on her children's education since they will both start attending university next year.

loans.use: to buy goods for her general store .

loans.name: Sonet's Group

texts.en: Sonet was born in a rural part of the Mongkul Borey district in Banteay Meanchey province. She is a 40-year-old farmer who is married and has three children, one of whom is still a dependent while another is still in school. For the last twenty-five years, Sonet and her husband have earned a living by growing corn, and she supplements her income by working for others when she is not farming. Sonet earns about $12 per day and can save approximately about $5. Her main challenges are weeds and pests, which reduce her crop yield. Sonet, who is new to VisionFund, leads a two-person loan group and plans to use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and organic week killers. Her hope is to provide her son with better support for his studies and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield and pay for her son's education.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Thach's Group

texts.en: Thach’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Thach makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn, 28, is a married mother of two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other one is too young to attend school, living in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice as the main source of her family’s income for ten years. Tailoring clothes is an additional source of income for her to complement her family’s need. She is able to earn around 12 USD per day. Due to the depreciation of her crop price is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family.

Now, Norn is leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund and this is the first Kiva loan for her. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee to increase her crop yields. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income and ability to keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds to increase her crop yields, so that she can increase her income and ability to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Shahid Ahmad

texts.en: Shahid Ahmad is 29, married, and lives with his wife and two children in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He owns a small business selling clothing in a busy part of his town's main market. There is a lot of competition so it is necessary to have a big variety of clothing to meet customer needs. Fortunately, people like his selection a lot and he wants to continue this now that the winter season is about to begin. To make this possible, he is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. His dream is to provide a good education to his children, and he is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy more seasonal clothing for his shop.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en: Eng, 29,  is a widowed farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province. Being the single parent of two children, she faces many challenges and grows rice as her sole source of income. Her farm always faces challenges like pests and poor yields. Moreover, crop prices are low. Eng is applying for her first loan from VisionFund and as group leader will use most of her loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer, and use the balance to buy organic pesticide to protect her crop from pests. She hopes she can increase her income and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to increase her crop, earn more money and send her children to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve her stall and range of produce for sale.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 34-year-old married father of two children, a Palestinian refugee who lives with his small family in a Palestinian refugee camp.

In 2000, Rami started working in the construction business, specialized in the painting sector to cover his family's increasing needs and expenses. He is an ambitious, hardworking man who is putting in a lot of effort to provide his family with better living conditions.

This is the reason Rami is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car necessary for his business development to cover a wider region and make sure he is capable of increasing his family's income.

He hopes that in the future, he can continue to be capable of expanding his business in a well- managed way.

loans.use: To buy a car necessary for his business development through covering wider regions and make sure he is capable of  increasing his family's income

loans.name: Qurbonkhon

texts.en: Qurbonkhon is a bright girl who was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with her parents and three siblings. She graduated high school with excellent grades, then passed the entrance examination to university where she is going to study finance and credit. She is committed to learn and become a highly qualified specialist. Qurbonkhon has applied to IMON for a loan which she will use to pay her tuition. She is grateful for the support she receives from Kiva lenders, and appreciates the help they are giving her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a married woman with 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to open other business branches within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a well organised and established business. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy items for her store. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Cynthia will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

She hopes that in the future, she will open a boutique. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a twenty-two year old single man living in Bundibugyo-Uganda. His major business is motor vehicle transportation (taxi) and he also has a shop that sells general merchandise. He is a very hard working young man who is very committed to his work, having started the business to raise income for self support. He faces a challenge of high fuel prices and expensive spare parts.

He intends to use the loan to buy merchandise like sodas, sugar, soap and cosmetics to sell. He used the first loan to buy tires and repair his vehicle that helps him transport his merchandise to different markets.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sodas, sugar, soap and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy is married and the mother of four children. She describes herself as honest and operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been in this business for twelve years and works in a good area where most of her customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital and will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm supplies. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; she successfully repaid her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy farm supples.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes is from Darakert village of Ararat region. He is a farmer. Hovhannes lives with his parents, wife and two little daughters.

He owns a plot of land where he cultivates cucumbers and greens. Hovhannes also owns a greenhouse, where he cultivates different vegetables and sells them in the markets.

To be able to purchase a polyethylene cover for a greenhouse and thire workers for organizing cultivation works, Hovhannes has applied for this loan. As this is his first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Hovhannes hopes for his good cooperation with lenders.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for a greenhouse and to hire workers for organizing cultivation work.

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan, born in 1987, is the Thai ethnic woman. She has been joining in the program of M7-MFI since January 2008. She currently lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is coffee cultivation, and each year the income from cultivating coffee is about VND 50 to 60 million but after deducting all costs is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. Her son is at grade 2 at school and she does not have enough money to pay for his education fees. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her son have better conditions for learning and then he will have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for her son education fees

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es una persona muy conocida en su comunidad, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable y dedicada a su familia, a sus cultivos y a la ganadería, se creció con su madre quien  fue la responsables de apoyar y enseñar todos los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería, de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante y dar lo mejor a su familia la cual está formada por su esposo, dos hijas y un hijo.


Rosaura se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, a cuidar ganado y a la venta de lácteos, en esta actividad tiene 20 años de experiencia, la aprendió de su abuela y su madre quien dedicó toda su vida agricultura y ganadería, una de sus hijas le ayuda a Rosaura por las mañanas a recolectar la leche y a dar de comer a los animales ya que por la tarde se dedica a los estudios.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar una vaca lechera y comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol. 


Las proyecciones que ella tiene para un futuro son las de establecer mejores instalaciones para su ganado y comprar una máquina picadora de zacate.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a well-known person in her community and is very responsible and dedicated to her family, to her crops and to her livestock. She grew up with her mother who supported her and taught her everything about farming and livestock. This has allowed her to get ahead and give the best to her family which is made up of her husband, two daughters and a son.

Rosaura raises pigs, cares for livestock and sells dairy products. She has 20 years of experience doing this and learned from her mother and her grandmother. Her mother dedicated her entire life to farming and livestock. One of Rosaura's daughters helps her with milking and feeding the animals in the mornings and devotes the afternoons to her studies.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow and to buy farming supplies for her corn and bean crops.

Her future plans are to have better facilities for her livestock and to buy a fodder shredder.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and farming supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: José Genaro

texts.es:
José es un hombre casado, su familia está conformada por su esposa y dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad, José es caracterizado en su comunidad como una persona muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo y a su familia.
  

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era muy pequeño, cuenta con mucho conocimiento y experiencia gracias a la enseñanza de su abuelo. En la actualidad se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, maíz y frijoles de esta forma  puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia y apoyar en los estudios de sus hijos.



Este préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, venenos, abonos entre otros insumos, comprará un granero donde guardar el cultivo y para invertir en cultivo de hortalizas.


Las metas que tiene para futuro son las de tener un sistema de riego por goteo para trabajar las hortalizas en tiempo de verano.
texts.en:
José is a married man. His family consists of his wife and two children who are currently studying at the community school. José is known in his community to be a very responsible person who is dedicated to his work and to his family.

He has worked in agriculture since he was very young and has a lot of knowledge and experience thanks to the teachings from his grandfather. He currently works by sowing basic grains, corn, and beans. This is how he is able to meet his family's needs and support his children in their education.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers, poisons, manure, and other supplies. It will also be used to buy a barn for his crops and to invest in growing vegetables.

His goals for the future are to have a drip irrigation system to take care of the vegetables in the summer season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, poison, manure, and other supplies. It will also be used to buy a barn for his crops and to invest in growing vegetables.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be strong and God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells second hand clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport costs. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be wealthy. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is 39 years old living in Kasese Uganda married with six children. Nelson runs a depot selling sodas, beers and spirits to make income for his family. Nelson is also a salary earner but due to his hard working nature, he practices crop farming and sells timber to make additional income. Nelson has a dream of educating his children but he is challenged by high rental fees. He is requesting for a loan to buy spirits, sodas and beers for selling.

loans.use: to buy spirits, sodas and beers for selling.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with 6 children. He operates a farm where he grows bananas, maize and other cereals. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a productive place and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Stepanavan town where she lives with her husband and daughter. He is a farmer and has been raising cattle for the past years.
Armine is a nurse by profession. She provides medical service for her neighbours and patients from her house and is well known in Stepanavan town for her high professional work.

She has now applied for this loan to purchase three calves and forage for feeding the livestock.
Armine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Armine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.
Armine hopes that Kiva lenders will appreciate her ideas and finance her to realize it.

loans.use: to pay for three calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Kanhara's Group

texts.en:
A married woman who is a farmer in Kampong Cham province, Kanhara is 28 years old and has a dependent daughter who is too young to attend school. She has farmed cassava for 10 years as the main source of income. To earn additional income, she is growing rice and working for others for a fee.

The cassava farm has been covered by weeds. As a result, the crop is unhealthy and produces lower outputs.

She decides to lead a group of two to apply for a loan from VisionFund to save her business.

Kanhara, who is the leader, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and herbicide to support her farmland. She hopes she can generate more income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yield to earn more income and upgrade the standard of living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Satine

texts.en:
Satine, a teacher by profession, has been involved in farming activities in Kapan town. Satine lives with her little son and mother, who help her with work on the farm. Her farm currently includes 2 cows, 4 calves, 3 pigs and 10 colonies of bees.

Realizing how big the need is for agricultural income for the family, Satine wants to increase it.

She asks this loan to purchase a cow and forage for feeding the livestock.

Satine has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back. However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Satine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.

Satine hopes for the loan, and successful cooperation with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for the last many years. Sajida's husband needs to replace the tires of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle's tires is not good.

Due to insufficient financial means he is unable to cover the cost of new tires for his vehicle. Therefore Sajida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her husband's taxi tyre replacement.

loans.name: God Is Good Group

texts.en:
Doris is 48 years of age. She is from Assin Foso in the central region of Ghana. Doris is the leader of the God Is Good group. She is married with five children. The youngest child is 3 years and the eldest is 18 years old. All her children are in school.

Doris has been into trading for the past 20 yrs. She sells both alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages. With her 20 years of work experience, Doris is yearning to expand her business by way of opening a new branch in the next five years. It is also her vision to provide better service to her customers, but financial challenges has been a stumbling block to the achievement of her goals. Doris has many customers and sales are very good during the weekends due to weddings, funerals, outdooring and other festive activities.

Doris needs a working capital loan to enable her purchase more drinks to meet her customer's demands and future growth aspirations.

Doris intends to use the profit from her trade to improve the education needs of the family and support her business. Doris thanks all her Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to distribute alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy daily necessity for her new kiosk stocks and water tub materials such as bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Japheth

texts.en:
Japheth is a married man. He has 6 children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a retail business where he sells soda, sweets, sugar, salt and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all kinds.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficent funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sweets, sugar, flour,soap and other items. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sweets, sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Suyapa

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos, se crió con sus padres y abuela la cual esta última se dedicaba a  realizar los oficios domésticos.


Blanca tiene una experiencia de 15 años en realizar trabajos domésticos en casa de personas que se lo solicitan, se dedica a cuidar niños, ancianos y cuida casas cuando no están sus dueños, de esta forma es como ella consigue ingresos para poder salir adelante.


El dinero será utilizado para comprar fertilizantes y herbicidas ya que necesita realizar la siembra con su esposo. 


Sus sueños son cancelar el crédito y montar un negocio de venta de comida en su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children. She was raised with her parents and her grandmother, who spent her time doing domestic chores.

Blanca has 15 years experience doing domestic work for people who request her. She takes care of children and seniors, and takes care of houses while the owners are away. In this manner she brings in income to help her get ahead.

The money from the loan will be utilized to buy fertilizers and herbicides she now needs in order sow with her husband. Her dreams are to pay off the loan and start a business selling food from her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides that she needs in order to sow with her husband.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en oficios varios y tienen un hijo que está en kínder.

Ana, tiene un puesto en el mercado, en el cual vende productos de la canasta básica y también tiene una tortillería, este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de tres años, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque genera buenos ingresos para mantener a la familia y poder darle un buen futuro a su hijo, la distancia que recorre son dos kilómetros, para llegar al local de ventas en el mercado y su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 6: p.m.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar 6 quintales de maíz para hacer tortillas para vender, porque es un negocio de gran demanda en la ciudad.

Ana, sueña con ver crecer mucho más su negocio y con colocar otro local en la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ana is 28 years old and studied up to the seventh grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in various trades. They have a son who is in Kindergarten.

Ana has a stand at the market at which she sells staple goods and makes tortillas. She has had this business for more than three years. She decided to make a living in this business because it generates good income to support the family and be able to give her son a good future. The distance that she travels to get to the sales area in the market is two kilometers. Her work schedule is from 5:00am to 6:00pm.

Ana needs the loan to buy 6 quintals of corn to make tortillas to sell because it is a business of high demand in the city. 

Ana dreams of growing her business much more and opening another location in the city.

loans.use: to purchase 6 quintals of corn to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Муборак  пожилая женщина 63 лет. Она  замужем  и имеет четырех детей. Муборак  пенсионерка, её муж тоже  пенсионер. они вместе  трудятся на своём земельном участке несмотря на свой пожилой возраст.   Муборак сотрудничает с Арванд с 2014 года.
  На этот раз она  обратилась  в Арванд   узнав о  новом продукте «Тахсил».  Она решила приобрести  учебные принадлежности   для   своих  внуков.  Она  заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Muborak is an elderly woman 63 years of age. She is married and has four children. Muborak is retired, and her husband is too. They work on their plot of land together despite their advanced age. Muborak has been collaborating with Arvand since 2014. This time she has applied to Arvand having found out about its new "Takhsil" loan product. She has decided to buy school supplies for her grandchildren. She thanks you in advance for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her grandchildren.

loans.name: Francisca Yanira

texts.es:
Francisca, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y tiene tres hijos, pero solo una está estudiando.

Francisca, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tamales y atol de elote, su compañero de vida es agricultor; ella se dedicaba anteriormente a vender pero el negocio era para otras personas, cuando ella notó que era rentable, decidió colocar su propio negocio.

Francisca, necesita el dinero para comprar maíz, frijoles y más ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales. 

Ella sueña con tener una mejor casa de habitación para sus hijos y ayudarlos a que se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Francisca, 32 years old, finished sixth grade; she is in a relationship and has three children, but only one daughter is in school.

Francisca makes and sells tamales and sweet corn and milk beverages; her life partner is a farmer. She was previously engaged in selling but the business was for other people; when she noticed that it was profitable, she decided to set up her own business.

Francisca needs the money to buy corn, beans and other ingredients for making tamales. She dreams of having a better house for her children to live in and to help them prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: buy corn, beans and other ingredients for making tamales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase her stock of birds.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay, 57, is a widowed mother of five children, who are all having their own careers such as Motor repairer and factory worker. Nowadays, she grows rice on two hectares of farmland located in Kampong Cham province as the main source of her family’s income for twenty years. Working as a paid worker is an additional source of income for her to complement her family’s need. Due to the drought and insects have destroyed her crop recently; she is able to earn a very low income.

Now, Nay is leading a group to take a new loan via VisionFund and this is the first Kiva loan for her. As a group leader, she is willing to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income and ability to renovate her old wooden house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yields so that she can earn more income and ability to renovate her old wooden house. .

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 39-year-old married mother of one child, who decided seven years ago to open her own clothes and shoe selling shop to support her husband in improving their living.

Rana is well known in her region with her special encouraging set prices, in addition to the good quality of products she has.

To keep her customers satisfied and address their needs, Rana is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special back-to-school and winter clothes.

She hopes to expand her business in the future and provide her family with a better living.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special back-to-school and winter clothes to address her customer's needs.

loans.name: Bily Randy

texts.es: Randy es un joven universitario de 22 años. Actualmente se encuentra cursando el octavo ciclo de su carrera de Psicología. El decidió estudiar esta carrera porque para el es muy importante la salud emocional de la persona. Ademas de ser un joven aplicado en sus ratos libres le gusta salir a jugar fútbol con sus amigos. Para obtener algún ingreso trabaja esporadicamente como asistente en un consultorio. El solicito el préstamo para poder pagar sus pensiones de estudios. Ya se encuentra a un año de terminar su carrera. Se siente agradecido con las personas que le pueden ayudar a cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Bily Randy is a 22 year old university student. He is currently in the eighth cycle of his psychology program. He decided to study this major because a person's emotional health is very important to him. In addition to being a focused young man, in his free time he like to go out to play soccer with his friends.

To make some money, he works sporadically as an assistant in an office. He seeks a loan in order to pay the costs of his studies. He is now within one year of finishing his degree. He is thankful to the people who can help him reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a motorcycle transport business, in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 65,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcyle. He hopes that in the future, he will own a matatu.

This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcyle.

loans.name: Lalita

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Lalita lives in a small village named Kalirhat in Dhupguri, West Bengal. She has two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is unemployed and her daughter is a student in grade 11. Her husband is a farmer by profession. Though the family income is scanty, Lalita is striving hard to provide an education to her daughter.

Lalita's daughter Purnima is 17 years old and reads in grade 11 in Kalirhat Dewan Chandra High School. Purnima has cherished a dream from her childhood to become a nurse and serve the poor people. To fulfill her dream, she strives hard to score good marks in her all examinations. Lalita can't afford the huge educational expenses of her daughter. But Purnima badly needs some books and private tuition.

Hence, as a responsible mother, Lalita is requesting a loan from BJS (a Kiva partner) to bear the educational expenses of her daughter. She plans to pay school fees, tuition fees and buy study materials for her daughter. The loan will help a bright young girl to continue her education without any obstacles.

Lalita and her daughter Purnima (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells timber and firewood. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His primary customers are carpenters.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more wood to produce timber. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more wood to produce timber

loans.name: Way Forward Group

texts.en:
Members of the Way Forward Group have been through the trials and tribulations of running their own businesses and yet they continue to work hard and manage their loans successfully. They know the difference between good and bad borrowing,as a result of the sessions they've had at Thrive and most importantly the in-depth, priceless experience they acquired throughout their previous loans. Janet is leading the Way Forward Group on a fourth loan. She is doing exceptionally well in her business. During her first loan, she received $300 and restocked blankets and clothes from South Africa. She managed to expand her business tremendously to the point that she added a new range of products which includes shoes, cellphones and beauty products.
Owing to her resilient business and the previous loans she attained, she has managed to impressively improve her life both socially and financially. She managed to insert floor tiles in the whole house and additionally replaced asbestos roofing with roof tiles. Furthermore, she gave thought-provoking testimony on how she managed to send her two children to study at Russian universities. One of the group members bought an open truck meant for business deliveries. Members.of Way Forward continue to encourage and help each other in difficult times.

loans.use: To increase the range of products for sale.

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en: Cornelius is a married man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spares. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His primary customers are motorists. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of products. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of auto spares.

loans.name: Gwindoline

texts.en:
Gwindoline is from Accra, Ghana, where she is married to a pharmacist and a mother of two children, 15 and eight years old.

For 11 years Gwindoline has operated a catering service, supplying pastries, cakes and breads to the community. Both she and her husband work hard for the future, and she aims to uplift her business so that they can move out of their apartment and build their own house.

Gwindoline is requesting this loan to continue buying flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients to prepare pastries, cakes and bread for her customers. She will reinvest the profits arising from this loan into the business and also take care of her children and home.

loans.use: to buy flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients to prepare pastries, cake and bread.

loans.name: Twifo Traders No. 4 Group

texts.en: Baby is 46 years old and resides in Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana. She is the group representative of Twifo Traders No.4. Baby is married with five children, ages 22 to 30.  Only two of the children are in school. Baby trades in soap, soft drinks, milk, etc. in her local community. She has been in business for 16 years. Baby also sells cooked rice as another source of income to support the household. She wants to see her business grow in five years’ time by expanding and filling the store with more goods. Her major challenge is the financing of the business. Baby needs micro loan financial support to help her achieve her aim of earning more income for her family. Baby thanks all her Kiva lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy soap, soft drinks, rice, and milk for resale

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, a married mother of five, describes herself as ambitious. For two years she has operated a transport business involving a matatu (minibus) that transports customers to their destination. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. 

Pamela will use this Kes 100,000 loan to buy spare parts for her matatu and hopes that in the future she will buy two more matatus. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, her previous loans fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her matatu

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima, 20 years old, is a housewife. She lives with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter) in Falakata. Her husband Ajmuddin is 28 years old. He is a farmer involved with agriculture. Nilima received an education up to grade four and her husband received an education up to grade eight. Nilima wants to provide a good education for her children. Her son reads in grade one and her daughter is a toddler now.

Her husband cultivates different kinds of vegetables in different seasons. She also helps her husband in cultivation after managing her household work. Now they have decided to cultivate cauliflower on their farmland because this is the perfect season to cultivate this crop and the demand for this crop is very high in the upcoming winter season.

So Nilima has applied for the loan to purchase cauliflower seeds and good quality manure, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming. The profit generated from this business will help them to improve the financial condition of their family and an opportunity to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to  buy three cows for sale  to meet  family needs.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is 26 years old and supports one dependent. He has run a motorcycle taxi business for the last four years. His monthly income is KES 20,000. He is taking out a loan of KES 98,345 to buy a motorcycle for his transportation business. He would use the profit to repay the loan and maintain his motorcycle. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. His dream for the future is to buy another motorcycle and create job opportunities for the  community.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Shabyarani

texts.en:
Shabyarani stays in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. She is 34 years old and lives with her husband and their two sons. The couple could not continue their education due to their family financial issues but they are very much concerned at providing an education to their sons who are studying in grades 8 and 10.

Her husband runs their grocery store and Shabyarani assists her husband after managing all of her household work. They sell items like spices, salt, rice, oil, and sugar, which are in great demand among the local villagers and neighbors. But the family's earnings hardly cover the family's basic needs. In order to meet the growing inflation and to keep provisions for the future cost of her sons’ education, Shabyarani wants to grow her husband’s grocery business. She realizes that she can earn more profit if she can increase her stocks on a large scale. To buy more grocery items in bulk, she needs capital. So she requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan to purchase more grocery items and daily needed commodities in bulk so that she can satisfy the regular customers and earn more. With the increased income, Shabyarani will be able to expand her business and save better for her family’s secure future.

Shabyarani thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more vegetables, corn, and charcoal, and kiosk stock such as sugar, tea, coffee, candies, shampoo, matches, and salt, seasonings etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, noodles, wheat flour, rice flour sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Kanchana

texts.en:
Kanchana is a 44-year-old woman from a small village in Kandi. She is blessed with two sons. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. Her husband is a mason and her sons assist him in his work.

Kanchana is busy with housekeeping, while her husband makes foundations (centering) for houses in their rural area. The profit that comes from this business is not sufficient for them to cover their family expenses. As his business is the only source of income for the family of four, he needs to expand the business to earn more. But the main obstacle is he lacks adequate necessary masonry tools due to inadequate capital.

Kanchana always takes care of her family’s well being and so decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that her husband can buy more necessary supplies like cluster, wood, bamboo, ropes, a spade, hammer and other tools for making firm foundations for houses.

She hopes the family economy will improve and her husband’s masonry work will expand. This will enable them to earn more profit to lead a decent life.

She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase necessary masonry supplies for her husband’s mason work.

loans.name: Malaqsi

texts.en:
Malaqsi lives with her mother and son in Voskehat village, Amavir region. The whole family is engaged in farming. They keep livestock (two cows, three calves, and hens) and also cultivate wheat and potato. Malaqsi sells the gathered harvest in the market. 

Malaqsi applied for this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and renovation of the barn. This hardworking family has never avoided the difficulties that are in the agricultural sector. The region where the family lives, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region. 

Malaqsi's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living. Please help this hardworking farmer to develop her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer and renovation of the barn

loans.name: Ros's Group

texts.en: Ros’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Ros makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Buthum's Group

texts.en: Buthum’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Buthum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Ephantus

texts.en:
Ephantus is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking oil, sweets, cakes, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. 

He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, cooking oil, sweets, cakes, flour and other items.

She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have several shops within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 27-year-old entrepreneur from Falakata. She is married and a mother of a girl child. Namita’s husband Narayan is a barber by profession. They live in the small village of Chuyakhola in Falakata.

Namita’s husband has an inconsistent income, which is not adequate to meet all the expenses of the family. Namita always wants to extend her helping hands to her husband to run the family well. She decided to contribute to her family by practicing cattle farming and started raising dairy cows. She has been selling milk and other byproducts like cow dung (widely used as farm manure) to her neighbors for the last five years. In this way, she tries to provide a supplementary income to her family.

Namita has been earning a decent income from dairy farming. However, the demand is overwhelming, and she wants to increase her dairy cattle. The biggest challenge is a lack of funds. So she is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, with which she plans to purchase a quality breed of dairy cow and fodder.

Namita will use the profits from selling milk for her daughter’s wellbeing and to purchase some agricultural land. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her dairy business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To increase the range of detergents she makes.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati, 30 years old, is the mother of three sons. She lives in a small village in Dhupguri. Minati has received an education up to grade eight, but she is highly interested in providing her children with a good education. Two of her sons are students in grade seven and three. respectively. One son is just five years old and has not yet started going to school.

Minati is a housewife and her husband is a farmer by profession. Her elder son Mithun is a student in grade seven. He is 12 year old and reads in Wast Magurmari J.R. High school. His father is the only earner of the family. So his parents are facing difficulty paying his educational expenses. Mithun is sincere about his studies and school curriculum. Minati has been unable to take care of all the things he needs, to continue his studies.

Thus, Minati applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). She thanks BJS (Kiva’s partner) for helping her. This loan will resolve her anxiety. She will use the loan to buy educational materials and will also pay the school fees and tuition fees for her son Mithun.

Minati hopes this educational support will give a boost to her son’s education. So Minati and her son Mithun (in the picture) are now very happy by getting the loan from BJS and Kiva and both of them are thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: To bear the educational expenses of her son.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a 49-year-old married mother of two children. She started five years ago selling clothes from her house to cover the needs and expenses of her family. She has a good reputation among her region and has her loyal customers. 
Despite her limited income, Wafaa is working hard to provide her family with descent living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house through buying necessary curtains and new furniture to provide her family with healthier living place. 
Wafaa hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house through buying necessary curtains and new furniture

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man with one child. He describes himself as strong and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for eight years. His primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is the high cost of fuel.

This is Kevin's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He successfully repaid his previous loan. He will use this KES 100,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a married woman with 1 child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, shoes, bags. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of goods.

She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes, bags. Her business goal is to have a big boutique in town within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and bags.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a married woman with seven children. She describes herself as responsible. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate capital. 

This is Everlyne's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Meline

texts.en:
Meline her family live in the village Arjis, which is in the Tavush region. Meline's husband is policeman working at the local police station. His salary is not big and main source of family's income is farming business. To be able to care for the needs of the two children Meline and her mother-in-law work in the farm day and night. They keep hens and take care of beautiful orchards where different fruit trees are grown - peach, cherry, fig, walnut, apple and pear. Meline's husband helps with selling the products in the market.

This loan is important for the family to purchase two cows to make dairy produce and sell it. As this is Meline's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.
Meline hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to her agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for two cows to make dairy produce and sell it

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, sugar, wheat and other ingredients

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a single woman. She describes herself as smart. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her primary customers are locals.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Everlyne's business goal is to have a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

This is Susan's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 60,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to have a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is from Accra, Ghana. She is single and a mother of four children, ages 28, 21, 19 and 14. As a single parent, she has to work harder to be able to provide for these children and herself. Cynthia is engaged in selling foodstuffs. She has been doing this for 24 years. Cynthia works hard for the future.

She aims to improve her business to have enough money so that she can take care of her children and also stay in business. She asks to borrow money for additional capital to continue buying vegetables, which she will supply to her customers in the community. She will make a lot of profit from this loan request, which will help her reinvest and also take care of her children and home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, which she will supply to her customers in the community.

loans.name: Sefoon's Group

texts.en:
Sefoon is the age of 40, living in the rural area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a mason by profession. He has been constructing buildings and houses for the last ten years. He is an expert in his art; he has constructed a lot of beautiful buildings in his career. He uses tools such as brick trowels, buttering trowels, pointing trowels, hammers, chisels, jointers, and levels, which have been wearing out. He also works as a tile fixer (also part of masonry work). He wants to buy new tools and a grinder machine to continue his construction work but he does not have cash in hand. 

Therefore, Sefoon requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband could be empowered to buy tools and a grinder machine for construction work. Sefoon thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new tools and a grinder machine for her husband's masonry work

loans.name: Dilnavoz

texts.en:
Dilnavoz is married with two children. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968 and she lives in a village with her family. Dilnavoz is a careful mother. She is an accountant who has worked at a private organization more than 18 years. Dilnavoz is very experienced. 

Dilnavoz is sick and is requesting a loan through IMON to be healed at a medical clinic. She wants to be treated at a hospital clinic. Dilnavoz will use her loan to help her to be healthy and continue working.

loans.use: to be healed at medical clinic

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with two children. For the past ten years, she has operated a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. Sophia’s business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes herself to be visionary. 

Sophia is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy a hair dryer. This will be her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank and she successfully repaid her previous loans. Sophia’s business goal is to open two more branches within the next five years. She hopes that she will have a better living standard in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low prices. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: Kim’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 29 años de edad, no tiene un alto nivel de educación académica, está soltero y vive junto a sus padres a quienes les apoya en los trabajos agrícolas.


Desde muy pequeño, Pedro se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra pues de eso obtiene ingresos cuando vende la cosecha, además ha iniciado una pequeña tienda para mejorar los ingresos en el hogar.

Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar aceite, café, refrescos, pegamentos, golosinas, sopas, arroz, azúcar, verduras, huevos, pan, etc para surtir su tienda.

El sueño de Pedro es que el negocio prospere y que pueda obtener más ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is 29 years old. He doesn't have a high level of education, is single, and lives with his parents, whom he helps with their agricultural work.

Since he was a small boy, Pedro has been working in the fields. He earns some income from selling the harvest. In addition to this occupation, he set up a small store in order to improve the household's income.

He needs this loan to buy oil, coffee, sodas, glue, candy, packaged soups, rice, sugar, vegetables, eggs, bread, and other products with which to stock his store.

Pedro's dreams are to see his business prosper and to be able to generate more income so that he can improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy oil, coffee, sodas, glue, candy, packaged soups, rice, vegetables, eggs, bread, and the like with which to stock his store.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 30 years old and a mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the income from this vegetable shop.

The needs of his family have suddenly increased, and he does not have other income sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his inventory on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales from the vegetables. Therefore, Rabia asked for a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, who is in his mid 20s, is married with one child who is in school. He has been running three projects--a transportation business, buying goats and cows, and selling vegetables--for three years now. He works from 4:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Felix’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to service his motorcycle, and it can now move smoothly and can go a long distance without mechanical problems. He started buying and selling cows and goats, and he also started selling vegetables. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully.
