He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group, which is doing great. He used the profit to pay school fees, for loan repayment, and to cover household expenses. The loan will help him to service his motorcycle, to buy cows and goats to resell, and to increase his stock of vegetables to sell. He dreams of expanding his business.

Felix will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle, to buy cows and goats to resell, and to increase his stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene su propio taller de costura en el cual confecciona diversas prendas que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo de trecientos cincuenta mil colones (₡ 350 000), para la compra de telas para la elaboración de dichas prendas, esto con el propósito de aumentar su nivel de ventas.
texts.en: Alicia has her own sewing workshop in which she makes various clothes that she offers to her customers. She is requesting a loan of three hundred fifty thousand colones (350,000 CRC) for the purchase of fabric to produce the garments, this in order to increase her level of sales.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline used the previous loan to buy beer to sell. Out of the profits she realized, she managed to pay rent, pay her loan on time, and provide for the family. Joseline appreciates the lenders' support that has helped her have a sustainable source of income through self-employment. Her vision is to set up a standard bar in her area and even offer snacks in order to increase her clientele and profits at large. She has asked for a loan to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 47 years old but she has a spirit of a twenties lady as she is very ambitious and patient woman lives in a sector in Jordan called Rusaifeh.
She is widowed and the caring mother of six kids, her husband died in an accident many years ago and she stayed alone without any income with her children, therefore she took a 300 JD loan and use it to buy blankets then she sell it.

Aisha is working hard to provide good life for her kids; Aisha has started her own business since 2007 and now she applied for a loan to expand her business and buy large quantity of blankets and more kinds of products to sell to help her improve the standards of living for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy a large quantity of blankets.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five children. Her husband works in a private company and they are living in Ramtha. 
To help add more income to the family, Tahani opened a small mini market in her home and started to sell the products to neighbors and friends. She is now thinking of expanding her variety of products to sell and increase her income, for that she is applying for this loan.

loans.use: To expand her variety of products to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 46 year-old married woman without children. Since her childhood, she has been a productive woman. She is working in a factory with low income and her husband is working as a construction worker, also with low income.

The high standard of living led Suha to decide to open her own business to improve her life with her husband, and she started selling household supplies in her home and in her work place.
Suha wants to increase her sales. Therefore, she is applying for a loan buy more household supplies and to add new products, girls' accessories, to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more household supplies and to add new products, which are girls' accessories, to increase her income.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo is from Goris town. He is a farmer and lives with his wife and two little daughters.
Kamo currently keeps 6 calves, one pig and 16 piglets in the farm.

He decided to increase the number of cows and to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. For that he asks for this loan and hopes that this loan will have success for his farm. Kamo has already taken a loan from a financial institution in the past, but unfortunately, because of difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to make monthly payments on time. Now, with a developed farm and hard work, Kamo is sure that this loan will bring him success and he will be able to develop his farm.
Kamo has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.
Kamo expects good results.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Maria Dilcia

texts.es: Maria, tiene 41 años de edad,  reside en una aldea del municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara, cerca de Cofradía, Cortes, acompañada de su conyugue y sus 4 hijos. Maria decidió hace 4 años tener su propio  negocio para obtener ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Los productos que vende son: granos básicos, refrescos, churros, lácteos, pan, huevos, manteca, azúcar,  etc., ella quiere aumentar su clientela y ha decidido solicitar otro prestamo a ODEF el cual es el cuarto ciclo y es por 25,000 Lempiras, este lo  invertirá en la compra de mas productos de granos básicos, quesos, refrescos, churros, pan, huevos, condimentos, productos de limpieza, azúcar y otros que necesite para surtir y vender. Su meta es seguir con el negocio ya que es una fuente de ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in a village in the municipality of Petoa, Santa Barbara, close to Cofradia, Cortes. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Maria decided to start her own business 4 years ago in order to generate income and help her husband with the house expenses. She sells basic grains, sodas, churros, dairy products, bread, eggs, butter, sugar, etc.
She wants to increase her customer base and decided to request another loan from ODEF, which is the fourth one, this time for 25,000 Lempiras. She will invest it in buying more products like basic grains, cheese, sodas, churros, bread, eggs, seasonings, cleaning products, sugar and other articles she needs to stock her store. Her goal is to keep the business running because it is a source of income for the family.

loans.use: buy more products like basic grains, cheese, sodas, churros, bread, eggs, seasonings, cleaning products, sugar and other articles she needs to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the registration of  tap water installation

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber  is 23  years  old  and supports two members  of the  family.  He has run a motorcycyle  service for the last two years.  His  monthly  income is Kes1300.  He  is  taking a  loan of Kes113,500 to  buy a motorcyle  for transporting goods and customers from one place to another.  This is his first  loan from Visionfund Kenya.  He would use the anticipated profit to repay  the loan and buy spare parts.  His hope and dream for future business is to buy another motorvehicle and open  another business.

loans.use: to  buy  a motocycle  for  transporting  goods  and  customers  from  one place to another.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather. He will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more cows. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José, de 42 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, debido al alto nivel de pobreza y porque tuvo que trabajar, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, su pareja se dedica al comercio de ropa.

José, es agricultor, se acompañó hace cuatro años y su pareja ya comercializaba ropa y decidió apoyarla. 

José, necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería (ropa) para que su pareja siga con este negocio, además busca generar más ingresos y poder llevar el sustento a toda la familia. 

El sueño de José, es tener un negocio estable y que su pareja no tenga que andar arriesgándose en la calle; además sueña con tener su propia casa y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 42 years old and didn't have the chance to get an education because of extreme poverty so he needed to work instead. He is accompanied and has 2 children.
Jose is a farmer and his partner sells clothes. Since they met 4 years ago his partner has been selling clothes and he decided to support her.
Jose needs the money to buy more merchandise (clothes) so that his partner can continue with the business. He also wishes to generate more income and be able to take care of the whole family.
Jose's dream is to have a stable business so that his partner doesn't have to go work outside the house and risk herself. He also dreams of having his own house so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy merchandise (clothes).

loans.name: Reina Julia

texts.es:
Reina, de 54 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tienen 5 hijos.

Reina, necesita el dinero para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pagar mano de obra y comprar semilla para sembrar frijol y maíz, porque la primera temporada la perdieron debido a la sequía. 

Reina, con que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reina, 54 , completed the third grade. She is in a relationship. Her partner works in agriculture and they have five children.

Reina needs the money to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to buy seeds to plant beans and corn, because they missed the first season due to the drought.

Reina wants her children to go to school and learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to buy seeds to plant beans and corn.

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
maria es divorciada tiene 69 años tiene un hijo de 38 años que es casado, ella vive sola, ella es un mujer muy fuerte que desea poner un criadero de animales de corral para ganar un dinero.

El dinero necesita para comprar animales de corral y luego venderlos, los animales compra en Guaranda en la feria del domingo a buen precio, el sueño de Maria es seguir con salud para poner ver mas seguido a los nietos que tanto quiere.

en los tiempos libres le gusta cocinar.. y esperar que los nietos vayan a visitarle para cocinarles.
texts.en:
Maria is a divorced 69 year old woman with a 38 year old son who is married. She lives alone and is a strong woman who wants to raise farm animals to make some money.

She needs money to buy the farm animals and later sell them. The animals she will buy at the Sunday market at Guaranda at a good price. Maria's dream is to remain healthy so that she can see her grandchildren that she loves so dear. In her free time she likes to cook... and hope that her grandchildren will visit her so that she can cook for them.

loans.use: buy farm animals

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Essi est une femme qui vit à Agoè avec ses deux enfants à charge. Mariée, Essi se bat énormément en revendant de l’huile rouge et des tourteaux qu’elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des bidons d’huile et de tourteaux, Essi sollicite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une marge bénéficiaire afin de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Essi is 50 years old. She lives in Agoe with her two dépendent children. SEssi is married and works very hard reselling red palm oïl and animal feed cakes. She stocks up at the market twice a month and then resells in nearby neighborhoods: In order to place an order for red palm oïl and animal feed cakre; Essi is seeking this loan to pay for her merchandise and earn  a profit margin allowing her to contribute to the household budget.

loans.use: to buy 180 livestock feed cakes and 5 jugs of red palm oïl.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro integrado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras que se unieron para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose todas por poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Susana quien se dedica a hacer comidas varias, y por medio de su trabajo tiene los medios para poder dar una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella pide este préstamo para usarlo en la preparación y venta de comidas,  quiere comprar verduras, condimentos, carnes y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group is composed of very hardworking and enterprising women, who united to be able to help their loved ones. They are part of the poverty elimination program, all of them striving to be able to help their loved ones.

One of the members is Señora Susana, who makes a living preparing various meals. Through her work she has the means to provide a decent life, without privation. She is asking for this loan to use it in the preparation and sale of food. She wants to buy vegetables, condiments, meats and other supplies, and thus to proceed with her work as she has been doing. She gives thanks for the opportunity to be enabled to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals, such as: vegetables, condiments, meat and others.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a retail shop. She supplements her income with crop farming; she grows bananas and coffee to help provide for her family's needs. Her dream is to expand her shop into a wholesale store and then become a prominent business woman. Her main challenge is inadequate capital to fully stock her business and meet her customers' demands.

She requests a loan to buy more soap, bread, and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, bread, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Moumita

texts.en:
Moumita is a 31-year-old inhabitant of Khagrabari. She is married and a mother of one toddler son who is in nursery level. Her husband Ranjan runs a small sweetmeat shop in their locality for their livelihood. There is no other means of income generation for their family, and the income is barely enough to pay the educational fees of his wife Moumita for her B.Ed. education.

Moumita has completed her M.A. (Master of Arts) in English, and now she has enrolled herself in a B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) course at Merit Institute with an aim to be an efficient teacher in the future. She is a very bright student, diligent in her studies, and has big dream of becoming a respectable teacher. Her husband always supports her to achieve her goal, but his meager income is the main hindrance to bear his wife's education costs and fulfill her dream.

So, Moumita is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to pay her educational fees and buy educational materials and stationery items so that she can complete her education smoothly.

She and her husband (in the picture) are thankful to Kiva and BJS for the financial assistance.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs for her B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) training course.

loans.name: Radharani

texts.en:
Radharani is a 43-year-old woman from a small village in Kandi. She is blessed with three daughters. Two of her daughters are married, and the youngest one is a student of grade 5. In spite of being illiterate and just knowing how to sign her name, Radharani has a keen interest to give a good education to her youngest daughter.

Radharani is busy in housekeeping, while her husband is a mason. He makes foundations (centering) for houses in their rural area. The profit that comes from this work is not sufficient for them to cover their family's expenses. As this business is the only source of income for the family’s livelihood, he needs to expand his business to earn more to make ends meet. But, the main obstacle is that he lacks adequate necessary masonry tools due to lack of capital.

Radharani always takes care of her family’s well-being and so decided to give financial support to her husband by taking the loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) so that her husband can buy more necessary supplies like cluster, planks, wood, bamboo, ropes, a spade, a hammer, and other tools for making firm foundations for houses.

She hopes the family economy will improve to provide financial stability in her family and expand her husband’s masonry work as well.

She is very much obliged to Kiva and BJS, as they came into her life as a light of success.

loans.use: to purchase necessary masonry supplies for her husband’s mason work.

loans.name: Twibesheho Group

texts.fr:
Caritas fait partie du groupe Twibesheho  et  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 55 ans et est mariée à Sylvestre, un cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 15 à 36 ans, dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce de  bière de banane   depuis 30 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième    crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité  de bananes pour la  transformation en bière de banane  à vendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  construire une belle maison  et voir ses enfants etudier.
texts.en:
Caritas is a part of the Twibesheho group and lives in Gitega. She is 55 years old and is married to Sylvestre, a farmer. Together they have five children, aged from 15 to 36, 1 of whom is studying. She has been selling banana beer for 30 years. She is up to her thirteenth loan with Turame. 

With the KIVA loan she obtains, she is going to increase her funds and buy a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer that she sells in order to earn more. In the coming years, she would like to build a nice house and see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her funds and buy a large quantity of bananas to make into banana beer that she sells in order to earn more.

loans.name: Sebastian Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEBASTIAN” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roxana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de chompas, venta de perfumes, venta de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de jugos de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roxana es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá hace varios años, y con los pocos ahorros que tenía decidió emprender este negocio.

 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideo y aceite por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "AC Sebastian" is starting its third cycle in "Pro Mujer" as part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. It's made up of 8 members and directed by board where Mrs. Roxana is the President.
The businesses in which the members of the community group are involved are varied, including selling food, sweaters, perfumes, blankets, clothes, cleaning supplies, and fruit juices.
The credit requested will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Mrs. Roxana serves as a member. She mentions that she's been part of "Pro Mujer" for three years, institution she joined after an invitation from one of the members. Currently, she has business selling food. She learned the business from her mother and decided to start her own business with the few savings she had.
The loan she's now requesting is to increase her capital (buying noodles and oil wholesale) which she will get from wholesalers in the city of El Alto. After making the food items she will sell them in her selling space.
This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She lives with a partner and has 4 children. She mentions that she likes the workshops and the health benefits that "Pro Mujer" provides to its members.

loans.use: buy noodles and oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Celina Beatriz

texts.es:
Celina, de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañada, aún no tiene hijos, porque hace poco tiempo perdido el embarazo que esperaba.

Celina, junto a su pareja hace 1 año, colocaron una tienda en donde invirtieron $3000 gracias a un crédito que se les otorgo, ahora tienen el doble de dinero en inventario que cuando empezaron, luego intentaron colocar un molino, pero no resultó.

Ahora Celina, está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en su tienda y compara gaseosas, golosinas, pan, café, salsas, entre otros productos de la canasta básica, para tener lo principal y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Ella sueña con incrementar más su negocio, pero lo que más desea es tener hijos y darles lo que esté a su alcance.
texts.en:
Celina, 23 years old, attended school until the 6th grade. She is in a relationship, but does not have kids, because not long ago she miscarried.

Celina, together with her partner a year ago, put up a store thanks to a $3000 loan they were given.
Now they have twice the money in inventory as when they started. Later they wanted to start a mill but did not.

Now Celina is asking for a loan to invest in her store and buy soft drinks, cookies, bread, coffee, sauces, among other basic goods so that she can have the basics and satisfy the needs of her customers.

She dreams to expand her business, but what she wants most is to have children and provide the best to them.

loans.use: to invest in her store and buy soft drinks, cookies, bread, coffee, sauces, among other basic staples.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be proactive. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cabbages and put up a business premise. Her business goal is to have a big business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a truck for transporting cabbages. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbages and put up a business premise

loans.name: Khern's Group

texts.en: Khern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Khern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is a 34-year-old married woman from Falakata. She is a mother of two school-going children (one son and one daughter). Laxmi is illiterate but can sign her name only.

She is a dedicated homemaker, raising her children and taking care of her family. Her husband Bhajan is engaged with agricultural activities. He cultivates different seasonal crops on his farmland, and he sells the harvest products to the local markets. He chose this business because he has a good knowledge of agricultural activities.

Laxmi also assists her husband in agricultural activities. Now, with the growing needs of the family, her husband needs to increase his business. So, he has decided to cultivate teasel gourd. It is the much-demanded crop in the region.

So, Laxmi has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase necessary farm supplies like teasel gourd seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, etc. so that they have a good harvest this year. Laxmi wants to buy more farmland for the development of their business with the profit from the business.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Veuve femme de 44 ans, Essi est mère de deux enfants et vit à Adidogomé. Essi est une marchandes de friperies et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Essi réalise une bonne rentabilité avec son activité génératrice de revenu. Essi nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des jupes en vue de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: A 44 year old widow, Essi is a mother of two children and lives in Adidogomé. Essi is a seller of second-hand clothing and gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Essi makes a good profit with her income-earning activity. Essi needs this loan to buy skirts for the purpose of earning profit and to support her childrens' school education.

loans.use: to buy 90 units of skirts.

loans.name: Balmoris

texts.es:
Balmoris, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, pero solo uno estudia porque el otro está pequeño.

Balmoris, se dedica al destazo de cerdos desde hace 3 años y su pareja es quien se encarga de salir a vender la carne; hace un mes comenzó a destazar res y le pareció que era más rentable, pero requiere de más dinero por el precio de los animales. 

Balmoris, necesita el dinero para comprar ganado para destazo. 

El sueña con tener una carnicería más grande y tener su propia casa donde pueda ver crecer a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Balmoris, 41 years of age, attended school until the 6th grade. He is married with two kids, but only one attends school because the other is too young.


Balmoris, has worked as a hog butcher for over 3 yars. His wife is in charge of selling the meat; a month ago they began selling beef and it seems more cost effective. However, it requires more money because of the price of the animals.


Balmoris needs the money to buy cattle to butcher.

He dreams of having a larger butcher shop and his own home where he can watch his children grow.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher

loans.name: Kwekulakunya Kyotera Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a urban area and comprises of 5 members and these include; Prossy, Rehema, Jonan, Robert and Teo. They involve in different activities which include: food vending,bar, produce traders and farming.

Prossy is a married woman aged 35 years with 2 children attending school. She runs a small pub and also doing farming as a side business and started business in 2004 and started his business to improve on her standard of living and also increase on the family income. He acquired the loan to stock goods in form of sodas, beers and other drinks demanded by her customers. Her clients are people from nearby areas and residents. She hopes to build rentals and to expand her business.
Her challenge is limited capital and describes herself as a trust worthy and hardworking woman who appreciates the services lenders offer and encourages them to continue giving their clients financial literacy in order for them to make proper use of the loans.

loans.use: to boost her pub by stocking it with more drinks.

loans.name: Mursani

texts.en:
Mursani, 33 years old, a widow and lives with her two sons. Mursani is a housewife, however she also has a small shop where she has been selling basic foods for 5 years. She works to increase her family income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 5.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation and water sources for families. Her family income is still not enough to build a toilet and water sources by cash, but they are able to repay loans received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a toilet at their home to improve access water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a single woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells peas. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of peas. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of peas

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Junks, who can believe that there is still money in junk ? While many people find them as useless, Josefina, 58 years old, still finds them as a way to generate a living.

Since, trash is not well-managed in the country and just thrown anywhere along the sidewalks and riverbanks, street dwellers usually collect such things that are still recyclable from junk like copper, papers, plastics and metals. After collecting, their next destination is to the junk shop where they sell such for a corresponding price depending on the material. Usually, metals cost higher. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories.

However, stable income from this kind of business is hardly predictable. Sometimes, the revolving fund that the Junk Shop operators use is not enough. This is why Josefina is taking out a loan worth PHP 15,000 to add up for her current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop.

With her husband Jimmy, they are truly hopeful that someday their lives will get better and they will be able to renovate their house. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add to for her current revolving fund and to use for improving her shop.

loans.name: Nherng's Group

texts.en: Nherng’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Nherng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rajbala

texts.en:
Rajbala is 41 year old and a rural married woman who is a mother of five children (four sons and one daughter). Her four sons are associated with shuttering and carpentry work and her only daughter reads in grade seven. Her husband is a farmer by profession, involved with agriculture. They live in a small village in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar.

Rajbala works hard every day from early morning. Her family's main activity and source of income is in the planting and cultivation of paddy rice. One of the challenges, she and her husband come across in the maintenance and support of their crops is the high prices of the farm inputs. Because they are expensive, the income with which she is left is sometimes too low to maintain their household expenses.

Thus, she has applied for the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase farm supplies like paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. and to maintain the operational cost for farming. She hopes to get a better income from their business with this loan. Both Rajbala and her husband want to give a proper education to their daughter.

Her plans are to save a little more to purchase some farming land for them and she thanks her lenders very much for their help.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and to bear the oprational cost for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Leomaria Ester

texts.es: Por herencia familiar Leomaria, es una mujer que toda su vida ha estado vinculada al comercio informal,  hace 5 años tuvo la oportunidad de consolidar su propio negocio desde su lugar de residencia, una venta de pasabocas, los cuales son muy apetecidos para desayunos o meriendas por ser comida típica de la costa caribe Colombiana y todos los días a primera hora de la mañana tiene listo para la venta una gran variedad entre ellos empanadas, arepas, deditos, carmañolas y demás. Adicionalmente combina sus actividades del hogar con el comercio de enseres plásticos para el hogar: tazas, vasos, jarras, platos y ropa en general de acuerdo a los pedidos de su nutrida clientela, actividad que le genera un margen de utilidad significativo y que planea incrementar mediante la inversión de los recursos de su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con los que comprará nuevo surtido de artículos para el hogar y prendas de vestir.  Su meta es poder organizar un local comercial donde exhibir un inventario para propiciar sus ventas de tal manera que dinamice su negocio generándole mayores ingresos que mejoren su calidad de vida y poder brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
As a family legacy, Leomaria is a women who has been involved in informal commerce all her life. Five years ago she had the opportunity to fund her own business selling snacks from her place of residence. They are often craved for breakfast or lunch being traditional food of the Caribbean coast of Colombia.

Every day from the early in the morning she has a great variety ready to sell, including empanadas, arepas (corn pancakes), deditos, carmañolas and others. She also combines her household duties with the sales of plastic goods for the home like glasses, cups, pitchers, plates and clothing in general. This business generates a significant profit margin which she plans to increase through the investment of the resources from her first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy a new assortment of items for the home and clothing.

Her goal is to organize a commercial space to exhibit her inventory to raise her sales in such way as to invigorate her business generating greater income. This will improve her quality of living and allow her to provide her children with good education.

loans.use: for household items and clothing.

loans.name: Wamuka Farmers S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is called Alice. She is 45 years old and married. She runs a retail shop and also sells motorbike spare parts. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH E.A) in 2013 with an aspiration to be trained on credit management which has enabled her manage her enterprise better. Her main purpose for applying for this Kiva loan is to buy more stock to her retail shop. This will eventually lead to more sales and increased profits that will enable her be able to meet the cost of basic needs like food and clothing. 
Alice is very grateful to kiva and their lenders for the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her general retail shop, to enable her to increase sales and thus profits.

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 52 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, es madre de un hijo quien le ayuda en todo tipo de trabajo.

María aprendió a trabajar desde muy joven, ya que sus padres siempre han tenido cerdos y ganado y por lo tanto ella se dedica a lo mismo y tiene sus propios animales.


El préstamo lo solicita para comprar una vaca y dos cerdos para criarlos y luego venderlos a buen precio.
 
Su sueño es siempre criar animales para venderlos y de esta forma cubrir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Maria, 52 years old, was in school till sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. Maria is mother of a son who helps her in every kind of work. Maria learned to work when very young, since her parents always have had pigs and chicken, and thus she earns a living in the same work and has her own animals.

Maria is asking for this loan in order to buy a cow and two pigs to raise and later sell at a good price. Maria's dream is to always raise animals to sell and thus cover her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a cow and two pigs to raise and later sell at a good price.

loans.name: Maleka

texts.en:
Maleka, 50 years old, lives in a small village in Khagrabari. She is married and a mother of three children (two sons and a daughter). Maleka is illiterate and only knows how to sign her name. She manages a business of firewood and does the household chores. Her husband sells imitation jewelry in her neighborhood. Her two sons are engaged in some income-generating work. Yet the family income is not sufficient to provide a family with all the adequate needs.

Maleka's 17-year-old daughter Ambia is currently studying in grade 12 at Kalabagan High School. She is a bright and intelligent student. She is going to appear for her Higher Secondary Board Examination next year. But she is not supported by adequate educational equipment as her parents can barely afford her education costs. She worries that she will not be able to complete her studies due to the poor economic resources of her family.

Thus, her mother Maleka is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to bear the cost of her daughter's educational fees and purchase necessary study materials for grade 12. Maleka hopes that this loan will help Ambia to complete her higher secondary education with a good result.

Maleka and her daughter Ambia (as in the picture) are very much thankful to their lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to bear the education cost for her daughter's grade 12.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita lives at Mukuldanga village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is 24 years old and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Her husband is a farmer by profession. Her children are reading in different grades in a local school.

Sabita's husband strives hard from dawn to dusk on his farm land to give a better life to his family members. Sabita also supports her husband by every means. Sabita’s husband grows vegetables on his farm land and sells them at the market.

Now he decided to cultivate cauliflower as it is a nutritious crop and in much demand in the winter season. This is the best time to cultivate this crop. But they have a lack of capital to invest in their business and execute their plans.

As a responsible lady, Sabita is requesting this loan from Kiva's partner, BJS, to buy fertilizers, seeds, herbicides and necessary farm supplies. She wants to take advantage of the rainy season to obtain a good harvest with all the care and management possible to achieve her intended future earnings, which will allow her to meet the needs of the family.

Sabita thanks BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for cultivation of cauliflower.

loans.name: Jose Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, de 68 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 6 hijos pero todos son independientes. 

Ernesto, es agricultor desde hace muchos años, pero además se dedica a la compra de ganado para revender a un mejor precio, ya que es una actividad que le da muy buenos ingresos. 

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar un ternero y para invertir en la agricultura. 

Ernesto, desea seguir trabajando en sus terrenos y poder compartir su tiempo con la familia.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 68 years old and studied up to Grade 3. He is in a relationship and his partner does housework. He has six children but they are all independent.

Ernesto has been a farmer for many years but he also works buying cattle to resell at a higher price as it is an activity that creates very good income.

He will use the loan to buy a calf and invest in his farming.

Ernesto wants to continue to work on his land and be able to share his time with his family.

loans.use: to buy a calf and invest in his farming.

loans.name: Ghadir

texts.en: Ghadir is a 23 year old married woman living with her husband and only child. Her husband is the main source income children to satisfy the family needs and being able to live in a good lifestyle and as per her she is dedicated only for her family. Today, in order to pay her university fees, she is applying for a new loan. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to pay her university fees and to pursue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Saraswati

texts.en:
Saraswati, the mother of two children (one daughter and one son),lives in Khagrabari with her husband and their children. Her husband is engaged in an animal trading business.

Her son, 22-year-old Sanjay, is in the third year of his B.A (Bachelor in Arts) at B.T and Evening College and his younger sister is in grade 11. Sanjay is a moderate student going through his studies not smoothly. One of the reasons for this is that he is not provided with enough study materials and the guidance of a tutor. Saraswati and her husband give support to their son, yet they cannot fulfill all the requirements needed for his education. So Saraswati needs some financial help to give support to her son and thus, she is taking a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to pay all his educational fees and purchase educational materials for her son.

She hopes this loan will increase her son’s educational standard, so that he can complete his graduation successfully. Sanjay aims to be a teacher in the future.

Saraswati and her son Sanjay are highly obliged to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to cover her son's college education.

loans.name: Concepta

texts.en:
Concepta is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy materials for constructing a green house to enable her grow tomatoes. She hopes that in the future, she will produce farm products in large quantities. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials for constructing a green house

loans.name: Kalyani

texts.en:
Kalyani is a 42-year-old rural woman who resides in Kandi with her family. She has a family comprised of her husband and two sons. Both of her sons are associated with some income-generating work. Kalyani is illiterate (only can sign her name). She has taken a great role in improving her family's livelihood.

Kalyani's husband is a mason by profession and she is associated with a fish vending business. She has been engaged in this business for the past 12 years. She purchases varieties of fish at the wholesale rate and sells them in the local market and in her neighborhood. She has chosen this business as she knows this is a profitable business; most of the people are fond of fish in West Bengal. Now, in order to generate more income, she wants to expand her business by purchasing more varieties of fish.

Thus, she applied for a loan from Kiva via BJS. The loan amount will help her to purchase a good quality of fish. She hopes to elevate her business in the future with the profit from the business.

Kalyani is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Foirty-four-year old Mamata hails from Khagrabari. She lives with her family of three; her husband, one son and one daughter. Both the children are now students. Mamata is not only a homemaker but runs a small sewing business to earn an income for the family so that her children can smoothly carry on their studies. Her husband has a small bag retailing business.

Their daughter Tanusree is a commendable student in the second year of her B.A (Bachelor in Arts) in B.T. and Evening college. Unfortunately, the meager savings generated by her parents are not adequate to bear her educational expenses. She is a very serious and meritorious girl. Despite the adverse situation, she engages herself in her studies. Her parents try to meet their daily needs and cover the education costs of their children. Sometimes they find it very difficult to bear.

So Mamata seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to support her daughter with adequate study materials and pay for college expenses so that she can complete her graduation and can build her career in the teaching profession to help her parents financially.

Mamata and her daughter Tanusree (as in the picture) are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of graduate level studies for her elder daughter.

loans.name: 29 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “29 DE ABRIL” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Antonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de frutas, venta de colchas, venta de ropa, venta de comida, venta de muebles, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Antonia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de muebles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, con el pasar del tiempo y un pequeño capital decide implementar un negocio independiente.
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la fabricación,  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "29 de Abril" ("29th of April") will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Tejada regional center. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors where Señora Antonia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal association run are varied. Among them are: selling fruit, selling bedspreads, selling clothing, selling food, selling furniture, and selling vegetables.

The loan that they will take out will benefit these micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Señora Antonia. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining because of the invitation of a friend who is part of the institution. At this time she has a business of selling furniture. She lets it be known that she learned the business from her parents a number of years ago. With the passing of time and a little capital, she decided to set up an independent business. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase capital and buy wood wholesale, which she will acquire from the wholesale sellers in the city of El Alto and later, after the fabrication process, she will sell [her products] in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is single and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 45-year-old married woman, blessed with two sons. Minati could not continue her studies after grade 4. Her husband Upen is a farmer by profession. He does not earn sufficient income for the family, so Minati is engaged in an animal husbandry business. They live in their own house in the small village of Konamalli in Khagrabari.

Minati’s first priority is to give her sons a better education, but the family's income is a hindrance for their education. But, Minati wants to educate their children at any cost. Her younger son Susanta is a student of B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) at Panchanan Barma University. He is a meritorious boy with a vivid interest in studies. He wants to complete his graduation of the B.Ed. course with an aim to be a teacher in the future, but he does not get the necessary educational supplies and private tuition because of his parents' poor financial resources.

So, Minati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase study materials and pay educational fees for her son. She hopes it will help her son to get an uninterrupted education and reach his goal.

Minati and her son Susanta (in the picture) are thankful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to bear her son's further education in his B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) course.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.es:
Anselmo de 70 años de edad, estudió hasta 2° grado de educación, está casado y su esposa trabaja en oficios domésticos, él no tuvo hijos propios solo uno de crianza pero comenta que lo quiere como a un hijo.

Anselmo se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene toda una vida de experiencia pues realiza esta actividad desde los 6 años, en otras ocasiones trabajó en la reparación de calles, peso su fuerte es la agricultura pues es su mayor fuente de ingresos.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar abono y veneno para combatir las plagas en sus cultivos, esto le permitirá mejorar la situación de su familia pues viven por medio del cultivo.


Él solo espera que Dios le de fuerzas para seguir trabajando,
texts.en:
Anselmo, who is 70 years old, went to school through second grade. He is married and his wife does domestic work. He did not have his own children, only one whom he raised, but he comments that he loves him like a son.

Anselmo raises corn. He has a whole lifetime of experience, since he has done this work since the age of 6. At other times, he worked repairing roads, but his strength is agriculture, since it is his greatest source of income.

He needs this loan to buy compost and poisons to combat the pests in his crops. This will allow him to improve his family situation, since they live through farming.

He only hopes that God gives him the strength to continue working.

loans.use: to buy compost and poison to combat pests in his crops

loans.name: Cayetano

texts.es:
Cayetano, no asistió a la escuela, está casado y se dedica a la agricultura, su esposa no trabaja formalmente, pero se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar, tienen cuatro hijos, que viven con ellos.

Cayetano, se dedica a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, porque su padre también realizaba trabajos agrícolas; pero además de eso también tiene ganado de repasto, que lleva a vender cuando tiene buen precio.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar ganado y cerdos para destazo y comercializar la carne, porque desea trabajar en algo diferente a los trabajos agrícolas y obtener un poco más de ingresos.

En el futuro desea comprar y vender ganado para repasto.
texts.en:
Cayetano did not go to school. He is married and works in agriculture. His wife does not have a formal job but instead works doing chores in the household. They have four children who live with them.

Cayetano worked in agriculture from a very young age because his father also worked in farming jobs. Additionally, he keeps cattle on pasture lands that he sells when the price is good.

The loan will be used to buy cattle and pigs for butchering to sell the meat; he wants a job outside of farming and he also wants to achieve a slightly higher income.

In the future he wants to buy and sell pasture land cattle.

loans.use: buy cattle and pigs for butchering in order to sell the meat at market.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: Ceferino vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 15 años, tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia como: sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ceferino lives in his own home with his family members. He has operated a store from his home for 15 years. He has many clients, especially neighbors. He pays for household expenses with his earnings. He is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise including soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc., to be able to have more income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy more merchandise such as soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, pastries, etc.

loans.name: Dolores Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dolores de 28 años de edad, solo estudió hasta primer grado, es una madre soltera de dos niños los cuales viven con ella y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.


Dolores tiene un pequeño negocio donde vende pupusas y tortillas, se dedica a esto desde hace tres meses, decidió realizar esta actividad porque considera que es una buena fuente de ingresos y el negocio lo tiene a una distancia de 20 metros de su casa,  y el horario en que trabaja  es de 3:00 pm  a 6:00 pm

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar harina, maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrón, frijoles, gas entre otros para la venta de pupusas.

Los sueños son que su negocio sea grande y las ganancias aumenten, y desea esforzarse para darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dolores, who is 28 years old, only went to school through first grade. She is a single mother of two children who live with her and go to the school in the community.

Dolores has a little business where she sells pupusas [thick, filled corn tortillas] and tortillas. She has been working in this for three months. She decided to do this work because she thought that it would be a good source of  income, and the business is located at a distance of 20 meters from her house. The schedule on which she works is from 3:00 pm to 6:00 pm.

She is applying for a loan to buy flour, corn, fresh cheese, oil, fried pork rinds, beans, and gas, among other items, in order to [make and] sell pupusas.

Her dreams are that her business become big and the earnings increase, and she wants to make an effort to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, corn, fresh cheese, oil, fried pork rinds, beans, and gas, among other items, to make pupusas to sell

loans.name: Fanny Margoth

texts.es: Fanny es ama de casa y madre de dos hijos menores de edad, que a pesar de su profesión como docente, no logró ubicarse laboralmente después de su última desvinculación en esta actividad. Ella decidió apostarle al emprendimiento como fuente de ingresos para apoyar al sostenimiento de su hogar; siempre había sido amante del arte culinario y aprovechó sus conocimientos en repostería. Ofreciendo productos de gran sabor, calidad y con un toque de innovación, pudo conquistar una significativa clientela dentro de su vecindario  a quienes les ofrece postre de tres leches, napoleón, brownies, turrones, dulces y demás recetas caseras. Fanny aprovecha su relación con los clientes para ofrecer otros productos como ropa, calzado y productos para el hogar, que poco a poco han ido incrementando su cartera. En la actualidad su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente para atender la demanda de sus clientes, por lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en insumos de repostería, como crema, maní, esencias, entre otros  y ropa, calzado y productos de hogar requerido por su clientela. Su sueño de prosperidad es tener casa propia y mejorar la imagen de su negocio.
texts.en:
Fanny is a housewife and mother of two young children. In spite of her profession as a teacher, she wasn’t able to find a work position after her latest break from this occupation. She decided to bet on entrepreneurship as a source of income to contribute to the maintenance of her home. She had always been a lover of the culinary arts and took advantage of her knowledge in baking. Offering products of great taste, quality, and with a touch of innovation, she managed to acquire a significant number of clients in her neighborhood, to whom she offers desserts of three milks, napoleons, brownies, nougat, candies, and more homemade recipes. 
Fanny makes the most of her relationship with her clients by also offering other products like clothing, footwear, and home products, which little by little have increased her wallet. Currently, her work capital is insufficient to meet the demand of her clients, which is why she is processing her first credikiva with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to use these resources to invest in baking supplies, like cream, peanuts, essences, among other, and clothing, shoes, and home products required by her clients. Her dream of prosperity is to own her own house and improve the image of her business.

loans.use: to invest in baking supplies, like cream, peanuts, essences, among other, and clothing, footwear, and home products required by her clients.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor, de 28 años de edad, está estudiando su último año de la carrera Ingeniería Agronómica en la universidad, está casado y su esposa es maestra de estilista, actualmente no tienen hijos y solo ellos dos viven en casa. 

Víctor, desde hace dos años tiene un pequeño comedor afuera de la Universidad de donde estudia y aprovecho la oportunidad, porque los estudiantes de agronomía tenían que ir hacia las otras áreas para encontrar comida, ya que no existe cafetín en su área, su madre es quien vende cuando él está en clases, ellos venden desayunos y almuerzos en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m. de Lunes a Viernes. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos para el negocio, por ejemplo bebidas, jugos, agua, y alimentos para preparar los desayunos y almuerzos, además desea comprar láminas para cubrirse del sol.

Su sueño es terminar la carrera y graduarse como ingeniero agrónomo,  además desea obtener el permiso para poder construir su cafetín adentro de la universidad.
texts.en:
Victor, 28 years old, is in his final year of university, studying for a degree in agricultural engineering. He is married and his wife is a hairdressing instructor. They do not currently have children and just the two of them live at home. For the past two years, Victor has had a small eatery outside of the university where he studies. He took advantage of the opportunity because the agricultural students had to go to other areas to find food since there is no cafeteria in their area.

His mother sells while he is in class. They sell breakfast and lunches on a schedule from 6 a.m. until 1 p.m. from Monday through Friday.

He needs the loan to buy supplies for his business such as beverages, juices and water and food for preparing breakfast and lunch. Additionally, he wishes to buy sheet metal to shade himself from the sun. His dream is to finish his degree and graduate as an agricultural engineer. Additionally, he hopes to obtain a permit in order to build a cafeteria inside the university.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the business such as beverages, juices and water and food for preparing breakfast and lunch. Additionally, he wishes to buy sheet metal to shade himself from the sun.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh is a 43-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and four children in Wihdat. Her husband was retired, but now he is working as a taxi driver with low income.

Amneh started her business with a low quantity of household products and small pieces of furniture to sell. She and her husband run the business, and the problem that they face is high cost and seasonal production. Amneh is applying for a loan to buy household products to sell, which will increase her income and help her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy household products to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 26-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two children (a son and a daughter). Both of them are students in different grades. Her husband is a vegetable grower. They live in Falakata in West Bengal, India.

Her husband cultivates seasonal vegetables on their farmland. Anita is a homemaker and also helps her husband with the farming. They usually sell the produce in the local market. Now they decided to cultivate cauliflower because this is a very in-demand crop in this season. Also, the climate of this region is perfect for cauliflower cultivation. But they need capital to invest in this farming.

So to help her husband, she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. This will allow her to cultivate cauliflower, which is a crop in great demand in the market in this season, and increase their monthly turnover. This way, she can increase the profitability of their business and ensure her financial stability so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

She conveys her hearty thanks to the lenders for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema lives in a small village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is a 29-year-old, hardworking mother of two children (a son and a daughter). She is a homemaker. Her husband's occupation is farming and he works hard to meet the family's needs. Fatema knows the value of education, so she wants to provide better education to her children.

Fatema's husband cultivates beans, gourds, cabbages, peas, and other seasonal vegetables to sustain his family. Fatema also helps her husband with the cultivation during busy seasons. The crops they grow are sold in the market, which is the main source of their income that is spent in buying household requirements and payment of other fees.

Now they want to grow cauliflower, which is fully a winter crop. They want to get a huge profit from the cultivation of this crop in the forthcoming winter season. So she wants to buy good quality farm supplies but she has no capital.

So she applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS. The loan money will be used to purchase necessary agricultural inputs like seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. for cauliflower cultivation.

She is thankful to her lenders for their help.

loans.use: To pay for agricultural inputs for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Mayarani

texts.en:
Mayarani is a 28-year-old housewife and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She lives with her family in their own small house in a small village in Falakata in the district of Alipurduar. Her elder son and daughter go to a nearby school and her younger son is a preschooler.

Mayarani’s husband is a farmer who grows seasonal vegetables on their own farmland. They have inadequate capital to successfully carry out the business activity and inadequate finances to educate their children and provide them with other basic necessities. The income from the agricultural activities is hardly sufficient for maintaining all the expenses of a five-member family. So, they have decided to cultivate cauliflower on their farmland. They have chosen this crop, as it has a very good market demand and thus, Mayarani has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in their business.

She will use the loan amount to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other necessary resources for growing cauliflower on their own field. With the additional income from this business, she will be able to fulfill the basic necessities of her family and give a good education to her children. In the future, she dreams of buying more farmland with the profit from her business.

She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary farm resources for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica  a la crianza de pollos desde hace 3 años, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de concentrado para los pollos ya que le ve muy bien con las ventas y asi poder generar buenas ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana, 33, lives in her own house with her family group. She has been raising chickens for 3 years; she markets her products around the area. She is again applying for a loan to buy chicken feed, since it’s going very well for her with the sales and she may thus be able to generate good profits and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Ajita

texts.en:
Ajita is 29 years old and married to Jiyarul. They are blessed with two sons. She is a housewife and in her childhood, she could not get enough opportunity for study, so she ended her education at grade four. They live in the small village of Mukuldanga in Falakata.

The main income for the family comes from agriculture. Ajita's husband, 29-year-old Jiyarul, is engaged in an agribusiness. He grows seasonal vegetables and fruits, which he sells to his regular customers in the local market. He has good experience in agriculture but his monthly income from this business is too scant to cover the household costs. He now wants to cultivate cauliflower on his farmland. Cauliflower has a good market all over West Bengal, especially in the winter season.

In order to yield a good harvest, Ajita applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to buy good fertilizers and seeds for starting the cultivation. She wants to increase her income and provide her family with a good life.

She is grateful for her generous lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Marie

texts.es:
Marie tiene 44 años de edad, solo estudió hasta noveno grado, está casada y su pareja se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura, tiene una hija que está estudiando bachillerato y depende de Marie y su esposo.

Marie se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura, en esta segunda actividad ya tienen 18 años de realizarla, pues les gusta mucho trabajar en el campo.

Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar productos necesarios para la agricultura como lo son los fertilizantes, abono y venenos.

Ella sueña con sacar adelante a su hija y que sea una excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Marie is 44 years old, she only studied up to the ninth grade, she is married and her spouse works in agriculture. She has a daughter who is in high school and is dependent on Marie and her husband. Marie is a homemaker and also together with her husband works in agriculture. They have already spent 18 years in this second activity, because they very much like working in the field.

She is requesting this loan to buy products needed for agriculture such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides. She dreams of getting her daughter ahead and that she become an excellent professional.

loans.use: buy products needed for agriculture such as fertilizers, manure and pesticides.

loans.name: Wendkogoonda Group

texts.fr:
Karadiam, âgée de 43 ans est mariée mère de 3 enfants.

Restauratrice depuis 02 ans dans le riz et du spaguetti. 

Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est que son lieu de commerce est situé a coté d’un marché d’où il ya beaucoup d’affluent, elle aime la propriété dans son lieu de commerce et aussi respect ses clients.

Elle veut le prêt pour acheter le riz de 2 sacs de 50 kg et l’huile de trois bidons de 20 litres.
L’utilité du prêt c’est de pouvoir renforcer son activité.
 
Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser aux dates prévues.
texts.en:
Karadiam is a 43-year-old married mother of three children, and for the past two years has been a caterer of rice and spaghetti.

What makes her business prosper is its location next to a crowded market. She loves cleanliness in her place of business and also shows respect for her customers.

She wants the loan to buy two 50-kilo bags of rice and three 20-liter containers [of oil]. The loan will be useful in strengthening her business.

She has already received a loan and repaid it on schedule.

loans.use: buy two 50-kilo bags of rice and three 20-liter containers of culinary oil for 175,000 CFA francs

loans.name: Sahera

texts.en:
Sahera is from the village of Mukuldanga in Falakata, West Bengal. Her family consists of her husband only, she doesn’t have any kids. She is a 30-year-old housewife who is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Sahera’s husband is involved in farming. He grows vegetables and sells the produce in the local market. She also helps her husband in his field work. The low income of her husband is not enough to meet the basic needs of their family. This is the only source of income for them. Thus, they can somehow manage household expenses.

As life gets more expensive day by day, Sahera and her husband want to increase their income. They want to cultivate cauliflower, which is a popular and in-demand vegetable all over West Bengal, especially in the winter season. So Sahera is seeking a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

She hopes she will earn more and be able to run her family smoothly with the increased income. She wants to give her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can upgrade their living standard.

Sahera is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr: Aïcha est une femme mariée avec un enfant à charge. Agée de 33 ans, Aïcha habite à Agoè où elle exerce ses activités. Aïcha est une revendeuse de friperies de quartier en quartier qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Aïcha sollicite ce crédit pour commander la balle de friperies. Grâce à la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Aïcha compte accroitre son commerce et de répondre favorablement  aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Aïcha is thirty-three years old, married and has one child. She lives and works in Agoè. She sells second-hand clothing around several areas, and buys new supplies four times a month from the market.

Aïcha has requested this loan to order a bundle of second-hand clothing. Thanks to the profit that she will make, she expects to be able to expand her business and respond better to the expectations of her customers.

loans.use: to buy 1 bundle of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée, Akouvi est femme de 38 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Agoè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins des enfants, Akouvi prépare et vend de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchoukoudou» à la devanture de son domicile. Akouvi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Akouvi désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil afin de maximiser son profit et aider son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants et favoriser ainsi leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Akouvi is thirty-eight years old, married and has two children in her care. They live in Agoè. In order to earn a living and support her children, Akouvi makes and sells 'Tchoukoudou' (a local, alcoholic drink) from the front of her home.

Akouvi buys her supplies twice a month from the market and makes a good living from her business. She has requested this loan to order sacks of millet to increase her profits. These will be used to help her husband provide for their children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of millet.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est âgée de 40 ans et est une femme mariée. Ayawa vit avec ses cinq enfants et à Adidogomé où elle prépare de la bouillie faite à base du mil accompagné et des beignets et des gâteaux pour ses consommateurs qui trouvent satisfaction dans son activité. Ayawa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire commander le sac de mil et des sacs de farine de blé afin de gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour ainsi promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants et bien réorganiser son activité.
texts.en:
Ayawa is forty years old, married and lives with her five children in Adidogomé. She prepares and sells millet porridge accompanied by fritters and cakes for her satisfied customers.

Ayawa buys her supplies once a month from the market. She would like to order the sack of millet and the sacks of wheatflour to increase her profit. This will then be used to support her children's education and reorganise her business more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of millet and 2 sacks of wheatflour.

loans.name: Adalberto

texts.es: Adalberto de 37 años, desde muy joven emprendió su idea empresarial en las calles del barrio que lo vio crecer al sur de Barranquilla y con un espíritu especial que ha cultivado y fortalecido con los años, logró que su actividad comercial hoy en día le permita obtener un ingreso digno para sostener a su familia. Él combina varias actividades: tiene una moto que utiliza para prestar el servicio de transporte de los transeúntes del barrio, en su casa con el apoyo de su cónyuge ofrece la venta del servicio de llamadas telefónicas y ha consolidado una cartera significativa con los clientes a quieres le ofrece ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar con el fin de ampliar la cobertura de su negocio con nuevos clientes. La meta de Adalberto es que su negocio continúe en crecimiento y le genere ingresos adicionales para mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda de habitación.
texts.en:
Adalberto, 37, started his business when he was very young on the streets of the neighborhood where he grew up south of Barranquilla. And with a special spirit that he has cultivated and strengthened over the years, he succeeded in getting his business to where it nowadays allows him to obtain a decent income to support his family.

He combines several occupations: he has a motorcycle that he uses to provide transport service to pedestrians in the neighborhood, at home with the help of his spouse he sells telephone service, and he has established a significant portfolio of clients to whom he offers clothing, shoes and household items.

He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo (Mario Santo Domingo Foundation), funds which he plans to invest resources in clothing, shoes and household items in order to expand the range of his business with new customers. Adalberto's goal is that his business continue to grow and that it generate additional income to improve his quality of life and improve the house in which he lives.

loans.use: invest in clothing, shoes and household items.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme divorcée de 50 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Mère d’un enfant, Afi est une marchande de pagnes qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des pagnes de haute qualité, Afi demande ce prêt afin d’acquérir un grand nombre de stock et par suite une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de soutenir sa famille et permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à son enfant
texts.en:
Afi is fifty years old, divorced and has one child. They live in Adidogomé and she sells pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing). She buys her stock twice a month from the market and sells them from her shop at home and in the surrounding areas.

Afi has requested this loan to order high quality pagnes to build up her stock levels. This will help her earn a good profit and be able to support her family and pay for a good education for her child.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing).

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Agée de 29 ans, Adzo est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec un seul enfant à charge. Adzo est une marchande des produits l’électricité et de plomberie qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique qu’elle a louée. Adzo nécessite ce prêt pour commander des cartons d’ampoules  en vue de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et pouvoir gagner plus de bénéfices afin de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en:
Adzo is twenty-nine years old, married and has one child in her care. She lives in Adidogomé and sells electrical and plumbing goods. She buys her stock three times a month from the market and sells it from a shop which she rents.

Adzo has requested this loan to order boxes of light bulbs to meet the demands of her customers and improve her earnings. This will enable her to take good care of her child.

loans.use: to buy 3 boxes of light bulbs.

loans.name: Farija

texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Farija is a rural woman from the small village of Mukuldanga in Falakata. She is a mother of three children (two daughters and a son). All her children are students in different grades.

Farija is married to Mojammel who is a farmer by profession. She also assists her husband after completing her household chores. Her husband cultivates vegetables and crops, and then sells most of the harvest in the local market at a low price. This is their sole source of income for their livelihood. But the income is barely enough to cover all the household expenses along with the educational expenses of their children. So, to earn more, they have decided to cultivate cauliflower on their farmland because of its high nutritional value. They have chosen this because it is one of the year round vegetables, grows well in the winter season and is in great demand in their locality. To get a good harvest, Fariza seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).
