She will purchase good quality seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and other farm resources for cauliflower cultivation. She hopes she will earn more profit by selling cauliflower in her local market and satisfy her valuable customers as well.

She is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm resources for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Salina is a widowed woman with 2 children.

She operates a retail business where she makes dresses and also sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics and tailoring materials. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics and tailoring materials

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Adzo est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec sa famille. Adzo est une couturière qui vend aussi les trousseaux bébé et qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Adzo revend ses marchandises à domicile et en distribuant en gros ses clients potentiels. Adzo sollicite ce prêt pour commander des rouleaux de popelines afin de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire et pouvoir faire face à ses besoins quotidiens et celui de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adzo is single and has no children. She lives in Adidogomé with her family and is a seamstress. She sells outfits for babies and buys her supplies twice a month from the market. She sells her clothes from her home and to various wholesale clients.

Adzo has requested this loan to order rolls of poplin fabric to increase her profits and provide for her day-to-day needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy 24 rolls of poplin fabric.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 30-year-old woman from Falakata. She lives with her husband Naresh and their two children. Her son reads in grade six and her daughter is in grade five in a local school. Anita attended school up to fifth grade but due to her parental monetary problems, she could not continue her education. But she has a great desire to provide an uninterrupted education to her children.

Anita's husband is a farmer who cultivates vegetables and other crops in their own plot of land and sells them to the market. Now Anita and her husband decided to cultivate cauliflower in their farmland, as it is a profitable crop in the region. So, she thinks this will be a lucrative business because in winter season, it is a crop that is in much demand.

Anita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies to cultivate cauliflower. She is very hopeful to earn profit from this cultivation, which will help her to reach her goal of purchasing more farming land.

Anita is thankful for her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies to cultivate cauliflower.

loans.name: Tanuja

texts.en:
Tanuja is a 31-year-old married woman. Her family is comprised of her husband Jebed, one son and two daughters. Her children read in different grades in a local village school. She lives wih her family in a small village named Mukuldanga in Falakata, West Bengal.

Her husband is engaged in an agribusiness. He grows a variety of seasonal crops on his farmland and sells the harvested produce in the market. He works hard dawn to dust in his fields to achieve a good harvest and profit. This business is the sole source of income for the family.

Thus, Tanuja and her husband want to increase their business. For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s field partner). Now they plan to cultivate cauliflower for the upcoming winter season. She will use the loan amount to buy better quality cauliflower seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. They hope to have a good harvest from this investment.

With the profit money, she wants to fulfil her dream of constructing a concrete house for them.
Tanuja is very happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and BJS for this kind support.

loans.use: to purchase necessary farm supplies for cauliflower cultivation.

loans.name: Nawanounadjete

texts.fr: Nawanounadjete est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè avec quatre enfants à charge. Nawanounadjete est âgée de 37 ans et est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Nawanounadjete  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des petits et moyens sacs de charbon de bois  afin réaliser des recettes et pouvoir faire face aux charges de la famille et préparer la scolarité de ses enfants pour la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Nawanounadjete is a married woman who resides in Agoè with four children. She is 37 years old and is a charcoal retailer who resupplies twice a month at the market and sells in front of her home.

Nawanounadjete is requesting this loan to finance the order of small and medium bags of charcoal, to achieve profits, cope with family expenses, and prepare for next year's schooling of her children.

loans.use: buy 14 medium-size bags of charcoal and 23 small bags of charcoal

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-D Group

texts.en: Saraswati, the lady standing on the left in the picture, is 59 years old and living with her husband, parent-in-laws and children. Three years ago, her husband met with an accident and lost his vision. That was a very hard time for her because the entire family burden came on her. In those days, she had two cows so she managed to cover her family expenses by selling milk, but that was not sufficient. After one year, she purchased another cow to earn more money as her children's study expenses were increasing. Now she wants to purchase another jersey cow so that she can sell still more milk and milk products. She said, "If I get a jersey cow, I can sell more milk so I can spend more money on my children's studies." She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion for purchasing a jersey cow. She wants her children to graduate from a good college, and she needs to save some money for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to purchase a jersey cow

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is aged 46 and lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a motorbike shop in which he sells motorbikes from different companies. He buys new motorbikes from different manufacturing companies and sells them through his shop. He has been selling Honda, Pak Hero, Metro, Eagle and Suzuki motorbikes.

Now he wants to purchase some more new bikes, but his major problem is the lack of the lump sum amount. Therefore Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy more motorbikes to resell.

Farzana is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the number of motorbikes for sale in her husband's motorbike shop.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg-E Group

texts.en:
The "Maa Durga SHG-E" is a group made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They both live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and do some crop cultivation.

Sandhya is the lady in the picture standing first from the right. She is the featured borrower of the group. She is 41 years old and is the single mother of two children. She sells seasonal fruits and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than six years. She sells fresh fruits like oranges, apples, bananas, pineapples, and guavas.

Sandhya, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. With her new loan, Sandhya plans to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell. With her profits, she plans to increase her savings to better establish her business.

Sandhya and her group member are very happy for this loan and thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits in bulk to resell.

loans.name: Aninan

texts.fr: Aninam est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec un enfant à charge. Aninam est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Aninam nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leur enfant.
texts.en:
Aninam is a married woman, with one child in her care and lives in Adidogomé. She sells charcoal which she buys three times a month from the market and sells from her home.

Aninam has requested this loan to order sacks of charcoal to increase her earnings. She would like to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family and pay for a good education for their child.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with 8 children. She describes herself as patient.

She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy materials to enable her to construct a greenhouse for growing tomatoes.

Her business goal is to expand her farm over the next 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials to enable her to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Nadège

texts.fr: Nadège est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè et âgée de 37 avec quatre enfants à charge. Nadège est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux  fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Nadège nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois de petits et de grands modèles afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Nadège is a 37-year-old married woman who resides in Agoè with four children. She is a charcoal retailer who resupplies twice monthly at the market and resells from her home.

Nadège is requesting this loan to finance the purchase of small and larger bags of charcoal, to achieve more profits, support her husband with family expenses, and ensure a good education for their children.

loans.use: buy 10 medium-size and 8 small bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is 47 years old. She is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer, and she manages agriculture well. Her farm is not very fertile and the income from it is not big, but due to Tsioala's care and hard work it yields income for her family.

Tsiala has a big family of 7 - her husband, sons, daughter, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her family members also try to help Tsiala around their farm.

The loan Tsiala is asking for will be used to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, seeds, forage for the livestock and two oxen.

As this is Tsiala's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Tsiala will be very thankful to receive this loan.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer, seeds, forage for the livestock and two oxen.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man who describes himself as determined.

He operates a farm where he keeps cows and also grows crops. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a good place and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more cows. His business goal is to expand his farm over the next 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cows

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Doña Ana se desempeña en su puesto de venta de comidas y bebidas. Ella solicita un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (₡ 570 000), para la compra de alimentos para la elaboración de dichas comidas, con este préstamo ella podrá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Doña Ana works in her stall selling meals and beverages. She requests a loan of five hundred and seventy thousand colones (₡ 570,000) [$1,075 USD] to buy food to prepare these meals. With this loan she will be able to offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: buy food to prepare meals.

loans.name: Ayichetou

texts.fr: Ayichetou est une veuve femme de 33 ans qui habite à Agoè. Mère d’un enfant, Ayichetou est une marchande des céréales et des tubercules d’ignames qu’elle achète deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des sacs de maïs, Ayichetou nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et mieux couvrir les frais scolaire de son enfants dès la rentrée prochaine.
texts.en:
Ayichetou is a 33-year-old widow who lives in Agoè. Mother of one child, Ayichetou is a merchant of grains and yam tubers she buys twice a month at the market, to be resold from her homefront to generate income.

Ayichetou is requesting the loan to finance the restocking of her supplies, so she can achieve good profit margins, provide for her family, and better deal with her children's tuition fees in September.

loans.use: buy four bags of maize

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de pollos desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de pollos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en:
Elena is 55 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her son.

Elena has been making a living selling chickens for 15 years. Her business is in her house and she has many customers because of the good prices she offers.

Elena is applying for another loan in order to buy chickens in bulk and continue with sales. She can thus earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life with her son.

loans.use: to buy chickens in bulk.

loans.name: Xiomara Karina

texts.es:
Xiomara de 32 años de edad, tiene un niño de 8 años que estudia en la escuela de la comunidad, está casada desde hace 9 años y su esposo es albañil. 

Xiomara trabaja desde hace ya cuatro años en un negocio de venta de tortillas de maíz, las cuales comercializa en la comunidad y por encargos, también se dedica a trabajar en la casas, y por las tardes cuando sale se dedica a cuidar de la familia y su esposo trabaja todos los días de la semana en diferentes labores.
 
Ella solicita este crédito para comprar dos sacos de maíz para la elaboración y venta de tortillas.

Ella sueña con un día tener su propia casa donde vivir con su familia y está en sus planes apoyar a su hijo mientras pueda en los estudios para que cuando crezca sea una persona de bien para la sociedad y pueda el ya trabajar en un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Xiomara is 32 years old. She has an eight-year-old son who attends the local school. Xiomara has been married for nine years; her husband is a builder.

Xiomara has been working for four years at her business selling corn tortillas. She sells the tortillas in the community and takes orders. Xiomara also works in houses. In the afternoons, after work, she looks after her family. Xiomara's husband works every day in different jobs.

Xiomara is applying for this loan in order to buy two bags of corn to produce and sell tortillas.

Xiomara dreams of one day owning a house where she can live with her family. She also plans to support her son's education for as long as she can. This will allow him to grow up to be useful for society, and will allow him to find a decent job.

loans.use: to buy two bags of corn to produce and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Ciany

texts.es: Ciany es una joven muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (₡570 000), para la compra de mercadería que le permita ofrecer más variedad de prendas a sus clientes y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Ciany is a very hard-working young woman who makes a living selling clothes.

She is applying for a loan of 570,000 Colones in order to buy merchandise, allowing her to offer more clothing items to customers. She can thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell clothes.

loans.name: Cthérine

texts.fr: Catherine est une femme mariée âgée de 50 ans qui a cinq enfants à charge. Résidant à Agoè, Catherine est une revendeuse ambulante des sachets plastiques. Catherine s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché. Catherine sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des douzaines de sachets afin d’en tirer un maximum de profit pour pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Catherine is a 50-year-old married woman with five children. Living in Agoè, Catherine is an itinerant retailer of plastic bags.

Catherine resupplies five times a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to buy dozens of plastic bags so she can derive maximum profits in order to provide for her children.

loans.use: buy 17 dozen plastic bags

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Аваз мужчина 38 лет. Он живёт вместе с женой и  3 детьми  в собственном доме   в кишлаке Яхтан.  У него среднее образование, почти что с детства  занимается откормом скота. Аваз занимается животноводством  и земледелием.  Он очень стремительный и трудолюбивый .У него в стаде 2 коровы и 4 барана. Также Аваз подрабатывает мастером. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Авазу в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Аваз хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Аваз очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Avaz is 38 years old.  He lives with his wife and three children in his own house in a small village called Yakhtan.  He has a secondary education and he has been involved in fattening cattle literally since childhood.  He now works in animal husbandry and agriculture.  Avaz is very dynamic and hardworking.  He currently owns two cows and four sheep.  He also makes extra money working as a handyman, an activity from which he derives a good salary.  His wife helps him around the farm; she sells the milk they get from their livestock.

Avaz wants to increase the size of his herd and expand his business.  For this reason, he has turned to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, to get a loan which will help him to buy a cow.  He is looking very forward to a positive outcome, and he thanks MDO Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохиста молодая девушка в возрасте 29 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Она замужем и у нее 2 детей. Шохиста занимается бизнесом на местном колхозном рынке. Она продает материалы для пошива. Этим бизнесом она начала заниматься после окончания школу. Огромную помощь в открытии своего бизнеса ей оказала мама. Она научила ее многому, как правильно выбирать и покупать товар, как обращаться с покупателями.  Постепенно Шохиста  смогла расширить свой товарооборот и увеличить прибыль. Муж Шохисты работает водителем маршрутного такси и в свободное время помогает жене в бизнесе. Бизнес Шохисты является основным источником дохода для ее семьи. На данный момент у Шохисты возникли финансовые трудности для закупки товара. С этой проблемой Шохиста решила обратится в «АРВАНД» за поддержкой. На полученные деньги она хочет закупить товар.
texts.en:
Shohista, age 29, is a young woman who lives in a rural area.  She is married and the mother of two children.  She is involved in retail business at the local market and she sells sewing supplies.  With her mom's help, she got involved in this business right after she finished school.  Her mom taught her a lot; she showed her how to select and buy merchandise and how to interact with customers.  Gradually, Shohista was able to increase her merchandise turnover and her income.

Shohista's husband works as a taxi driver and, during his spare time, he also helps his wife with her own business.  Shohista's business constitutes the main source of income for the family.  At the moment, Shohista is experiencing some financial difficulties and she cannot buy merchandise.  For this reason, she has decided to turn to Kiva's field partner, MDO Arvand, for support.  She intends to use her loan to buy some merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and increase her turnover.

loans.name: Sebjamol

texts.ru:
Себжамол из района Шахритус.  Шахритусе хорошая погода для развития сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Все жители района занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Некоторые выращивает скота и некоторые выращивает растения.  Себжамол выбрала растениеводство, потому что ее родители тоже занимались этой деятельности.  Она много времени проводит на земле. У нее имеется 6 Га земельный участок. 
Себжамол замужем и мать двоих детей. Сыновьям 28 и 25 лет. Они семейные парни. Растениеводство является семейной деятельности. Себжамол помогает муж и невестки. Она готовила почву к новому посеву урожай, и ей нужно минеральные удобрения для обработки и семян лук для посадки. С такими планами Себжамол обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Она верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Sebjamol comes from the Shahrituz district of Tajikistan.  This particular district enjoys a beautiful climate which is favorable to crop farming.  All the residents of the district are involved in farming; some raise cattle while others grow crops.  Like her parents before her, Sebjamol chose to grow crops. As she owns six hectares of land, she spends a lot of time in her fields.

Sebjamol is married and the mother of two sons who are now 28 and 25 years old and have their own families.  Agriculture is a family business.  Sebjamol's husband her daughters-in-law also work on the farm.  Sebjamol has just prepared her soil toward the next planting season but she still needs to  buy mineral fertilizers and onion seeds.  With this goal in mind, she is turning to you for a loan.  She confidently relies on you and on your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and onion seeds.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENACER” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de condimentos, carnicería, venta de mantas, venta de mantas, venta de hamburguesas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne de res; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace más de catorce años y lo aprendió de su mamá.  

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá del matadero Municipal de la ciudad de  El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Renacer" ("Rebirth") communal bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer at one of the regional offices in Alto Lima. It is made up of eight members and it is led by a board of directors with Modesta as the President. The members of the community bank carry out a variety of businesses, including: food sales, condiments sales, butchers, blanket sales and hamburger sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small microentrepreneurs, such as Modesta. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer by invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently she has a business selling beef; she says that she started this business more than fourteen years ago and she learned it from her mother.

This loan will be used to increase capital to buy meat wholesale that she will get from the town slaughterhouse in the city of El Alto, which she will subsequently sell in her retail space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is married and has four children.

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale meat.

loans.name: Armida Ruth

texts.es: Armida de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y actualmente a la venta de frutas, su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa, tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito pero esta vez para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Armida is 42 years old and lives in her own house with her son. She makes a living selling clothing and now fruits. Her business is located near her house and she has been doing the job for several years. With the earnings that she gets, she manages to resolve some household expenses. She is asking for a new loan, this time to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesale prices to continue with her work and be able to have a better income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Perlas Doradas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PERLAS DORADAS” iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de internet, venta de carne de pollo, venta de artículos para el hogar en plástico, venta de productos de belleza, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chompas; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace más de treinta años, por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación  y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Perlas Doradas (Golden Pearls)" loan group will begin its 13th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Tejada. It is composed of eight members and is directed by a board where Elena is the president. The businesses that the community association members carry out are varied, and between then there is: internet service, selling chicken, selling plastic home goods, selling beauty products, selling food, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Elena is a member. She says that it has been seven years since she joined Pro Mujer, via an invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling sweaters. She started this business more than 30 years ago, on her own initiative. The loan that she will take out is to get more money from buying wool at wholesale prices from the vendors in the city of El Alto, and then after the preparation, she will sell it in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the health area that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials and university books.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia está estudiando el segundo año de la carrera de contabilidad, sus padres son  personas muy luchadoras que siempre han sido su mayor sostén, en 5 años se ve como profesional y como gerente de la empresa donde actualmente trabaja.
Ella es una mujer muy luchadora, que estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo, lo cual según comenta es algo muy difícil, pero que hace para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y comprar materiales de estudios.
texts.en: Julia is in her second year studying Accounting. Her parents are very determined people who have always been her biggest support. In 5 years, she sees herself as a professional and as the manager of the business where she currently works. She is a very tenacious woman who studies and works at the same time, which she says is very difficult, but she does it to be able to be someone in life. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her degree fees and buy study materials.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees and buy study materials.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, continua con sus estudios de la carrera de Derecho, es una persona muy buena, que se esta esforzando para poder mejorar su vida a través de sus estudios, pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder pagar su matricula, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
Ella pide este nuevo préstamo para el pago de su matricula y de las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en: Sandra is from the city of San Lorenzo. She is continuing with her studies in Law. She is a very good person who is striving to be able to improve her life through her studies. She gives her best effort to be able to get ahead and be someone in life. She says that her previous loan was used to pay for her tuition and continue studying. She is asking for this new loan to pay her tuition and degree fees.

loans.use: to pay tuition and her degree fees.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMANUEL” iniciará el trigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lucia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de detergentes, venta de frutas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lucia es integrante, ella indica que hace más de quince años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió  hace varios años, por iniciativa propia ya que en ese tiempo, estaba atravesando por una necesidad económica, a esa necesidad es que decide emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de dulces por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Emanuel" loan group will begin its 36th cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal of Panamericana. It is composed of nine members and is directed by a board where Lucia is president. The businesses that the members of the community association carry out are varied, and between them there is: selling clothing, selling sweets, selling blankets, selling detergents, selling fruits, and selling food.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small micro businesses where Lucia is a member. She says that it has been more than 15 years since she joined Pro Mujer. She joined from a invitation from a friend who is a customer of the institution.

Currently, she has a business selling sweets. She learned this business many years ago through her own initiative, because in that time, she was nearing an economic need and from that need she decided to start this business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her income by buying sweets at wholesale prices, which she will get from the venders in the city of El Alto, and afterwards she will sell them in her stall.

This form of work allows her to get resources to support her family economically, because she is married and has three children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the health area and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy sweets at wholesale price.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
Monica es estudiante de la carrera de Marketing, cursa actualmente el segundo, vive con sus padres, ella desea terminar su carrera para desempeñarse como profesional, para mejorar sus ingresos tanto de ella como de su familia.
De aquí a cierto tiempo se ve ejerciendo su profesión para poder ayudar a las personas que ella quiere.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en: Monica is a Marketing student. She is currently in her second year and lives with her parents. She wants to finish her degree to start work as a professional, in order to improve her income not only for herself but for her family as well. Between now and that time, she is practicing her profession to be able to help the people that she loves. She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her college fees.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Prem

texts.en:
Prem, 42, is a lovable and a kind-hearted lady from a small village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She has a family comprising her husband, who is a mason, and three daughters, who are continuing their studies.

Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. The women and girls, seeking privacy, often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves. The family, especially the women and daughters, are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.

Seeking to improve her situation, Prem is requesting for a loan of INR 15,000 to build toilet in her home. Your loan will help her family access basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

loans.use: to build toilet in her home.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo actualmente está trabajando en una casa comercial de pintura, estudia la carrera de enfermería, está el último año de la carrera, su principal objetivo es seguir trabajando y trabajar en su profesión.
Él es una persona que se está esforzando para poder ser un profesional y el día de mañana ayudar a las personas por medio de su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, y así continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alfredo currently working at a paint producer and is studying to become a nurse. He is in his last year of his program, his principal goal is to continue working and to work in his profession.

He is a person who is working hard to be able to be a professional and tomorrow to help people through his profession.

He asks for this loan to be able to pay the fees for his program and, so, to continue with his education.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mahabir Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Anita is a 24-year-old differently abled lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law and two children, 10 and 7 years old, in a small village in Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady standing left is Anita.

She is engaged in rice paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business.

Some years ago, Anita formed a group with Gomati from her village and named the group "Mahabir SHG-A." Both women are are engaged in the same business activity to alleviate their poverty. Anita is the president of this group. She motivated Gomati to form this group so they could help and support each other in their business and personal lives.

Anita, along with Gomati, requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation. She hopes to build a house for her family and she is very grateful to Kiva for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase standard quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Mahabir Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Hum is a 25-year-old differently abled woman who lives with her husband and parents-in-law in a small village of of Odisha state, India. The lady standing to the right in the photograph is Hum.

She is engaged in mushroom and vegetable cultivation. Her husband is a farmer and he produces rice. Her husband helps her in her activity. Currently, Hum earns 4,000 INR per month from her cultivation, which is used in monthly household expenses.

Hum has a three-acre farming area where she produces mushrooms and vegetables and sells them in the market. She focused on cultivating mushrooms because mushrooms can be grown on nearly any type of agricultural and forestall residue. They are an ideal crop for rural areas with large amounts of cultivated hectares and residue from field crops. By taking into consideration the drought problem in certain regions, mushroom production could help soil and water conservation too.

Hum, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Hum will use her portion of the loan amount to take farming land on rent so that she could produce more mushrooms and vegetables. Hum says, “I am sure that with the financial assistance received from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum, my family needs can be met and even I can expand my business.”

loans.use: to take farming land on rent so that she could produce more mushrooms and vegetables.

loans.name: Abilia

texts.es:
bilia vive en la ciudad de Luque, junto a su madre e hijo quien son su motivación por la cual cada día lucha, y está esforzándose.
Quiere ser una profesional  y tiene como objetivo trabajar en su área, y también poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus diversos gastos de la universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Abilia lives in the city of Luque with her mother and son who are her motivation for whom she fights each day, and she is working hard.

She wants to be a professional and has as her objective to work in her field, and also to be able to help other people in society.

She asks for this loan to cover her various university expenses, and in this way to be able to continue with her education.

loans.use: to cover university expenses.

loans.name: Anderson Andrés

texts.es: Anderson es un joven de 20 años de edad que por la falta de oportunidades laborales decidió por continuar con la actividad comercial que le inculcaron sus padres.  Desde hace cinco años se animó  a comenzar su propio negocio de comercialización de camisetas deportivas que le provee un familiar dedicado a la producción de estas prendas, las cuales exhibe en su casa y en las afueras de los estadios de futbol, aprovechando la demanda que generan los aficionados a ese deporte. Anderson considera que con un mayor capital podrá ampliar su clientela, e incrementar sus ventas por lo cual está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  su primer Credikiva, recursos que planea invertir en camisetas de los diferentes equipos del futbol Colombiano, de acuerdo a la demanda de la temporada. Su visión como emprendedor es posicionar la marca de sus productos a nivel nacional y terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Anderson is a young man, 20 years old, who due to lack of work opportunities decided to continue with the business work that his parents taught him. Five years ago, he decided to begin his own business selling the sports jerseys that come from a relative who works making this clothing, which he shows in his house and outside the soccer stadiums, taking advantage of the demand that the fans of this sport generate.  Anderson thinks that with more capital he will be able to expand his customer base and increase his sales, for which he is applying through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for his first Kiva loan, resources that he plans to invest in jerseys from the different Colombian soccer teams, according to the seasonal demand. His vision as an entrepreneur is to position the brand of his products at a national level and finish his university degree.

loans.use: to invest in jerseys for the different Colombian soccer teams.

loans.name: Sarat Kumar

texts.en:
Sarat Kumar, 31, is a differently abled man and a resident of a small village of Odisha, India. He is a happily married man and has two sons who are currently studying in primary school.

Sarat Kumar is a grocer by profession and is the only breadwinner in his family. He is a man with full of confidence and determination to succeed in life. He works very hard in order to fulfill every possible demands of his family. He sells snacks items like sweets, biscuits, cookies, banana chips, potato chips, french fries, soya sticks and cold drinks in his shop. He has a very good reputation in his community as he deals with his customers in a very cordial and friendly manner.

He is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR in order to purchase more stocks of chips, cookies, french fries, soya sticks and cold drinks so as to make his supply match with his customer's demand and thereby increase his cash flow so that he can improve his standard of living and lead a happy life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of chips, cookies, french fries, soya sticks and cold drinks.

loans.name: Mahabir Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Priyatama, 26, is to the left in the photograph. She is a good mother and an enterprising, dynamic, active, dependable, optimistic, responsible and very hardworking lady. She is a single mother and works really hard in order to earn her living and fulfill the needs of her children.

Her business is making craft adhesives, which are stickers, transfers and nail decals. She does the production by hand, using micro-painting technology. "The most common designs are flowers and butterflies in different colours and shapes, so that the customer can wear works of art on their hands and feet, she says.

The advantage of her business is that it has the demand of a beauty salon and individual customers; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase working materials such as organic acid, acetate, ether, etc. Her dream is to expand this business and stabilize it.

Priyatama, along with her group member, is requesting for a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase working materials to make craft adhesives.

loans.use: to purchase working materials to make craft adhesives.

loans.name: Damayanti

texts.en:
Damayanti, 32, is a resident of a small village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She is a married lady, having two daughters in her care. Her husband works as a truck driver and is the only breadwinner in her family.

Damayanti belongs to a low-income household and has access to very limited resources due to lack of funds. For this reason, she was never able to build a toilet for her house. She and her family have to go outside the house to the open field in order to attend nature's call, which is very unsafe.

Therefore, Damayanti is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a new toilet and install a new commode in it so that she can maintain her health and hygiene and avoid unnecessary medical expenses.

She has a dream to provide her daughters the best possible education and see them become successful in the future.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install a new commode.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in supplies needed for her business: flour, vegetables, oil, cheese, and more.

loans.name: Padmabati

texts.en:
Padmabati, 50, is an enterprising lady who hails from a small village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She works as a daily wage labourer in the agricultural sector. She has five members in her family, including three children.

She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. She and her family have to walk long distances for defecation and urination.

She is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes in it so as to facilitate the supply of water. The loan amount will help her in improving the health and sanitary conditions of her family, thereby promoting cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and incorporate water pipes.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina, 31, is a humble married lady from a small village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She is a farmer by profession and has a family of three. Her husband helps her in the field to cultivate vegetables.

Rina is from a very low-income household and she spends her life with access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a toilet in her house.

Rina is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to install a commode and a hand pump in order to improve her health and hygiene and help her family get access to basic sanitation.

Rina has a dream to purchase a vehicle so that she can transport her produce to the nearby market without paying unnecessary transportation charges.

loans.use: to install a commode and a hand pump.

loans.name: Sabya

texts.en:
Sabya, 43, is a simple and a humble lady from a small village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She has a family size of three and her husband is a farmer by profession.

Her family does not have the means to build a toilet at home. With no access to a toilet, they have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private, in dense bushes or isolated fields. She has understood the importance of having a toilet at home.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR to build a toilet in her home to improve her situation. Your loan will help her family get access to basic sanitation, improved health, and safety.

Sabya plans to start a dairy business by purchasing two cows so that she can supplement her husband's income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
Greta works on 0.97 hectares of land, where there are cucumbers, tomatoes, eggplant, and in the future, grain. Greta also has greenhouse, where she cultivates tomatoes and cucumbers.
 
Greta lives with her husband and two kids. Her husband helps her with the farm.
 
Greta has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her with purchasing farming supplies. Specifically, she plans to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation, and also to hire workers to support her. This will be Greta's second loan and she has plans of enlarging her farm and hopes that Kiva lenders will appreciate her ideas and help her realize her dreams.

Greta's loan has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. This second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for farming supplies.

loans.name: Manorama

texts.en:
Manorama, 43, is a charismatic, enterprising and humble lady who hails from a small and remote village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India.

She lives with her husband and a 16-year-old daughter. Manorama’s family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. These unsanitary practices make them vulnerable to infections, and the lack of privacy exposes them to molestation or worse.

Therefore, Manorama is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a new toilet for her family so that they no more will have to travel long distances to attend nature's call. They can maintain privacy and lead a healthy and happy life.

loans.use: to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old and married with 6 children living in Bundibugyo Uganda. She operates a stall where she earns income through the buying and selling of second hand shoes to support her family. She also earns additional income from her cocoa garden. 

She faces the challenges of competition and high transport costs to different markets in the shoe business.  In her cocoa business business, she faces challenging price changes.

She is a very hard working lady with future plans of operating a large retail shop. Miriam intends to use the loan to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Roseleah

texts.en:
Roseleah is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for eight years.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a huge cereal store within five years.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables.

Her business goal is to have a big store within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables

loans.name: Dukhik

texts.en:
Dukhik is shiny woman from Vedi town of Ararat region. She has been running a farm for more than 20 years. Dukhik lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. The whole family takes care of their farm and everyone has separate responsibilities. The family mostly keeps livestock of cows, calves and hens. In the family's own land near the house, they also cultivate fruit and vegetables (including the grape orchard which is shown in the photo).

Dukhik has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to support her farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for the livestock.

As this is Dukhik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

Dukhik will be very grateful if lenders support her plans for developing the farm.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer for land cultivation and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Winny

texts.en:
Winny is a single woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells mats. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of mats.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mats

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik is young farmer from Kanachut village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, their little daughter and in-laws.

Arpenik and her family run a farm. It currently includes cultivation of vegetables and fruit which they sell in local markets.

Arpenik asks this loan to have an opportunity to enlarge their family farming business. She plans to purchase three oxen, forage for feeding the cattle and fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

As this is Arpenik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen, forage for feeding the cattle and fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are locals.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

His business goal is to have a fleet of motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Paceñitas 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PACELITAS 16 DE JULIO” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Emma es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de material escolar (librería), venta de pan, venta de frazadas, venta de pan, venta de cosméticos, venta de jugos y batidos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Emma es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace cuatro años, al trabajar como ayudante de cocina y con los ahorros que tenía decidió emprender este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para la compra de un horno rostisero, que lo adquirirá de las comerciantes de  la ciudad de El Altos, esta compra le ayudara a ofrecer más variedades de platos de comida para posteriormente comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “PACELITAS 16 DE JULIO” credit group will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Panamericana Center. It is made up of nine members and is led by a board of directors, of which Emma is the president. The businesses that the members of the credit group have are varied. among them are selling school supplies, selling bread, selling blankets, selling cosmetics, selling juices and smoothies, and selling food.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Emma. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling food. She says that she learned this business four years ago while working as an assistant in a kitchen and with her savings she decided to start this business.

The loan she will take out now will be to buy a rotisserie oven, which she will acquire from merchants in the city of El Alto. This purchase will help her to offer more varied dishes in her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that the likes the area of health and the trainings that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a rotisserie oven.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 55-year-old married man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a clothing business supplemented by income from rentals. These businesses have seen him provide for his family, complete the rentals and meet his loan obligations. He has future prospects of constructing a good residential house for his family.

He complains of tenants who don't pay rent on time, since it is what he uses to pay for electricity plus water bills.

Fred has asked for a loan to help him buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jacton

texts.en:
Jacton is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest, capable and kind.

He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes.

His business goal is to be able to sell shoes at wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future he will have a big business.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Kerebu

texts.en: Kerebu is a 32-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He has 2 children, ages 6 and 9 and they both attend primary school. He buys and sells produce, especially coffee. He also owns a banana plantation to earn more income and supplement his own food stuff. His vision is to expand his business and build a permanent house but he faces a challenge of inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes. He is in need of a loan to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items. His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, milk, flour and other items.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is farmer living in Artashat town. He lives with his parents, wife and three children.

Vardan's farm is rich with livestock and he also cultivates wheat and barley. He currently keeps livestock of 3 cows, 6 calves, 2 piglets, hens, turkeys and 16 colonies of bees.

Vardan works day and night on his farm to sustain it and gather income for his family's living. He asks lenders to help him with the development of his farm.

With the required loan he plans to pay for land cultivation work (hire workers for help, watering costs).

This is his second loan. The first one which he took from local financial institution, Vardan faced financial difficulties to make payments on time. Now, having a sustainable and profitable farm, Vardan wants to ask for a second chance to develop his farm further. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.

Vardan and his family hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation work (hire workers for help, watering costs).

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis esta estudiando para poder ser un buen ingeniero comercial, y por medio de sus estudios poder abrirse camino y ser alguien útil,no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás, comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder  pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue muy útil.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder volver a pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de perseguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Luis is studying so he can be a good commercial engineer and, through his studies, make his own way and be useful, not only to himself but also to others. He said he used his previous loan to pay his university expenses, which was very useful to him.

He's requesting this new loan to pay his program fees again and be able to continue with his studies.

Luis is grateful for this opportunity to follow his dreams.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en: Johnstone is a Kiva borrower. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 to 13 years. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik, her husband (in the photo) and their big family live in Meghri town of Syunik region.
All family members have been involved in agribusiness as they are running the family farm located near the house.
The farm is not big, but the enthusiasm to develop it is very strong in the family. Currently they keep four cows and 2 oxen. Hasmik and her mother-in-law milk cows and make dairy products which are sold in nearby markets.
Hasmik has now applied for this loan to purchase a cow, calf and forage for feeding the livestock.
As this is Hasmik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.
Hasmik hopes that the Kiva loan will bring success to their agricultural business.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, calf and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Suzin

texts.en:
Suzin is married with 3 children, two of whom attend school in Kasese. He raises pigs and also runs a produce and coffee business. These two sources of income help him sustain his family and accumulate more savings. 

He is a hardworking and strategic man with a desire to become an expert in business. At the moment, his coffee business is doing very well, because it is peak season.

He is requesting a loan to stock more coffee to sell.

loans.use: to stock more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Gualberto Condomi

texts.es:
Jorge de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado en la escuela de la comunidad, se casó de 19 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como sirvienta en una casa en la ciudad, Jorge es padre de dos hijos quienes están estudiando en el instituto en la ciudad.

Jorge tiene muchísima experiencia en trabajar en un carwash donde lavan automóviles y motocicletas, desde pequeño él ha trabajado en el área de servicio, ahora junto con un amigo tienen un carwash donde trabaja de lunes a domingos de siete a cinco de la tarde. 

Él solicita este crédito para comprar más equipo de trabajo para su carwash y el resto para ajustar y comprar una motocicleta. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando y mejor el local donde presta servicios, todo esto por salir adelante y darle lo mejor a su esposa e hijos.
texts.en:
Jorge is 36 years old. He went to school up to seventh grade in the community school. He got married at 19 and his wife works as a servant in a house in the city. Jorge is the father of two children who are going to school at an institute in the city.

Jorge has a lot of experience working in a car wash where they wash cars and motorcycles. Since he was little, he has worked in the service sector. Now he and a friend have a car wash where he works Monday through Sunday from from seven until five in the afternoon.

He is asking for this loan to buy more work equipment for his car wash and to finish paying for a motorcycle.

His dream is to keep working and improve the locale where he offers his service. All of this is to get ahead and give his wife and children the best.

loans.use: to buy more work equipment for his car wash and the rest is to finish paying for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Heanh's Group

texts.en: Heanh’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Heanh makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna tiene 24 años, vive en la ciudad de Villa Hayes con su pareja y un hijo pequeño, estudia el 3er año de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, es una persona que quiere salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Mirna está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser una buena profesional, útil, no solo a sí mismo, sino también a su familia y seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mirna is 24 years old. She lives in the city of Villa Hayes with her spouse and her young son. She is in her third year of Accounting Sciences. She is a person who wants to get ahead to help her family and her loved ones.

Mirna is putting her best effort into being able to be good at her profession and useful not only to herself but to her family and her loved ones as well.

She is asking for this loan to pay for college tuition so that she can continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, en un futuro quiere poder abrir un estudio contable, para poder crecer no solo como persona sino también como profesional.
Leticia está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser un buen profesional y de esa forma poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de tesis, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Leticia is studying the career of accounting, in the future she wants to be able to open an accounting firm to be able to grow not only as a person but also as a professional.

Leticia is putting her greatest effort to be able to be a good professional and in this way be able to earn a living in a dignified and honest way.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her thesis expenses, and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha, a 29 year-old mother of three dependent children who are under the age of school, lives in Kampong Thom province where she and her husband are growing rice and raising pigs to better support family’s needs. Both business earn this family about 37,600KHR per day and enable her to save approximately about 17,600KHR after deducting daily expenses. This will be the fourth cycle loan for her with VisionFund; as the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that after installing the latrine her family members will live in healthy environment.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to help her family live in a healthy environment.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be self motivated. He operates a farm where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labor costs

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a resident of Batasan, Philippines and a wife of Edgar, a bus conductor. They’re helping each other to make daily earnings. Lilibeth is engaged current in selling Ready-to-wear clothes and foot wears in Commonwealth for ten years now. She admits that it’s not easy to earn a living nowadays since there’s a price change on every product from time to time. That’s why she is persevering in running the business as she has children to raise and their daily needs that she and her husband needs to sustain.

Lilibeth is thankful that she has a hard working husband who’s helping her on the business. Approximately P21, 600 is her monthly earnings. Right now, Lilibeth is just leasing a space for her business and she aims to have her own store. She applied for a P15, 000 loan to buy doll shoes, sandals and added ready-to-wear-clothes for the business. This amount will help her earn additional profit since she can sell variety of designs to customers. 

Being a long time member of CCT, Lilibeth has been consistently attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made Lilibeth to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy doll shoes, sandals and added ready-to-wear-clothes for the business.	 .

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa is a single woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows maize, beans and also keeps cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her range of fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en: Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Renovacion Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RENOVACIÓN” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Judith es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de medias, venta de cosméticos, venta de mantas, venta de zapatos, venta de celulares, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Judith es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de celulares; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. "Renovación" will start the ninth cycle of Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch Focal Center, is composed of eight members and is headed by a board where Judith is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal association carry forward are varied and include: sale of vegetables, sale of socks, sale of cosmetics, sale of blankets, sale of shoes, sale of cell phones, and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs where Judith is a member. She indicates that for the year she's been a member of Pro Mujer, she entered through an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. Today she has a business selling cell phones, and she discloses that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago.

The loan that they now will request is part of the increase of capital (purchase of cellphones wholesale) that she will acquire wholesale sellers in the city of La Paz and subsequently sell in her retail space. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, as she lives in a free union and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy cell phones wholesale.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es de una familia humilde, ella es estudiante de la carrera de Química Farmacéutica, es una mujer que está luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida, y por medio de su profesión abrirse camino.
Ella comenta que su sostén es su familia, ya que siempre la apoyan en todo y están a su lado siempre.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liliana is from a poor family, and she is studying the career of pharmaceutical chemistry. She is a women who is struggling to be able to be someone in life, and through her profession she will break through.

She says her family is supportive, as always they support her in everything and they are always on her side.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees, and thus be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, con mucho sacrificio está estudiando, ya que sus padres son de origen muy humilde. Ella se está esforzando por mejorar su vida, es por ello que está luchando y estudiando.
La carrera que estudia es la de Derecho, ya que quiere ser un buen abogado para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Natalia is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, with much sacrifice she is studying, because her parents are from very humble origin. She is working hard to improve her life, which is why she is fighting and studying.

The career that she studying is that of law, because she wants to be a good lawyer and be able to help others.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her career, and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo está estudiando la carrera de Análisis en Sistemas, su meta es superarse y convertirse en una excelente profesional, está luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida y por medio de sus estudios poder crecer.
Él quiere abrirse camino por medio de su carrera, es por ello que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Guillermo is studying the career of systems analysis, his goal is to excel and become an excellent professional. He is fighting to be able to be someone in life and through his studies be able to grow.

He wants to make his way through his career, and this is why he is putting his greatest effort to be able to be someone useful to society.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees of his career and thus be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Horacio es estudiante de la carrera de ingeniería comercial, es el menor de dos hermanos, sus padres siempre le han apoyado en todo lo que el necesita para ser alguien en la vida.
Él está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su meta de ser un buen profesional, y se esfuerza para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Horacio is studying the career of commercial engineer. He is the youngest of two brothers, and his parents have always supported him in all that he needs to be able to be someone in life.

He is putting his best effort to be able to fulfill his goal of being a good professional, and strives to achieve it.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees of his career, and thus be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay the fees of his career.

loans.name: Karen Cecilia

texts.es: Karen, inició su negocio con la premisa de que el tiempo se debe ocupar y que mejor forma que generando recursos para su familia, fue entonces que decidió hace cinco años utilizar para su idea de negocio unos ahorros que su cónyuge y ella habían guardado; con ellos compró una vitrina que surtió con productos misceláneos, posteriormente incorporó una venta de helados y servicio de minutos y recargas. Karen de 25 años es madre de un hijo de apenas un año de edad y residen en un barrio que se encuentra ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en donde sus vecinos, amigos y transeúntes son sus clientes. Karen está muy feliz de poder ofrecer bienestar a su familia y continuar con sus labores cotidianas en el hogar, puesto que cuando se comprometió con su cónyuge solamente se dedicaba al hogar y sentía que debía crecer comercialmente para a futuro ser una empresaria independiente.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con nuevos productos para su miscelánea y comprar paquetes de minutos. Esta inversión ampliara el surtido en su negocio y serán muchos más los clientes que visiten su negocio.
