Su meta a futuro es ampliar el local y continuar ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Karen started her business with the idea that time must be spent productively, and what better way to do that than by earning money to provide for her family?
Following this logic, she started her business five years ago, thanks to some money her and her husband had put aside.
She bought a display counter that she stuffed with various products, and a bit later expanded into ice-cream sales and telephone top-ups.
Karen, 25, has a one-year-old child and lives in a neighbourhood of the town of Barranquilla.
Her customers are neighbours, friends, and passers-by.
Karen is very happy to be able to provide for her family while taking care of the household.
When she got engaged, she was just taking care of the household, but felt that she had to have her own business in order to grow as an entrepreneur and become independent.
She is asking for her first loan to Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy new products for her shop and buy mobile credits to sell.
The goal is to offer more merchandise and thus attract more customers.
Her plans for the future are to have a bigger shop and to keep increasing her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new products for her shop and buy mobile credits to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es: Miguel es un emprendedor de 55 años que consolidó una microempresa familiar cuya clave del éxito fue el trabajo en equipo: en su casa organizó una venta de artículos misceláneos; dulces, agua, cacharrería, venta de minutos, recargas a celular, accesorios y demás, la cual es atendida por su cónyuge, mientras él se encarga de la organización de los eventos programados para un reconocido centro comercial de la ciudad de Barranquilla, de donde es proveedor exclusivo desde hace 18 años.  Su trabajo consiste en dirigir una emisora interna y desarrollar eventos sociales para impulsar la actividad del centro comercial de acuerdo a las fechas especiales: outlets, conciertos y demás, así mismo maneja clientes particulares que requieren de sus servicios para organizar diferentes tipos de eventos sociales entre ellos cumpleaños, bodas, bautizos, graduaciones. Actualmente los equipos con que cuenta son insuficientes para atender sus compromisos, por lo cual Miguel está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de invertir en la compra de luces y fortalecer su capital de trabajo para la financiación de la logística que requiere cada evento, pues su meta es fidelizar a su clientela con buen servicio y buenos precios.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 55 year old businessman who runs a small family business. The key to the success of the business is teamwork.
His wife is responsible for selling from their home a variety of goods: candy, kitchen goods, cell phone credit, cell phone calls, accessories and much more. Miguel is responsible for running scheduled events at a famous shopping centre in the city of Barranquilla, where he has been the exclusive contractor for the last 18 years.

This work consists of running an internal booth and creating social events aimed at increasing activity at the shopping centre on specific dates: sales, concerts and much more. Miguel also has private customers who require his services to organise different types of events such as birthdays, weddings, baptisms and graduations.

Nowadays, the equipment Miguel has is not good enough for the events he is running, thus he is applying for his first loan with KIVA through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Miguel wishes to use the money to buy new a new lighting system and strengthen his capital in order to be able to finance the logistics that each event requires. His goal is to ensure his clientele are loyal through great service and good prices.

loans.use: to buy new a new lighting system and strengthen his capital in order to be able to finance the logistics for event he runs.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 25 años de edad, hizo 3° grado de estudio, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura y juntos luchan para superarse.

María está trabajando en el cultivo de maíz, esto lo aprendió con la abuela pues desde pequeña la acompañaba al campo y así fue aprendiendo esta actividad productiva.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, veneno entre otros insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz.


Ella planea seguir trabajando para crecer a los niños, también ahorrar para pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old, completed her third grade of studies, is married and has 4 children. Her husband works in agriculture and together they fight to succeed.

María is working in the cultivation of corn, this she learned with her grandmother so since she was young she accompanied her in the field and thus learned the activity of production.

She needs this loan to be able to purchase manure, fertilizers, and poison among other agricultural inputs for the cultivation of corn.

She plans to continue working to be able to raise her children, also to save to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, and poison among other agricultural inputs for the cultivation of corn.

loans.name: Rambha

texts.en:
Rambha, 46, is a charismatic, enterprising and industrious lady who hails from a small village of Bolangir district in Odisha, India.

She runs a food stall in her locality and has a good reputation in her community for the tasty and quality food she serves to her customers. She has two sons in her care, and her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Unfortunately, she does not have a toilet facility in her home. She has to go outside to a distant open field to attend nature's call, which is very difficult for her as she is an acute rheumatic patient.

Therefore, Rambha is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a toilet in her home and install a water pump so that she get access to an adequate amount of water.

The loan will ultimately help her in safeguarding the health of her family and improving the hygiene and cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a toilet in her home and install a water pump.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina es estudiante de la carrera de Trabajo Social, sus metas son lograr terminar sus estudios y de aquí en el futuro graduarse y desempeñarse en su carrera Lic. en trabajo Social, para poder ayudar a las personas de la sociedad.
Ella es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida, y destacarse en su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Romina studies social work. Her goals are to finish her studies, graduate in the future, and practice her professional career in social work so she can help people in society. She's a person who gives her all to be able to be someone in life and stand out in her profession.

Romina's requesting this loan so she can pay her program fees. That way she can continue with her studies, just as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her program fees

loans.name: Subarna

texts.en:
Subarna, 27, is a humble and simple lady from a small village of Bolangir district. She has a family of three which includes her 4-year-old daughter and her husband, who owns a betel shop. He is the only breadwinner for the family. Subarna and her family make their living with a very limited income.

Unfortunately, Subarna does not possess a toilet in her home, which is her major concern as she has to travel a long distance for defecation and urination.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR in order to build a new toilet and install a commode in it. It will also mean that they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick.

In this way, Subarna will be able to safeguard her and her family's health and promote cleanliness in the community.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install a commode in it

loans.name: Daemati

texts.en:
Daemati, 47, is a resident of a small, remote village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She is a married mother of three grown-up children.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland that is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around 10 years.

Daemati wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shampoo, hand and foot care products, perfume, body lotion, and other beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more human drugs to sell

loans.name: Kumari

texts.en:
Kumari is a 53-year-old widow with three sons and a daughter who is married. She is a resident of a small village of Kandhamal district, Odisha, India. She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, consistent, independent, active, responsible and hardworking.

She has been doing livestock all these past 10 years to earn a living for her family. "After my husband passed away, my life became harder financially and physically demanding. I had young kids to take care of. It was tough, but I made it. Extreme poverty is no good for nobody and I have been experiencing it for almost forever," she said.

Kumari is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 INR in order to purchase two milking cows so that she will be able to sell more milk and increase her customer base. This will subsequently result in her in getting a better standard of living and leading a happy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase two milking cows

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando es un joven que proviene de una familia muy humilde, pero saliendo adelante ayudándose todos. Su meta es conseguir recibirse en la carrera de análisis de sistemas.
Él está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder recibirse en su carrera y también poder ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos varios que tiene en su universidad, y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte.
texts.en:
Armando's a young man from a family that's very modest but gets ahead and helps each other mutually.

His goal is to graduate in the field of systems analysis. He's putting his best effort into graduating in his field and helping his family and loved ones.

Armando's requesting this loan so he can cover his various university expenses as well as his transportation expenses.

loans.use: to cover his university and transportation expenses

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen es una emprendedora confeccionista del municipio de Soledad que organizó con escasos recursos económicos su propio proyecto de negocio, iniciativa que hoy le permite ganarse la vida demostrando que el crear empresa sin necesidad de tener un gran capital sí es posible. Para ella la costura fue la profesión heredada por tradición familiar, trabajó en varios talleres como operaria y finalmente con su última liquidación compró sus máquinas y organizó su taller de costura en el que ofrece a familiares, vecinos y referidos el servicio de confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra de una nueva máquina de coser y materia prima como telas, hilos, accesorios, para atender la demanda que genera la temporada de fin de año. Su principal reto es tener un taller grande, con operarias a su servicio, con el propósito devengar mayores ingresos para el beneficio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is an enterprising clothing manufacturer from Soledad municipality who started her own business with few resources. It is due to her initiative that she can now earn a living while demonstrating that it is possible to start a business without a lot of capital. For her sewing is a profession she inherited through her family. She worked in several workshops as a machine operator and then with the proceeds of her last sale she bought her machines and opened her workshop where she makes men's', women's and children's clothing for family, friends and other clients who have come by referral.

Now she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation which she plans to invest in the purchase of a new sewing machine and basic supplies such as fabric, thread and accessories to meet the demand for the year end season. Her main goal is to have a large workshop employing machine operators in order to bring in more income for her family's economic well being.

loans.use: to invest in a new sewing machine and basic supplies such as fabric, thread and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NECESITA ATENDER A SU HIJO YA QUE TIENE MUCHA MOLESTIA EN SUS ENCÍAS TIENE UN SEVERO PROBLEMA PERIODONTAL URGE SE LE REALICEN VARIAS CIRUGÍAS PARA QUITAR EL EXCESO DE ENCÍA DE NO REALIZARSE ESTE TRATAMIENTO PUEDE PERDER VARIAS PIEZAS DENTALES, ELLA DE MOMENTO NO CUENTA CON LOS RECURSOS SUFICIENTES YA QUE ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTO DE SU FAMILIA.
texts.en:
This woman needs to care for her son because he has a lot of pain in his gums. He has a severe periodontal problem. It is urgent that they do various surgeries in order to remove the excess gum. If the surgery is not done, he could lose various teeth.

At this time she does not have enough resources because she is the sole support of her family.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak is involved in dried fruit production in Armavir town. He produces apricots, peaches and plum dried fruits and organizes production in his own home. During seasonal production, in addition to his family members, Sevak also hires eight employees. The final product is sold mainly in Russia and Armenia.

Sevak now asks for this loan to purchase raw materials for dried fruit production (peaches).

Sevak has requested a loan several times from local financial institutions to develop his business, but has not been successful. His loan request was rejected each time because the business isn't registered as a formal business.

Sevak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Sevak hopes for lenders support to develop his business further. He lives with his parents, wife and 18-year-old son, and all family members help him with the production.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials for dried fruit production (peaches).

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, solo estudió primaria, es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela.

Ella tiene una tienda desde hace varios años, sus hijos le ayudan cuando regresan de estudiar , además María se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas y petates en sus tiempos libres.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, frijol, maíz, jabón, papas entre otros y así surtir su tienda.

Ella sueña con que sus hijos se preparen y no trabajen como le ha tocado a ella pues ha sido madre soltera y no ha tenido apoyo de nadie mas.
texts.en:
María, age 41, only went to elementary school. She is the single mother of three children, who go to school.

She has had a store for several years. Her children help her when they get back from school.

María also makes hammocks and bed mats in her free time.

She needs the loan to buy basic needs products like sugar, beans, corn, soap, and potatoes, among others, in order to stock her store.

Her dream is that her children become prepared so they do not have to work like she has. She has been a single mother, and she has not had support from anyone else.

loans.use: to buy basic needs products like sugar, beans, corn, soap, and potatoes, among others, in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Campanitas De Belen Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMPANITAS DE BELEN” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Filomena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de salchipapa, venta de sombreros, venta de chocolates, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de muebles, venta de DVD’s, venta de calzados, venta de artefactos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Filomena es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción de la institución, que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando como ayudante de cocina hace más de un año, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en este negocio es su hija.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto, para posteriormente, a la elaboración, comercializarlo en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos. 

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la otorgación de créditos que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Campanitas de Belen communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center. It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors. Filomena is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include selling 'salchipapas' [fried potatoes and sausages], selling hats, selling chocolates, selling food, selling clothes, selling furniture, selling DVD's, selling shoes, and selling appliances. The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Filomena is a member.

She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined by invitation from a promotion the institution did in her area. She currently has a business selling salchipapas. She says that she learned this business by working as a kitchen helper over a year ago. Now it is her daughter who helps her in this business. The loan that she will take out will be to increase capital (to buy potatoes and rice in bulk), which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. After making the food, she will sell it at her sales space.

This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family financially. She is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she like the lending activities that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Margaret will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business and well-educated children.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another knife sharpening machine

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a Kiva borrower. She has two children. She describes herself to be focused, social and God-fearing. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Marceline will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine makes and sells cookies and ice cream from her house in Metsamor town of Armavir town. She works hard to manage to cover all orders she receives from her customers. Her only son is a migrant worker in a neighbouring country, and time after time supports his mother financially.

Narine asks this loan to purchase a refrigerator for keeping the ice cream.

Narine has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to develop her business, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because her business isn't registered as a formal business.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Narine will be very grateful to lenders for their support of her business activity.

loans.use: to pay for a refrigerator the ice cream.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. For three years, she has operated a retail business selling charcoal. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain, which affects business. She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy more supplies of charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en: Melanya is from Sardarapat Village, Armenia where she lives with her husband and three children. She prepares and sells different food products from her house. The business is 20 years old, and Melanya works hard to make it run successfully. She wants this loan to purchase an oven for making food and polyethylene bags to package the food. To develop her business, Melanya has requested several loans from local financial institutions without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because her business is not registered as a formal business. Melanya has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Melanya hopes to receive lenders' support and cover orders for the current month.

loans.use: to pay for an oven and polyethylene bags for her food preparation business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy the peanuts direct from farmers in bulk to save costs.

loans.name: Diana Laura

texts.en: Diana is a 20-year-old who lives with her parents and has no dependents. She makes a living by running a stand in which she sells fruits, sodas, shakes, and soft liquors like tepache (distilled fruits). She dreams about becoming a professional chef one day soon and work for a big restaurant. She also wants to buy a house in the near future. She is currently paying for her chef studies with her stand. She thinks she may attract more clients if she can buy another shake machine and other merchandise such as fruits and sodas to meet her current demand. In order to make this posible she is looking for a $5,000 MXN loan. She had a previous loan that she repaid. In Kubo we believe that she will achieve her dreams and that her stand will produce enough money to provide for her studies.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies to improve her food business

loans.name: Jamil

texts.es:
Jamil vive en la ciudad de Villarrica, vive con mis padres, son 4 integrantes en la familia, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y comenta que después de graduarse su meta es la de poder ejercer su profesión para poner una empresa para poder ayudar a su familia y solventar los gastos.
Jamil es un joven muy luchador y está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante, es por eso que se esfuerza. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder alcanzar su meta de ser alguien en la vida
texts.en:
Jamil lives in the city of Villarrica with his parents. There are four people in his family.

He studies accounting and he said his goal is to practice his profession after he graduates and start a business so he can help his family and pay their expenses. He's a very persevering young man who's giving it his all so he can grow and get ahead. That's why he's making an effort.

Jamil is requesting this loan so he can pay his university fees. That way he can continue with his studies, just as he has been doing.

He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to realize his goal of being somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Mira's Group

texts.en:
Vanessa is a married mother of two children, who left her hometown in the Philippines to come and work as a house keeper in Lebanon so that she can provide her family with a better income and improve their living.
Vanessa is the featured borrower of Mira's group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they met in Lebanon seeking a better living.
For a 28-year-old mother, hope is still available, her limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover her family's increasing living needs. Thus, for this reason she acquired a group loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her children school tuition fees in the Philippines to provide them with a better future.

Vanessa is the Lady at the center of the picture with blue top. As for the other group members, Sally is the first from the left, while Myra is the first from the right.

loans.use: to pay for her children school tuition fees in the Philippines, to provide them with a better future.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is married with two children. He lives in Kasese and deals in a produce business. Moses also does crop farming for additional income. However, he does not so much rely on it because of unpredictable weather changes like too much sunshine or heavy rains with floods.

If given a chance for supplementing his income, Moses sees himself as a successful businessman in a few years to come. He is now requesting a loan to buy more maize and coffee for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize and coffee for selling.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.en:
The women of group Ushindi are from the city of Bukavu, Eastern Democratic Republic of Congo. This loan is their 7th as a part of Wezesha Project and have a strong repayment record. Each group member will receive a loan of $400USD to invest in their businesses in order to increase their capital.

Nsimire is a young entrepreneur who has managed to make progress at a young age. Thanks to the support of her husband and the loan she had previously she has managed to stock her business with charcoal and more products

In order to continue growing in her sales of charcoal a larger variety to her customers, Nsimire is asking for another loan to buy more products and sacks of charcoal. In the not-too-distant future she plans to have a fully equipped stall with a larger range of products. she is thankful for the ended loan through it she finished the school year without dept of her children.

This is good because Nsimire is the sole income earner for her 8 children. She is married, but like most in Eastern DRC her husband is unemployed. This loan will allow Nsimire to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and transport to Bukavu for sale.

loans.name: Hmayak

texts.en:
Hmayak is from Aratashen village. He is a father of three little kids and together with his wife has been running their family farm. They have greenhouse where currently they cultivate tomatoes and peppers, and have plans to cultivate greens in the future. 

Hmayak asks Kiva lenders to support him with development and improvement of his farm. He wants to purchase polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, seeds, fertilizer and hire workers for organizing cultivation works. 
This will be Hmayak's second loan. During his first loan from local financial institution, he faced financial difficulties with the result of which wasn't able to make monthly payments on time.Now, with the increased profit and successful farm, he ensures responsible monthly payment. Hmayak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products.
Hmayak hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover and wires for the greenhouse, seeds, fertilizer and workers for organizing cultivation works

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is farmer from Anushavan village of Shirak region. She lives with her husband, father-in-law and three grown up children. Arevik is the only one who takes care of the family farm. Her husband is a migrant worker, who left the country with the hope of finding a job and supporting his family financially.
Arevik's father-in-law is elderly retired, so Arevik works day and night to sustain her farm. She keeps two cows, two calves and two piglets and also cultivate wheat, potato and garlic in the yard near the house.

To be able to purchase wheat seeds for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock, Arevik now asks for lenders' support. The region where they live, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region. Arevik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living.
Arevik hopes for lenders' support and she is sure that her hard and tireless work will bring her success and she will be able to provide her family with appropriate living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds for land cultivation and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Buguma Group

texts.en:
This group's members are part of Buguma and are beginning their 5th loan cycle with Wezesha Project. It is made up of five members and represented by Estella. Estela (far left) is a 59-year-old vegetable seller. She is a widow and mother of 6 adult children. She is from the city of Uvira in the Democratic Republic of Congo. She has been in the business of selling produce for 14 years and this is the way she knows to make a living.

She finished her last loan correctly and she earned more profits that helped her.

The businesses that the members of the group carry out are varied. Among them: smoked fish, cosmetics, maize, vegetables, cooking oil and fruits. The loan that they will take out will benefit each small-business entrepreneur in the group of which Estella is a member.

Currently, she has a business selling Vegetables and fruits . She makes it known that she learned this business on her own. The loan that she will now take out is for the increase in capital to purchase more smoked fish and cosmetics which she will sell to her customers. She will acquire these products from the wholesalers in the city of Uvira. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family since she is married and has children.

When she is consulted about what she likes about E R & D Overseas, she responded that she likes the area of health and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: buy tomatoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy comenta que su meta es recibirse de Licenciada en Kinesiología y poder ejercer mi profesión  y generar mayores ingresos de manera de ayudar a su familia.
Ella quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos dándoles una mejor calidad de vida, además quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, esforzándose por ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Nancy commented that her goal is to receive her degree in Kinesiology and exercise her profession and generate greater income as a way to to help her family. She wants to be able to help her loved ones providing them with a higher quality of living. She also wants to be able to help others in society.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her studies. Doing this she can continue with her studies, making an effort to be somebody in life.

loans.use: to pay fees for her studies.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be loyal.

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 33 years old, married with two children and she is practicing farming, planting maize dairy farming and horticulture. Her monthly income from her farming is ksh20,000. She is taking a loan of ksh 113,500 to buy motorcycle for transporting farm inputs She would use anticipated profits to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children.

This is her first loan from visionfund kenya. Her hopes and dreams for future is to buy a motor vehicle - pickup for transportation and educate her children to higher education as well as to create job opportunity to the community.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle  for transporting farm imput.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be patient.

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be rain, which affects business.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is from Saralanj village of Shirak region. The best agricultural business for the locals is cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. Ruzanna and her family keep livestock of two cows, calves and hens. They also have arable land where different crops are cultivated. 
Ruzanna now asks this loan to purchase seeds, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation works. The region where they live, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region. Ruzanna's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living. 
Please support this hardworking farmer and her family with many years of experience in that field to develop the farm and gather income for living.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation works.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
This will be Edgar's second Kiva loan, and again he has plans for enlarging his farm and hopes that Kiva lenders will again appreciate his ideas and finance him to realize them. With this loan amount, he will pay for renovation of the barn, three oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock.

At this time, Edgar's loan has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. He had another loan from a local financial institution, but because of financial difficulties in the family, wasn't able to make on-time payments.

Edgar now runs his farm successfully, ensuring responsible monthly payments, and hopes for lenders' support one more time.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn, three oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Wilson José

texts.es:
Wilson, de 23 años de edad, un joven luchador  con ganas de salir a delante,  con mucho esfuerzo  estudió hasta noveno grado ya que sus padres no pudieron costear sus estudios por falta de dinero, se crió junto a sus padres trabajando en la agricultura y su sueño fue siempre ser un futbolista, se acompañó hace cuatro años en la comunidad, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y tienen un niño de tres años de edad.

Wilson actualmente se dedica a trabajos en la agricultura, también como ayudante de albañil en la comunidad y además juega en un equipo de la ciudad en segunda división del país, en el cual va a entrenar todos los días por las tardes luego de los trabajos que realiza en la comunidad.
Él necesita este crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes y pagar a mozos para que le ayuden con la milpa de maíz.

El sueño de Wilson es hacer su casa propia donde vivir con su esposa y su hijo, además pretende para el próximo año seguir estudiando para superarse.
texts.en:
Wilson, 23, is a persevering young man who wants to get ahead. He put a lot of effort into studying up to ninth grade, but his parents didn't have the money to pay for his studies. He grew up working in agriculture with his parents, and his dream was always to be a soccer player. He got married in the community four years ago; his wife is a homemaker and they have a three-year-old child.

Currently Wilson earns a living in farming and as a bricklayer's assistant in the community. He also plays on a city team in the second national division, so he trains every day in the afternoon after he works in his community.

He needs the loan to buy soil amendments and fertilizer and to pay workers to help him with the cornfield.

Wilson's dream is to build his own house where he can live with his wife and child. He also plans to continue his studies next year so he can improve himself.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and fertilizer and to pay workers to help with the cornfield

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy farm inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur provides auto repair service in Artik town. He lives with his wife and their little daughter. Artur works hard to sustain his family's living and cover the daily costs of his growing family.

He has applied for this loan to ask lenders to support his business. Artur needs to purchase materials needed for providing auto repair service. He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Artur will be very thankful to lenders for their support, as it is very important for him now.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for providing auto repair service.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be honest and polite. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish.

She hopes that in the future, she will have improved family living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Ravy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Thom province, Ravy is 47 years old. As the breadwinner in the family, this widowed mother of two dependent children is growing rice for the main source of family income. In her spare time, she is working for others for a fee to supplement income too. Earning about 12USD per day, Ravy is able to support the living better. Ravy has ever been with VisionFund for six cycles and she has paid back completely. Now, she is leading a group of two members to apply for a loan to build a decent latrine. She hopes that all family members live healthily and protect them from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family's health and protect her children from infectious diseases.

loans.name: Akossiwavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Akossiwavi  est une femme âgée de 47 ans résidant à Agoè. Akossiwavi est une revendeuse  de produits d’alimentations générales qui achète ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa propre boutique. Akossiwavi  sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz, de l’huile et divers  afin d’avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit en vue d’aider son mari dans l’éducation de ses enfants et à subvenir aux charges quotidiennes  éprouvées.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of three children, Akossiwavi is a woman of 47, living in Agoè. She is a retailer of groceries who buys her merchandise twice a month in the market and resells it out of her home, in her own little store.

Akossiwavi is requesting this loan to order sacks of rice, oil, and various items so as to have a larger inventory and maximize her profit so that she can help her husband with the education of her children and cover their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of rice, one jerrycan of oil, and various other items.

loans.name: Thida Group

texts.en: Thida’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Thida makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Simtatcho

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Simtatcho est une femme mariée âgée de 40 ans résidant à Agoè. Simtatcho est une marchande de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile dans sa propre boutique pour gagner des revenus. Simtatcho désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de riz. Avec le bénéfice qui en résultera, Simtatcho va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Simtatcho is a 40-year-old, married mother of five children who lives in Agoè.

Simtatcho sells food products. She purchases supplies from the market five times a month and resells them at her house in her own store in order to make an income. Simtatcho is asking for this loan to order bags of rice.

With the profits that she makes, Simtatcho will be able to help her husband with the family's expenses and allow her children to get a good education.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice.

loans.name: Kindergarten Group

texts.en:
It has become a dream for most Zimbabwean graduates to be formally employed due to the persistent economic challenges the country is facing. Lenah is a graduate from the University of Zimbabwe; she attained a degree in computers. She is a 36 year old woman and is married and a mother of 4, 2 of whom are going to school. She took longer than normal for her to finish her college due financial constraints. She then identified a talent in her of sewing in order for her to finance her studies.
Finally she managed to graduate in November 2014 but could not get a place of employment; in fact currently there has been a trend where most companies are retrenching. Having been used to finance her studies through part time tailoring, she endeavored to venture more and involve herself intensely in embroidery.

As soon as Christmas 2014, she started tailoring energetically and due to the experience she had, her final creation was state of the art designer work. Tailoring proved sustainable hence the need for expansion was inevitable. The only handicap for expansion was lack of financial injection, fortunately she was introduced to Thrive by a neighbor, the good news she had been waiting for all along.
She and her 4 group members of Kindergarten attended Thrive sessions. She indicated that she benefited a lot from Thrive sessions and that the sessions were motivational and cemented her resolution to expand her business. In her business she provides tailoring business to clients who bring their own materials. Her clients give her their designs and she works on the material according to their specific requirements. Of late African Prints fabrics are the new hot material in town hence her expansion is focusing on using that material on production of dresses, suits, coating shoes and also sewing on matching handbags. She also makes accessories like clutch bags, earrings, flat base caps, and belts in African print. She intends to penetrate to a wider market and her vision is to become reputable designer using Computer Aided Design (CAD). She also intends to move with the times and make trendy clothing.

loans.use: to use more African prints in the clothes she makes.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es una persona que esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser alguien en la vida, esta estudiando y dedicándose al máximo para poder ayudar su familia por medio de sus estudios, ella comenta que por medio de su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de crecer.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a person who is putting all her efforts into being someone in life. She is studying and applying herself to the utmost to help her family through her studies. She commented that through her last loan she was able to pay the fees for her studies, which was of great help in her being able to continue her studies.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to pay her university fees and in this way continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving to grow.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en: Cosmas is a Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be intelligent. He operates a brick making business where he sells bricks. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials for making bricks. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy materials for making bricks

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is a farmer from Artik town, Shirak region. He lives with his wife and their two children. In his farm Harutyun cultivates potatoes and cabbage, and after gathering the harvest in the peak seasons, sells it. Agricultural income is very important for this family's living.

Harutyun is asking lenders to help him to purchase two calves and forage for feeding the livestock. The region where they live, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region.

Harutyun's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 18 years. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy residential area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Her business goal is to have a big grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer, seeds. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds

loans.name: Kanini Kaseo Utithine Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Urbanus, a member of Kanini Kaseo Utithine group. He is aged 35 married and has two children. He has been trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on savings and resource mobilization which enabled him to raise capital and start operating a retail shop and keeping poultry within the area and also supplies to the other markets.

He is applying for Kiva loan so that he can add more stock in his retail shop and access larger markets to earn him more income and therefore be able to support his children's school fees, food and shelter.
Urbanus is grateful for Kiva and its lenders and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to add more stocks on his retail shop and access larger markets for his poultry entreprise.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Gifty lives alone in her own house, all her children are grown and are on their own. She has a business selling Kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fried fish with ground pepper. She'd got to know about this work from her mother. Now she is independent and she serves her customers on her own for twelves years.

To increase her sales that she offers her customers, she has decided to ask for a loan, with which she will be able to purchase more corn dough, firewood, fish, oil and vegetable which she will use to prepare kenkey and fried fish, and sell to her customers. Her principal objective is that her customers purchase more and, so, to have more income to support the family expenses. Her aspirations are to continue working to have a source of income which allows her to have a stable and sustainable life.

loans.use: to purchase more corn dough, firewood, fish, oil and vegetables which she will use to prepare kenkey and fried fish and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the number of chickens she can rear.

loans.name: Sokleng

texts.en:
Sokleng, 22, is a resident living in Siem Reap province. She is married and blessed with a dependent son who is too young to attend school. To make a living, she is growing rice as the main business and raising a cow as the additional business. The farming business, which bases on rainfall, sometimes has affected by drought and flooding rain; this is the challenge to the main business.

The past loan obtained from VisionFund has enabled her to improve the living condition for the family and provide healthy food and living to her son. Requesting a loan from VisionFund, Sokleng will spend her entire loan on purchasing a hectare of farmland so that she can have larger arable land to increase the outputs. She hopes to get more yields so as to better support family’s needs and to save some money to support her son’s studying in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hectare of farmland to expand her farming area so that she can increase her income to save for future need.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush is a proud owner of her farm in Getap village of Shirak region. Hranush lives with her husband and little son who is only three years old. Her husband went to a neighbouring country as a seasonal migrant worker and from time to time, supports his family financially.

To cover her daily living costs and sustain their family farm, Hransuh is the only person who takes care of their agricultural business. She keeps a cow and four calves. Hranush also cultivates wheat, potatoes, carrots and beans in the field near their house.

To be able to purchase fertilizer, cover cultivation work, and buy forage for feeding the livestock, Hranush is asking lenders for this loan. The region where they live, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region.

Hranush's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living.
Hranush hopes for her good cooperation with Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, cultivation work, and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Aleqsan

texts.en:
Aleqsan lives and works in Ejmiatsin town with his wife. He has been involved in reselling of auto repair parts for already 20 years. Almost every car owner in Ejmiatsin town knows Aleksan and his service. He has now applied for this loan to ask lenders to support him in purchasing new stock of auto repair parts for reselling to customers.

He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Aleqsan hopes for lenders' support to develop his business and cover current orders of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase auto repair parts for reselling to customers.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi  est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Akouvi  vit à Agoè  et est âgée de 43 ans. Elle fait le commerce  des  chaussures  pour gagner son revenu. Akouvi  s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des séries de paires de chaussures en vue d’augmenter ses recettes ; ce qui permettra à Akouvi de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants  et  assurer les dépenses régulières de la famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a married mother of three children. Akouvi lives in Agoè and is 43 years old.

She sells shoes to make an income. Akouvi purchases supplies four times a month at the market and is asking for this loan to order sets of pairs of shoes.

This will permit her to increase her revenue which will allow Akouvi to better prepare for her children's start of the school year and to cover the family's regular expenses.

loans.use: to buy two sets of pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Maria Erlinda

texts.es: maria de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado desde hace vario años, comercializa sus productos en los publos aledaños, y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ganado para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. She earns a living raising and selling cattle. She has been selling her products for various years now, in the nearby towns. With the income she makes she is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cattle to continue working and consequently obtain better income.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Gahaha

texts.en: Gahaha is a married mother of one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more fish. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old. She is married with 4 children. She has had a livestock selling business for 6 years. She will be using the loan to purchase cattle for sell and hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business, make more income and educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for selling and she hopes this will enable her to get more income to support her family.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as joyful. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big grocery store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 36 year old married man with 6 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He deals in transport business in addition to the salary he earns from the local government. He faces challenges of high fuel prices and bad roads that cause constant mechanical breakdowns which an expense to him. Godfrey dreams building his own house since he spends a lot on rent. He has asked for a loan to buy land where he can construct a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to buy land where he can construct a residential house for his family.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used her previous loan to pay school fees for her children in Kamwenge, Uganda. She still deals in the selling of second hand clothes as her main source of income alongside agriculture. She also earns additional income from rentals. Agnes started this business to earn a living and look after her family. She still faces a number of challenges including competition, price fluctuation,seasonal customers, and weather changes that stop customers from turning up but has hopes that she will own a wholesale boutique.

She is requesting a loan to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Medline

texts.en: Medline is a married woman. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married mother of six children. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in a populated place. Esther describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ame

texts.fr: A 24 ans, Amé est jeune femme mariée qui vit avec son enfant et son mari à Agoè. Bien consciente de son état de vulnérabilité, Amé vend des produits de beauté et exerce un boulot d’esthéticienne de verni dans les quartiers environnant. Amé achète ses produits au marché trois fois par mois et gagne son revenu. Amé désire ce crédit pour commander des vernis et autres accessoires afin de trouver un maximum de profit pour couvrir ses charges quotidiennes et améliorer ainsi ses conditions  de vie.
texts.en:
At 24 years of age, Amé is a young married woman who lives with her child and her husband in Agoè. Well aware of her state of vulnerability, Amé sells beauty products and also does nail care in neighboring areas. She buys her products in the market three times a month and earns her income.

Amé wants to have this loan so as to order nail polish and other accessories. She wants to make the maximum profit so as to cover her daily expenses and, in this way, improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one series of nail polish shades and some care accessories.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Saralanj village of Shirak region with her husband and three children. 
The family owns  arable land where Hasmik cultivates wheat and potato. 
She also keeps cows, calves and hens. 
Hasmik asks this loan to purchase  forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs. 
The region where they live, Shirak, is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs create a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in Shirak region. Hasmik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them access the market and earn a living. 
Hasmik hopes and waits for lenders' support to develop her farm and make it profitable for her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a married father of two children. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high cost of fuel. Ellias will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to own a fleet of motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: Divorcée et sans enfant, Honorine est une femme âgée de 38 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Honorine est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui travaille activement pour gagner sa vie en vue de subvenir à ses besoins. Honorine s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois  au marché et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois; ce qui lui permettra d’avoir plus de recettes et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et jouir de sa vie.
texts.en: Divorced and without children, Honorine is a 38-year-old woman who lives in Adidiogomé. She sells wood charcoal and works very hard to earn a living so she can meet her needs. Honorine gets her supplies four times per month from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase sacks of wood charcoal. This will allow her to increase her income, meet her daily needs and give her the means to enjoy her life.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of wood charcoal.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Mère  de trois enfants, Abla est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè. Agée de 38 ans, Abla fabrique des gâteaux faite à base du blé et s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Abla vend ses marchandises  à la devanture de son domicile. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de farine de blé et de l’huile en vue d’en fabriquer plus de gâteaux et répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients puis soutenir son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en: 38-year-old Abla is a married mother to three children who lives in Agoè. She cooks wheat cakes to earn a living and gets her supplies three times per month from market. Abla sells her cakes out of the front window of her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of wheat flour and oil so she can bake more cakes and better meet her customers' needs. By doing this, she will be able to support her husband in looking after their children.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of wheat flour and one container of oil.

loans.name: Akossiwa Benjamine

texts.fr: Akossiwa est une femme mariée âgée de 23 ans qui habite à Adidogomé. Mère de deux enfants, Akossiwa est une marchande des céréales qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend dans sa boutique à la maison pour gagner des revenus. Pour commander des bols de maïs, Akossiwa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Akossiwa is a 23-year-old married mother to two children who lives in Adidogomé. She earns a living through selling cereals which she purchases from market twice monthly. She then sells them out of her home in order to earn her income. Akossiwa needs this loan to purchase bowls of maize. This will allow her to make a profit which will go towards meeting her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase 82 bowls of maize.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy pipe to enable him to irrigate his farm. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large-scale business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy pipe to enable him to irrigate his farm

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en: Felicita is a married mother of two children. She describes herself as outgoing. She operates a retail business where she sells torches,solar products and other items, and also has a farm. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy a water pump for pumping water for irrigation on her farm. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for pumping water for irrigation

loans.name: Atukuzwe Group

texts.en:
Bisozi, 41, is a widow with six children, ages 7 to 22. She  belongs to Atukuzwe Group and would like a loan in the amount of (USD) $400. Bisozi requires a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. 

In the future, Bisozi plans to become an international businesswoman and provide quality education for her children up to the university level. She thanks Kiva for its support which has really improved the livelihood of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Tuungane 2 Group

texts.en:
Chakupewa is a 47-year-old woman who has been single in the eight years since her husband disappeared . She makes a living by selling goods such as second-hand shoes and baking cakes and biscuits. Her dream is to open new shops and create jobs for the people who need them the most. 

Chakupewa works every day for between six and eight hours.
 Her only goals in life are to buy her own home and give her daughter greater economic stability and a better quality of life. To achieve this, she has the help of Interactuar and those who contribute through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more second=hand shoes

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.en: Women of the Neema Group are from Kiliba Village in Uvira, located in the Democratic Republic of Congo. They came together to benefit from a new loan from Wezesha Project. This loan will be their fourth and they have an excellent record of repayment. All the group members requested a loan amount of (USD) $1,000 to buy additional shoes to resale. The last loan helped them to increase their capital, and the profit to pay the school fees for their children. Furaha (second from the left) is married, 33 years old and has five children .The business of selling second-hand shoes helps her to maintain the necessary income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Fanja Mireille

texts.fr: Fanja Mireille remercie tous les prêteurs qui l'ont aidé la dernière fois. Avec ce dit dernier prêt, elle a bien pu augmenter ses stocks, renforcer son fonds de roulement, ouvrir un autre point de vente. Cette fois, elle vous demande encore de lui donner un coup de pouce s'il vous plaît, car elle va y investir davantage, elle va pouvoir enfin acheter une machine surjeteuse et puis quelques fers carrés pour fabrication de stand, mannequins pour exposer les vêtements et des marchandises supplémentaires. Grâce à vous, elle devient très motivée à continuer à lutter et à avancer. Elle s'efforce d'épargner dans la mesure de ses possibilité afin de pouvoir réaliser son rêve d'avoir sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Fanja Mireille thanks all the lenders who helped her with her last loan. Using that loan, she was able to grow her stock, increase her working capital, and open another sales point.

This time, she is asking you to give her a hand up once more, please, because she is going to invest more. She will finally be able to buy an overlock sewing machine, some iron bars to build a stall, shop mannequins to display her merchandise on, and more merchandise to sell.

Thanks to you, Fanja Mireille is motivated to continue to work hard to move forward. She tries hard to put aside savings, as much as possible, so that she can make her dream of owning her own house come true.

loans.use: to buy some shop window mannequins, an overlock sewing machine, and some one-piece garments, etc

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is a businesswoman from Tudela. She is 66 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Carmen is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Carmen continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, and is known for her convenience store. She has successfully repaid her whole loan, which she used to buy building material, paints, and to pay her workers. She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building material, paints, and pay his workers.

loans.name: Juralyn

texts.en: Juralyn is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. Recently, she got the help of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. Someday she hopes to open a meat shop in the nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is 26 years old. He is married with 3 children. He has had a cash crop farming and livestock selling business for 6 years. He will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting and also purchase sheep and goats for sell and make more income to support his family. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and make more profits to educate his children and have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting and also purchase sheep and goats for sell and make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en: Eric is a single man. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a taxi business. His primary customers are students. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to service his taxi. His business goal is to own more vehicles within 5 years.

loans.use: to service his taxi

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos has made a living most of his life as a musician, playing at events and as a street performer. He supplemented his income working part-time at a local grocery store.

Everything changed when Carlos was diagnosed with an illness a few years back. Due to his intensive treatment schedule, he was unable to continue performing music and had to take a leave from his job at the grocery store. Not allowing his circumstances to dictate his life, Carlos utilized his artistic talents to start a street vendor business selling his artistic creations.

He is currently making and selling ants, iguanas and other "creepy crawlers” made out of river rock and wrapped with thin iron rods. Carlos has been selling his pieces of art since August 2014 at Seaport Village, a high traffic tourist area in San Diego.

What Carlos appreciates most about his business is that he gets to use his artistic abilities to make money, while not incurring any overhead.

Carlos will use his Kiva loan to purchase equipment and inventory. His ultimate goal is to continue to save money from his street vending business so he can open a mobile food vending business. This will allow him to make the most of his degree in culinary arts and maximize his passion for healthy food.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and inventory

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a remote area of South Kivu province in the Democratic Republic of Congo, Vumiliya is 44 years old and she is a mother of three dependent children. Nowadays, she sells fish as the main source of her family’s income. Meanwhile, her husband works as a construction worker to earn additional income. She has been with this business for twenty-six years.

She has been with Wezesha Project (Kiva’s partner) for five cycles already and she repaid her past loans completely. Her past loan has helped her to improve her family’s living by having enough consumption to support her family. Vumiliya is the leader of a group, which contains five members taking a Kiva loan via Wezesha project.

She is willing to take her new loan of $400 and others as well. She hopes that this loan will help her to gain more income than before.

loans.use: to buy 200 smoked fish to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Karina

texts.en: Karina lives in a town in Puebla where she owns and attends a convenient store. Having her own business was more difficult than she expected. When she opened the store she did not realize how much investment it was required and time it consumed. However she is grateful that she did it because now she has her own income. The business investment required that she put on hold the construction for her house, but having her family live with her parents is tougher than she imagined. She is asking for a credit to finish the construction. This is the first time she will receive a credit. Her lack of credit and the informality of her business are characteristics that make accessing credit from traditional lines very difficult. With this credit Karina will receive technical supervision to ensure quality and safety standards are met in the construction.

loans.use: to finish the house she is building for her family.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is 21 years old. He is not married and has no children. He does wheat farming and has been in this business for 3 years. He will be using the loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his farming business and open another business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds to use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce for sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital to buy farm inputs. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs and pay labour costs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay labour costs

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.en:
A $800.00 loan is offered to Eduarda to improve her business. She is married with three children and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day.
