She will buy some additional supplies such as rice, oil, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, cola, noodles and biscuits. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable in running her business because she can earn money every day.
Running a business has made Eduarda independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it wil improving her living condition in the future and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, coffee, cigarettes, cola, noodles and biscuits.

loans.name: Esmenia

texts.en: Esmeralda is 28 years and she is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking about how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1.000.00. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as  milk, water, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, cola, beer, sprite, body looseners, fish and rice. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy milk, water, biscuits, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, cola, beer, sprite, body looseners, fish and rice.

loans.name: Abubakah

texts.en: Abubakah is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as outgoing. He has operated a retail business where he sells shoes for the past 10 years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is a Kiva borrower. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service, maintain his motorcycle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service, maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Norberta

texts.en: Norberta is a hardworking women from a small town in Puebla. Every day she picks up piles of clothes from the nearby maquiladora and works repairing damaged goods like improperly attached buttons, removing stitches, or straightening hemlines. This work has given her family a better life for many years. With hard work from her husband, they were able to build what they call home today. However, recently a part of the structure has started slowly falling down. When technicians visited the family they could see that they were living under a dangerous structure that will eventually fall apart. This gave all the family a big scare and they have been saving to start the foundations for a proper home and repair what can be saved from their current house. Norberta is asking for a credit to complete the amount needed to buy the materials. This time, along with the credit they will receive technical supervision and guidance to ensure that the new addition and repair complies with all the safety and quality standards. Norberta is excited to have this opportunity since providing a safe home for her family is an urgent priority for her.

loans.use: to build the foundations for a new, safe house and move out of the dangerous structure she lives in.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en: Mercyline is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: La Fortune Group

texts.fr: Mariette est commerçante membre de la banque communautaire La Fortune, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 55 ans, mère  des 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un marché du centre commercial depuis 20 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en trois sacs d’haricots. Elle débuta son activité avec des fonds reçu de sa famille. Elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mariette is a small-scale retailer and member of the community loan group called La Fortune (Fortune). She is a client of MFI Hekima, married, aged 55, and the mother of six children all with some schooling. She has been selling foodstuffs in a market in the commercial center for 20 years.

Mariette is going to add to her stock by buying three sacks of dried beans. She began her business with money received from her family. She wants to pay school fees for her children and feed them. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banks.

loans.use: to add to her inventory by buying three sacks of dried beans.

loans.name: Mesaid

texts.en: Mesaid is a Kiva borrower. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells juices. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fruits for making juices. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fruits for making juices

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is constructor living in Getetap village of Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife and two sons and is the only worker in the family. 
Artur provides different type of construction works in Vayots Dzor region and as a responsible and professional worker receive many orders during the month. 
 Artur applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing construction services. He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Artur hopes to receive lenders' support and continue his works.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing construction services

loans.name: Runyararo Group

texts.en:
Judith and Chipo are the only members left in Runyararo Women’s Group. Judith, standing on the right side runs a canteen in one of the high-density suburbs in Harare. Judith and two people under her employment, spend the day cooking and serving food to their customers. In order to have a constant supply of meat in her business, she rears broilers in her backyard. At times, she sells the chickens in order to raise extra income. Judith, being a 51-year-old widowed mother of three children, works very hard to raise school fees for her children.

Chipo is 26 years old, married, and runs a salon in the same area as Judith. As a group, they received their first loan in 2013. So far, they have received four loans from Thrive and they have a good repayment history. Chipo hopes that her portion of the loan will help her buy two overhead hair driers, a tong stove and other gadgets for her salon. Judith will use her portion of the loan to buy day old chicks and supplies for her canteen. To achieve this, they are looking forward to a $1700 loan to help them grow their businesses.

loans.use: to increase the number of chickens she can rear.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
A $1,000.00 loan is offered to Filomena to improve her business. She is married and she has five children. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like noodles, cigarettes ,sugar, coffee, oil, biscuits, fish and milk. She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family. She is happy with this loan because it will improve her living conditions in the future and her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, oil, biscuits, fish and milk.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
RUOS, 39, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Inspired by her dream of owning a grocery store that she can bestow to her children someday, Gloria, 56 years old, from Tigbauan, Iloilo, is working really hard to improve her small sari-sari (variety) store. She buys usual commodities at wholesale price, then she sells them per piece to her neighbors with a little add-on price. Her profit supplements her husband’s income as a casual employee. They provide for their everyday needs and the educational expenses of their four children.

But because raising four children is really challenging, Gloria also ventures into hog raising to augment her income. She expands her business little by little towards her goal of completing her children’s education and owning a grocery store someday. But it’s a distant target yet. For now she aspires to buy more grocery items and beverages to widen the selection in her store. She applied for a PHP 15,000 loan for this purpose. Part of it will be utilized for feed and vitamins for her hogs. Hopefully, additional income from this will boost her savings for the future.

She draws encouragement from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share life stories and Bible reflections. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and beverages to widen the selection in her store.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria de Lourdes is a single mom and a proud grandmother. She feels fortunate to have her granddaughter, Maria Fernanda, living with her and being able to enjoy again all those special moments children give us. Maria de Lourdes moved into a bigger house so the family could expand. Together with income from her son, she has been able to provide the expanding family a better place to live.

She is now asking for a credit, her first one, to finish the floor of her house with tiles, and complete the plumbing of the housing. The new floor will help avoid the water coming into the house when it rains since there is still the space left between the cement floor and the doors for the tiles. It will also provide a safer and healthier environment for her granddaughter to live in. Also the new plumbing will provide more outlets for clean water and better sanitation for the house. Maria de Lourdes wants to give her family the best life she can, and wants to make sure her granddaughter lives safe, healthy and happy.

loans.use: to finish the floor of her house to keep off the water during rains and give her grand daughter a safe house.

loans.name: Fozilat

texts.ru: Фазилат женщина в возрасте 62 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Она занимается животноводством на протяжении 35 лет. Фазилат мать 5 детей и благодаря животноводству она может обеспечивать семью так, как животноводство является основным источником дохода для ее семьи. Животноводством Фазилат начала заниматься после смерти мужа, чтобы хоть как то обеспечить своих детей. Постепенно она смогла увеличить поголовье скота и от 2 до 5 взрослых дойных коров. Дополнительно Фазилат доит своих коров и продает молоко на базаре.  Таким образом она обеспечивает свою семью на протяжении всего времени. На данный момент у Фазилат возникли некоторые затруднения с финансами из-за понижения цены на скот. На полученные деньги она хочет закупить корм для скота и молодняк для дальнейшего откорма.
texts.en: Fozilat is a 62 year old woman who lives in a rural area. She has been raising animals for the past 35 years. Fozilat has five children, and she has been able to support them thanks to animal husbandry, as it provides the primary source of income for her family. She began this work after her husband's death as a means to somehow support her children. She was able to incrementally increase her number of animals from two to five grown dairy cows. In addition Fozilat milks the cows and sells the milk at market. This is how she has supported her family all of this time. Currently Fozilat has come up against several financial issues due to a decrease in the price of animals. She wants to use the funds received to buy feed for her animals and a young cow for further fattening.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Neema Ya Golgotha Group

texts.en:
Mwanyuke is a 33-year-old married woman. She has 6 children including a newborn baby. She repaid her last loan without any problems and she's now requesting a new loan to reinvest in her business. She will put the earnings towards savings and her children's school fees.

Neema ya Golgotha is a group of businesswomen, part of the Wezesha project in the city of Bukavu. This will be the group's 6th loan and they have an excellent record of repayment.
This group of 5 women from Bukavu is a very active group, and they are all very brave women.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of soap.

loans.name: Aslia

texts.en:
Aslia is very grateful and thankful for the loan granted to her by Kiva in the amount of PhP 80,000 in which she used to buy items of summer clothing as additional items she can sell in her clothing store. Aslia clothing store has increased its income as there are more clothes the costumers can choose from. Aslia also was able to pay her loan on time and the revenue of her income helps a lot with their expenses and the school expenses of her children.

Aslia now has steady regular customers ordering bulk of her clothes. There are pile of orders now for this coming holiday and she wanted to take the opportunity to stock clothes where in its more cheaper compared to buying in holiday season to sell. This way she can increase her income more and still sell her clothes in affordable price.

Aslia is requesting a re-loan in the amount of PhP 100,000 to buy more clothes like dresses, blouses and other items she can sell and supply to her customers.

Aslia is continuously managing her store as she now saving to expand her store. She working hard to provide for her family especially for the education of her 6 children and at the same time helping her community by providing employment to her neighbors.

loans.use: to buy more clothes like dresses, blouses and other items she can sell and supply to her customers.

loans.name: Kieu

texts.en: Mrs. Kieu is a hardworking woman, 29 years old. She is married and has a baby. Her family’s income is mainly from salary and husbandry. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena is 64 years old, married with 3 adult age children from Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She is a member of Paglaum MPC since year 2006 to access its financial services for small time borrower like her. Recently, she avails a loan to restock store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, soap and shampoo.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, noodles, coffee, vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Jessie has been effectively working with her farm, harvesting her fruits and selling them in the market. She earns well and now wants to increase her income. She requested a new loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.  The loan will help her to produce good quality fruits to bring to the market.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso es un hombre campesino con 42 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, dedicado a realizar labores de campo desde muy pequeño, actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. De allí obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir la mayoría de sus necesidades.
Con esto ha tenido un buen progreso, tiene un gran cultivo de café y cuenta con 3 empleados. 
Trabaja 4 días a la semana durante 8 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá principalmente en el pago de sus empleados y en la compra de abonos, venenos y semillas.

Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva muchos años de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.
 
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a 42-year-old farmer. He is single and does not have any children. He has been engaged in field work since he was very little. He learned this occupation thanks to the teachings of his parents. From this, he obtains the necessary income to cover the majority of his needs.

With this he has had good progress. He has a good crop of coffee and employs three people. He works four days a week for eight hours.

He is requesting a loan which he will invest primarily in paying his employees and to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds.

His greatest dream is to improve the conditions of his home, since it has been many years since it was built and its current state is not the best. You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.

loans.use: to pay his employees and to buy fertilizer, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
This group, Agape, consists of five women who all sell fish and always repay their loans successfully.

Mrs. Munyekelwa (shown first on the left) is the representative of this group and she is requesting a new loan because she ended the last one successfully. She is married, 27 years old, and the mother of 5 children. In order to increase her capital, she is requesting a new loan from the Wezesha Project. Munyekelwa says the last loan helped her so much. She is a very brave woman. Her earnings will go towards savings and helping her husband take care of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario VENUS, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras, viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Bernice: Es la Coordinadora, es una señora de 37 años de edad, alegre y sonriente, madre soltera de un adolescente de 12 años que estudia su primer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos vende de manera ambulantes cosméticos y productos de belleza. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua perfumes, cremas corporales, pinturas de labio, de uña, maquillaje, entre otros productos para venderlos de manera accesible a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con tener el suficiente capital para establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The "VENUS" communal bank is made up of 3 enterprising women who live in the city of Bilwi. They got together 8 months ago with the aim of working together to be able to access loans from Pana Pana. This would allow them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, improve their incomes and thus little by little improve the living conditions of their families.

Bernice is the coordinator. She is a happy and smiling 37 year old woman . She is the single mother of a 12 year old adolescent who is studying in his first year of secondary school. With the goal of getting her family ahead and having her own source of income she sells cosmetics and beauty products itinerantly.

She is requesting a loan to buy in Managua, perfume, body cream, lipstick, nail polish and make-up amongst other products to sell at accessible prices to her clients in Bilwi. She dreams of having enough capital to open a store selling new clothing.

loans.use: to buy perfume, body cream, lipstick, nail polish, make-up amongst other products in Managua.

loans.name: Li Kauhla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres (María Auxiliadora, Emiteria  y Regina), todas son de la etnia miskita de la ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos, pulpería y carne de cerdo; se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 3 añoss para gestionar préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.  El nombre de Li Kauhla, que tomaron para su grupo solidario es en lengua mískita que significa Agua Helada.  

Regina: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora de 46 años de edad amable, casada con 4 hijos: 1 mayor de edad y 3 adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Con el propósito de contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, vende carne de cerdo, cuajada, queso, crema, frijoles cocidos y bastimento, en uno de los mercados de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comercializar carne de cerdo. Ella sueña con  establecer una carnicería.
texts.en:
This solidarity group consists of three women (María Ester, María Auxiliadora, Emiteria and Regina). They are all from the Miskita ethnic group, from the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They are entrepreneurial women that fight every day to grow their small businesses which sell seafood, groceries and pork. They organised the solidarity group roughly three years ago, in order to manage loans with a joint loan guarantee from Pana Pana. The name Li Kauhla, which they chose for the group, means frozen water in Miskita.

Regina is a member of the solidarity group. She is a woman of 46 years. She is kind, married and has four children: one of them is of age, and the other three are teenagers who are studying in primary and secondary school. With the goal of helping to cover household expenses as well as her children's education, she sells pork meat, cottage cheese, cheese, cream, cooked beans and side dishes at one of the markets in the city of Bilwi. She is requesting a loan to buy and sell pork meat. She dreams of setting up a butcher shop.

loans.use: to buy and sell pork meat.

loans.name: Chroeb

texts.en: Chroeb is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. Selling coconut is a main source of her family’s income, and construction work is an additional source of income which she has been involved in for twenty-five years. Increased competition has hurt her business,  and she is able to earn only 7USD to use for her family’s living expenses. Now, she is applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy more coconut to attract more customers and will use the rest of money to renovate her old house. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income by increasing the number of sales.

loans.use: to buy more coconut to attract more customers in order to earn more income by increasing the number of sales.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Mrs. Lien is a hard-working woman, 29 years old. She is married and has one child. Her family’s income is mainly from a small business. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en: Mrs. Tho  is 38 years old, married and has one child. She lives in rural area and raising poultry and cattle are her main job, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her living standard, especially her children.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Mrs. Duyen is a hard-working woman, 54 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve the health of her family members and also for environmental protection. Her family’s income comes from husbandry and cultivation so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Hy

texts.en:
HY is a 48-year-old woman from a remote area of Kompong Speu Province. She is a mother of six children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, grows rice for sale. She is able to make an income USD 3.00 per day, on average. So far, he has been involved in this type of business for around twenty years.

She would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen less smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this kind of loan product, HKL has offered a special interest rate than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es:
Oscar es un hombre casado con 44 años de edad, padre de un menor de edad, que  debido a una fuerte situación económica la cual vivió luego de quedarse sin empleo durante tres meses, se dedicó la cría de ganado, un medio por el cual vio una salida a la mayoría de sus problemas.
Trabaja tres días a la semana entre 5 y 6 horas diarias.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismos.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Oscar is a married man of 44. He is the father of a minor child. Thanks to a strong economic situation that he experienced after being without employment for three months, he is raising livestock, a means through which he saw an exit from the majority of his problems. He works between 5 and 6 hours daily, three days a week.

Now he is applying for a loan that he will invest in the purchase of pigs and feed for them.

His positive attitude and desires to get ahead allow his immense will to improve himself and a positive response to his application to be seen in this man. Be inspired, and make a loan!

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them..

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has managed her rice field for many long years. She's earning well and has been able to sustain her family's living condition. With her generated income, she was able to successfully pay her previous loan used for the business. With her access to GDMPC, she was able to improve her business.

Recently, Susan took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field and was able to bring plenty of rice to market. She plans to use the additional profit generated by the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Se

texts.en: Mrs. Se is a hard-working woman, 50 years old. She is a single mom. Her income comes mainly from husbandry and cultivation. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her children, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en:
Maria is a 50-year-old woman who has been married for a long time, pictured here with her husband at their business. She has 4 daughters who economically depend on her and help her with her business. Maria's family earns a living from the fish store they own. Maria and her husband have been in the fish-selling business for almost 22 years and they have owned their own store since 2007. It is a big accomplishment for them to own the whole store along with a pair of trucks which they use for logistics.

Maria has been thinking about growing her business by increasing her stock and improving her current store. She wants to buy a larger stock of fish to meet client demand, but a bigger stock requires more care and additional tools. To address this, she wants to buy a new refrigerator to keep the fish fresh and new knives to be able to work faster.

In order to increase her profits, Maria is asking for a $15,000 MXN loan. She has had previous loans and repaid them on time, so the people of Kubo are confident that she will succeed with her plan.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.en:
Maria Elena lives in Xochimilco. She feels fortunate to have her whole family living with her, especially her grandson Leonardo, and being able to enjoy again all those special moments children give us. Maria Elena is building a new home, together with her husband and children, so they can all live together.

She is now asking for a credit to finish the floor of her house with tiles, and complete the plumbing of the housing. She works as a clerk at a local auditing office, but is paid by the hour with no social security. This makes her job informal and almost impossible to access credit. The additions she wants to make to the house will provide a safer and healthier environment for her grandson to live in. The new plumbing will also provide more outlets of clean water and better sanitation for the house. Maria Elena wants to give her family the best life she can, and wants to make sure her grandson lives safe, healthy and happy. With the credit she will also receive technical supervision to make sure that the construction complies with quality and safety standards.

loans.use: to install plumbing and have access to water and finish the floor of her home

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is 60 years old and married with no dependents. She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items like noodles, biscuits, eggs, sugar, canned goods, cooking oil, shampoo, and seasonings. For almost 20 years now she has been running a sari-sari store. Aside from running the store, she also engages in farming, growing and selling rice.

Leonesa has requested a loan to buy groceries and supplies, such as fertilizers, for the farm. It is essential for Leonesa to continue to operate her store and also boost the yield of her farm. By doing so, she could expand both of her sources of income to become productive and sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her store and supplies, such as fertilizers, for her farm.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
El Sr. Vidal es de la ciudad de Santaní, esta esforzándose y luchando para poder ser alguien en la vida, tiene una carnicería en donde trabaja y se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior le ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Vidal hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de ganados para poder faenar y vender en su carnicería, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Vidal is from the city of Santaní. He is making an effort and striving to be someone in life. He has a butcher shop where he works and strives to be able to improve his living conditions and those of his loved ones. He says that the previous loan was a lot of help to him in being able to continue with his studies. Vidal is asking for this new loan to invest in buying cattle to butcher and sell in his butcher shop, which will be of great help in enabling him to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy cattle to butcher

loans.name: Kantutas De Las Lomas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTAS DE LAS LOMAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de polleras, venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de banderines, venta de overoles, venta de ropa deportiva.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de banderines; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de banderines por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Kantutas De Las Lomas credit group will begin its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub.  It is made up of nine members and is lead by a Board of Directors, of which Maria is the president.  The group members work in a variety of businesses, among them: pollera [traditional multi-layered skirts] sales, blanket sales, food sales, pennant sales, overalls sales, and sportswear sales.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small-time entrepreneurs, one of whom is Maria.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  She currently has a business selling pennants.  She shares that she learned this line of work from her parents a number of years ago.

The loan she is currently taking out is to increase her working capital (to buy pennants in bulk).  She will get these from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto and later will sell them in the El Alto markets.  This type of work allows her to earn money to support her family financially, because she is a widow and has four children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy pennants in bulk

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is 28 years old, married and has three children. She works hard to support her family. She would like to improve her family’s living standard, especially her children but she lacks capital. The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine. Her husband runs rudimentary trucks and  with support from him,  she is able to repay the loan from farming and husbandry.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una persona trabajadora, honesta y  responsable es muy dedicada al estudio, está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad y por medio de ella quiere poder abrir su propio estudio para seguir esforzándose por ser un buen profesional.
Clara pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder destacarse y ser una profesional reconocida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera  y de esa forma poder seguir sus estudios.
texts.en:
Clara is a hardworking, honest, and responsible individual who is extremely dedicated to her studies. She is continuing toward a degree in Accounting because she wants to open her own practice so that she can keep striving toward becoming a successful professional.

Clara is known for giving her best effort so that she can become a recognized professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Jovis

texts.en:
Jovis has been working in her small grocery store. Aside from that, she has also been selling vegetables in their town. She has been earning for almost ten years, and she was able to pay off her previous loan successfully.

Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more goods to sell in order to produce the quality of products that the customers need.

She wants to improve the business as well as the general living conditions of the entire family, and also she wants to repair her small store and make a bigger one.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. she will use anticipated profits pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
Kris is an entrepreneur who is trying to bring a kitchen incubator to Newark. Being familiar with the Newark area, Kris realized that there were many chefs, bakers, and caterers in the city who were looking for space to rent where they could cook their food. The problem was that there were no commercial kitchens or incubators that would support these entrepreneurs by renting out kitchen space.

Sensing an opportunity, Kris left her job working at a non-profit to go to work in kitchens around the state to learn as much as she could about what it's like to run a kitchen incubator. She also enrolled in an entrepreneur training course to teach her the business management skills she needed to run a business of her own. Now, armed with the skills and potential customers, Kris is ready to open her own kitchen incubator to serve the entrepreneurs who need her help.

This loan will help Kris with start-up costs like payments for her kitchen and equipment.

loans.use: to pay for start-up costs to get her kitchen incubator business running.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells flour, milk, bread,sugar and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap,bread and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap,bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand her range of traditional African clothing for sale.

loans.name: Irma Antonia

texts.en:
Irma is a 67-year-old single woman. She has a son, but he is now a grown man and she doesn't provide for him. Irma owns an incredible book store with her son, although she is the main owner. She takes all of the big calls while her son helps with accounts.

Irma makes a living by working in her book store, where she also sells coffee. The main idea is that when a person buys a book, they can stay awhile in the store, enjoying a coffee and the new book. She wants to improve her store so she is requesting a $10,600 MXN loan to buy furniture to make her place more comfortable and to expand her variety of books for sale.

loans.use: To buy books

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a fish vendor in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 53-year-old married woman with seven children. Her youngest child is 13. Three of her children are still attending school. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years now. Her husband earns a living by being a driver.

She has decided to take a loan to buy more stock of fish and foam (for fish storage). These resources are very important in improving her daily income. Thus, she could be able to settle her obligation and start to handle her finances. She could also provide for the needs of her growing children.

In the future, Prudencia is hopeful that someday she will be able to expand her business to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and foam (for fish storage).

loans.name: Heming

texts.en: Heming is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be humble. He operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain which affects business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service,maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to buy more motorcycles within 5 years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service,maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 27 years old, married and supports three children. He runs a business of motorcyle service for the last five years. Right now his monthly income is ksh12,000. He is taking loan of ksh 113,500 to purchase a motocyle for transporting goods from the market as well as customers from one place to another. He would use the profit to buy spare parts for the motorcycle and pay school fees for his children

This is his first loan from Visionfund Kenya. His hopes and dreams for future business are to buy a plot for a rental house and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcyle for transporting goods  from the market as well as customers.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is hairdresser in Gyumri town. She lives with her husband and three little kids. As she has little kids to take care of in her house, and to be able to work in her house, she needs a separate room. That's the reason she asks this loan to pay for renovation of the room that she will use as an in-house beauty salon.

Lusine has requested a loan from local financial institutions, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Lusine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Please help this hard working and enthusiastic hairdresser to accomplish her goals and continue providing her beloved work.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the room to provide hairdressing service in her house.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en: Zawadi is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells milk, bread,sugar,flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk, bread and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, milk, bread and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан мужчина 40 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Он обратился в Арванд, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Хасан  живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Хасана также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Хасан  занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Хасан  подрабатывает мастером. От данного бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Хасану в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Хасан  хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Хасан  очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hasan is a 40-year-old married man with three children. He approached Arvand when he found out about the possibility of receiving financial support. He lives with his family in a rural area. He doesn't have a higher education since he never had the chance to study at university due to family financial difficulties. Hasan's wife doesn't have an education either and is a homemaker who takes care of household chores and raises the children. 

Hasan runs his own business in order to earn a living. He works fattening and reselling livestock, and also works on the side as a handyman. He receives a good income from this business. His wife also helps him with his work - she sells the milk they get from the cows. He now wants to increase his quantity of animals in order to expand his business. Therefore he has approached Arvand and wants to take out a loan to buy a cow. He hopes very much for the desired result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy, living in Kampong Cham province, is a 23-year-old mother of two dependent children who are both in school.

Growing rice on one hectare area of farmland and working as a paid worker have been the sources of her family’s income for many years. Due to drought, her rice has grown not well and it causes her to earn a very low income. To overcome this hardship, she is now applying for a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase her crop yield, and take the remaining money to renovate her old wooden house.

This is her second loan cycle and the past loan helps her to be able to keep her children in school. For this new loan, she wishes to gain more yield than the previous season by having enough fertilizer for her farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to increase her crop yield and income to support her children's studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 100 chicks and 2 sacks of feed

loans.name: Marquetalia Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Marquetalia” está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucia, quien es una humilde y trabajadora señora, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, y con este humilde trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, que la enorgullece.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group named “Marquetalia” is in its first loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey so that all of them can put forth their best effort in order to grow and improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Sra. Lucia, who is a humble and hardworking woman. She says that she sells natural remedies. Through this modest form of work, she is able to earn a decent and honest living that gives her pride.

Lucia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in natural remedies to sell. This will allow her to continue her sales just as before and be able to keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Elithaflor

texts.en:
Elithaflor wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for approving her previous loan as she was able to buy sacks of charcoal to add to the business. She noticed that there’s an increase in her daily sales since she’s able to provide now bulk quantities of orders to clients. She believes that God will return the favor to those people with kind hearts.

Elithaflor is challenged as to how God uses people as an answer for her prayers. She wants to succeed in the business so that she’ll be able to help others as well. Since there’s an increase in her daily sales, she also wants to have supporting capital so that every week she’ll be able to buy sacks of charcoal. With this, she will apply for a loan of 12,000 PHP and is hoping that lenders will once again consider her story.

Elithaflor is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services and also sells cosmetics. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 39 years old and married to Cirilo, a bill distributor, and their children are in school. They live in Tigbauan, Iloilo in the Visayas region. Deborah has raised hogs in her backyard for the past 15 years. According to Deborah, hog raising is quite tiring but she focuses on its sustainability and its contribution to food production for the community.

Aside from raising hogs, Deborah earns money from her food stall business where she sells cooked viands and snacks. The food stall provides a more stable daily income compared to hog raising, which takes several months to yield a return on her investment.

Several weeks ago, she incurred huge expenses for her son's seaman’s application. It almost depleted her business capital. Nevertheless, she’s confident that her son’s work as a seaman will help improve her family's living conditions.

Deborah is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy feed for her hogs and ingredients for her food stall business. She plans to sell a fattened hog in the next few weeks which will allow her to recover her expenses. She aims to steadily improve her hog raising venture to attain her dream of owning a large piggery someday.

She shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She’s a dedicated member of the organization where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and the sharing of life experiences.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is an accountant with many years of experience working in that field. For over 20 years, Zhanna has provided an accounting service for local entrepreneurs in Gyumri, where she lives with her husband Varujan, who is 70 years-old.
Zhanna asks this loan to purchase printer and laptop needed for her work.

Several times she has requested a loan from local financial institutions, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because her business isn't registered as a formal business. Zhanna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
Zhanna hopes to receive lenders' support as the purchase will be very helpful for her work.

loans.use: to pay for printer and laptop needed for providing accountant service for local entrepreneurs in Gyumri town.

loans.name: Malkani

texts.en: Malkani  is 52 years old, married woman having three children, doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her son who is also shown in the photo. They hardly manage to fulfill their basic necessities. After purchasing small animals they raise them and sell them in the local market. For the improvement of her business, she has requested a loan of 45000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. .

loans.name: Astar

texts.en: Astar  is 44 years old; she is a married woman.  In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells their milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik has been involved in retail of fruit and vegetable for 5 years in Ljevan town. He lives with his parents, wife and two kids and is the only breadwinner in the family.

Edik asks this loan to pay for new stock of fruit and vegetables to sell in the market. He has requested this loan within the framework of a joint program between Kiva and SEF. The Start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Edik hopes to receive lenders' support and have a good sales during this coming season.

loans.use: to pay for stock of fruit and vegetables to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two 2-month-old pigs and a sack of feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase women's shoes and toys

loans.name: Oudomrith

texts.en:
Oudomrith is 21 years old. He is a single security guard at a micro finance institution. He resides with his parents in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. He has worked in the province since 2014, earning approximately $4.83 per day. His parents are rice farmers.

Currently, Oudomrith is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management at a university in the province. Due to the fact that he is short on finances to pay his fourth year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough to cover his university fees and go through the fourth year successfully.

As for his dreams, he wants to find a proper job with a reasonable salary so that he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his fourth year tuition fees.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose vive en la ciudad de Curuguaty, está estudiando la carrera de agronomía, a través de la cual quiere poder ser un buen profesional y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Jpse es una persona muy luchadora que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir con sus sueños.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the city of Curuguaty and is studying for a degree in Agronomy. Through his education, he wants to become a successful professional and be able to help his loved ones.

Jose is a determined individual who gives his best effort in order to accomplish his dreams. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his degree fees. This will enable him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth, 53, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of two children.  To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily grows cassava and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for thirty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farmland. To continue her family’s farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita engages in buying and selling. She sold mangoes, rice cake and tempura (a dish of sea foods, meat or vegetables that is battered and deep fried). Aside from that, she also goes farming. She grows rice. 
She is a married woman with no dependent. Her husband is a farmer.
She needs additional capital to finance her business.

She has requested a loan to to purchase  stocks like mangoes, rice cake and tempura and buy supplies for farm like fertilizers and pay for the laborers. With these, she could improve her earnings and able to pay her obligation. She could also provide healthy diets which is essential in her day to day livelihood activity.

Lolita hopes that she will be able to handle her livelihood properly to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase  stocks like mangoes, rice cake and tempura and buy supplies for farm like fertilizers and pay for the laborers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up with five bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Andema Group

texts.fr: Nankafu est commerçante conseillère du groupe solidaire Andema, cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 46 ans, mère  des 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des boissons sucrées sur la route principale de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 100 caisses de boissons sucrées. Elle débuta son activité avec des fonds reçu après avoir vendu une portion de son champ. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Nankafu is a merchant and the advisor of the solidarity group “Andema’. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married, 46 years old, and the mother of six children, all provided with education. She has been a seller of soft drinks for 12 years on the main road in town. She is going to stock up with 100 cases of soft drinks. She began her business with funds from selling part of her field.

Her wish is to grow her business and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with 100 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en: Leonides is operating a tailoring shop in her village to make a living. For more than 5 years, Leonides has earned well and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for tailoring needs. Recently, she took a new loan to repair and buy an additional sewing tools and clothing materials need. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair and buy additional sewing tools and clothing materials

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 38-year-old resident of Batasan, Philippines and a new member of Center of Community Transformation (CCT). While her husband Roy is at work, Rosemarie is in charge of the household chores and she is involved currently in a direct-selling business, where she sells personal products to her friends and neighbors like lotion, soap, make-up and such. She is earning about PHP 9,000 every month.

Since there is always an increase in market price, Rosemarie dreams of having her business expanded where she can have complete products to put on her display cabinet. This will increase her daily sales. Usually a customer will wait for a week or two to have the products they ordered. However, if there’s an availability of the product, there’s no need for them to wait for weeks, which will improve customers’ experience and will result in customer loyalty.

With this, Rosemarie has applied for a PHP 8,000 loan and praying that CCT would approve the amount. Rosemarie is consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made her become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy personal items like lotion, soap, and make-up for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Kheang's Group

texts.en: The members of Kheang’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Kheang makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor and sells cakes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. Saumu owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Saumu operates a firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business. With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Lela

texts.en:
Lela is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over seven years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai, 55 years old, she is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and two children. Husbandry and farming are main income source of her family. Additional, she is also a hired labour and earn about 120000VND/ day.With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nhung

texts.en: Mrs. Nhung is 36 years old, married and has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitary  latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Farming is main income source of her family and she is able to pay the loan monthly from chicken raising activity.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Muhammad-Ali

texts.en:
Muhammad-Ali is a young, single man, who is 20 years old. He lives in the city of Tursun-zoda.

Muhammad-Ali is a very nimble person. He provides for himself and his family. He is a taxi driver and he has run his business well and is able to recruit more clients. This year, his clients decreased because of his uncomfortable car. It requires him to change some spare parts and the engine. So he applied for a loan to solve his business problem.

Muhammad-Ali hopes that he will increase the numbers of his clients and his daily income will grow accordingly.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda has been selling grocery items  for many years. She earns well from the business and was able to provide the needs of her family.She has also successfully repaid her previous loan she used in the business. She was determined enough in sustaining here business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods and additional items to sell to her customers. In the future, she wants to improve the business and save more money.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear clothing to sell.

location.town: Sagrada Familia, Tambulig, Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Ma. Eliza

texts.en:
Ma. Eliza hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has three children ages 17, 14 and 6 years old. Her husband has an income that could help cover the family's daily expenses.

For the past 10 years, Ma. Eliza has engaged in selling fresh fish and crab. She sells to the locals in her place. She has requested a loan to buy stocks of fish and crab. This will help boost her family income. Thus, it will enable her to settle her obligations and start to balance her finances.

She would like to expand her business to support the welfare of her children and to have better living conditions as well.

loans.use: to buy  stocks of fish and crab

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a single woman with no children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, juice, cooking oil and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking a long time to pay for goods bought on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, juice, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, juice, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en: Mrs. Luyen is 62 years old, she is a hardworking woman. There are four people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and cultivation are main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Sreynoun's Group

texts.en: The members of Sreynoun’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreynoun makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Teang's Group

texts.en: The members of Teang’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Teang makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a tailor and sells cakes to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en: The members of Mun’s Group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Mun makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 56 year old, married woman. She is a mother of 4 children.

Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She aspires to save money for providing a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

loans.name: Buganvilias Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank Buganvillas group has just begun its third loan cycle with Kiva investors. Buganvillas has 8 very hardworking members who live in Guatemala’s second largest city, Quetzaltenango, about 128 miles northwest of Guatemala City. Most of the women in the group have businesses making huipiles (blouses), delantales (aprons), and cortes (traditional wrap-around skirts). They are very grateful to Kiva investors for believing in them enough to have funded their loan request. Because of this, they have been able to make their homes more comfortable, buy necessary school supplies for their children, and increase the revenue of their businesses.

Julia is the dedicated and responsible Secretary of the group. She is 31 years old and has 2 children to support. Her business is making cortes, traditional wrap-around skirts which she decorates with metallic threads. Although she only has a 4th grade education, Julia has been able to support her family by selling her skirts at both the retail level and wholesale levels. With the new loan, she wants to buy high-quality thread and a loom in order to increase her production of traditional Quetzaltenango skirts for the end of the year, when demand is very high.

At their monthly meetings, Julia and her fellow Trust Bank members happily share their experiences and learn about new educational topics from a Friendship Bridge Facilitator. This is part of the non-formal education program, Microcredit Plus, that makes up the win-win combination of education and micro-loans.

Many thanks to Kiva investors for helping these women overcome poverty and for opening doors to a brighter future for themselves, their families and their community!

loans.use: to buy high-quality thread and a loom in order to expand her textile business.

loans.name: Samrors

texts.en:
SAMRORS, 35, lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. So far, she has been in his types of business for more than ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 2.00 a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine and buy its facilities. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila hails in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She engages in making native crab trap made of bamboo. 
She is 49-years old married woman with two children. Her youngest child is 12 and still attending school.
Her husband's occupation is a construction worker. She has been producing and selling crab trap for more than 10 years now.
 
She  is asking for a loan to buy materials like wood and bamboo. These resource are tools that could improve the livelihood of Leonila. Thus, she could produce more supplies and sold it to her respective clients.
These will augment her income and continue provide the needs of her family.

Leonila is determined that she  could support her child's education  by handling her resources well to become sustainable as well.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood and bamboo

loans.name: Babylin

texts.en:
She is Babylin, aged 49, from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She’s a wholesaler of charcoal in their community and nearby areas. Her husband, Reynaldo, is a businessman who helps in her business through purchasing, marketing and supervising of four workers who produce charcoal from wood.

Charcoal making and selling is very common in the provinces of Iloilo and Negros because it is used in grilling “chicken inasal” or barbeque chicken which is one of the icon products of these provinces due to its savory taste and aroma. It is also used in household cooking as alternative to LPG and electric stove.

However, Babylin experiences difficulty in reserving logs and wood this time. She plans to survey the nearby towns if there are fallen trees due to typhoons. She will buy and produce these into charcoal. She needs PHP 13,000 additional capital for this. Additional income from this will continuously support her family and the families of her four workers. 

Babylin desires to open another business in due time. She dreams that her daughter will pursue her studies until completion. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fallen trees as source of wood and charcoal

loans.name: Ton's Group

texts.en: Ton is age 45 years old and a mother of three children, living in Battambang province. Selling coconut is a main source of her family’s income and construction working is an additional source of income for her that she has been involved in for ten years. The depreciated of the coconut price is the main challenge for her that causes her to earn lower income than before. This is the third loan cycle for Ton while the other one in her group is the first loan cycle. She is willing to use her entire loan portion to buy more coconuts to sell in order to increase her selling amount. She hopes to earn more income so that she can be able to expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell in order to increase her selling amount so that she can be able to expand her current business in the future.

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen is a hardworking woman, 45 years old. She lives with her  children. The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
This is Armando’s small place where he repairs watches and jewelry. It’s a movable post; he chooses a populous spot to stay for several weeks, then he will transfer to another busy place. For now, it’s located downtown, near a tricycle terminal in Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. His usual customers are commuters and passersby. He’s chasing the crowd in order to earn enough income for his family.

Armando is very keen on details and he knows how to repair small watches and jewelry. He’s been doing this for 22 years already so he has memorized all the parts and arrangements of various watches. His income provides for his family of six children. His wife, Nemia, supports him through proper housekeeping and nurturing of their children.

Armando longs to obtain additional capital worth PHP 14,000 that he will use to buy batteries and other accessories for his business. He also plans to buy gold-plated jewelry to sell. It will surely enhance his business that will lead to higher income and savings. It’s his dream to open a jewelry shop in the near future. He wants to see his children finish their schooling and acquire stable jobs someday.

He shares his experiences with his co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meet every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy batteries and other accessories for his watch repair business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong is 48 years old, has two children. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can improve the health of her family’s member, especially her children. She has daily income from pig raising activity  so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family
