loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Mrs. Thuy is a hard working woman, 42 years old. She is married and has  two children. She would like to improve her living standard. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine and she is able to repay the loan from selling chicken, duck, pig and vegetables.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Orom

texts.ru: Ором женщина в возрасте 49 лет проживающая в сельской местности. Ором  вот уже на протяжении 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает молодой скот и откормив продает за более высокую цену. Животноводством Ором  начала заниматься после того как вышла замуж. Видя что мужу одному трудно обеспечивать семью она решила купить пару голов крупного скота и откормив пару месяцев продала. На вырученные деньги она купила еще скот и таким образом постепенно смогла увеличить поголовье скота.  Муж Ором  работает строителем на частной стройке и по сезону ездит в Россию на заработки, но тех денег,  что он зарабатывает не хватает для обеспечения всех потребностей семьи.  На данный момент бизнес Ором  является основным источником дохода для их семьи. Сейчас у Ором  возникли некоторые трудности с финансами из-за упадка цены на скот. Она не может продать взрослый скот не потеряв часть прибыли. С данной проблемой она решила обратится в «АРВАНД» за финансовой поддержкой. На полученные деньги Ором  хочет купить корм для скота и скот.
texts.en:
Orom is a 49-year-old woman living in a rural location. Orom has been rearing animals for ten years. She buys young cattle and, having fattened them, sells them for a higher price. Orom began rearing animals after she got married. Seeing that it was hard for her husband to provide for the family on his own, she decided to buy a couple of heads of cattle and sold them after having fattened them for a couple of months. She bought more cattle with the money she received and in this way she was gradually able to increase her herd. Orom's husband works as a builder on a private construction site and goes to Russia seasonally to earn money, but the money that he earns is insufficient to provide for all of the family's needs.

At the present time Orom's business is the main source of income for their family. Now Orom has some financial difficulties due to the fall in the price of cattle. She is not able to sell her mature cattle without losing some of her profit. She has decided to apply to Arvand for financial support with this problem. Orom wants to buy cattle feed and cattle with the money she will receive.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and cattle for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Phoustine

texts.en:
Phoustine is a married mother of one child who attends school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with five children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her biggest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a cafe business for three years, selling to neighbors and the passersby. She mentioned a challenge with seasonality in her business. In addition, she also operates a fruit-selling business which is another source of income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase plastic tables, chairs, wheat flour, cooking oil and rice for her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic tables, chairs, wheat flour, cooking oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is encouraged that she was granted a loan, which really helped sustain and grow her dried fish selling business. Life in a third world country maybe difficult, but Marites is happy and content as long as her family is intact and helping each other.

She trusts that she will be able to access a Php 20,000 loan to pay for several packs of various kinds of dried fish to sell in her community.

Her business means a lot to her, for it is the main source of income to feed her family and send her children to school. She also assists some of her grandchildren in their schooling.

Marites dreams to own a vehicle and have her own store to sell her dried fish. She aims to have their house repaired. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various kinds of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years she has owned a food stall business, selling to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a mobile money transfer (mpesa) business the two years, serving people in the community. She faces a major of theft in her business.

Zuhura wants to start another business, selling clothes. With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Flor Del Paisaje Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group Flor del Paisaje, or “Flower of the Landscape”, is located in Santa Catarina Ixtahuacán, Guatemala. Because of the kindness and generosity of Kiva investors one year ago, this group of women received a loan. They are happy to report that the loan has helped them a great deal. Their businesses are more productive as well as more stable.

Juana is a 39-year-old group member who has expanded her business due to her increased earnings. She is now able to raise and sell more chickens and pigs. Juana is very grateful for the loan as she is the sole breadwinner for her family. She also appreciates the opportunity to participate in the monthly educational trainings given by Friendship Bridge Facilitators that help her improve her business (through budgeting, marketing, pricing, customer service, and accounting trainings), her family life (through nutrition, hygiene, health, and medical plant use trainings), and herself (through self-esteem, empowerment, and goal-setting trainings). Friendship Bridge calls this winning combination of education and loans Microcredit Plus.

Currently, Juana reports that her animal husbandry business is stable and she plans to start an additional business making huipiles, or traditional blouses. The huipiles from her town are especially beautiful and filled with colorful flowers. She is requesting a loan to purchase a large quantity of alpaca, wool, and silk thread as well as clothing dye. This enterprising woman looks forward to creating an inventory of beautiful huipiles that will attract customers.

Kiva investors are valuable partners to Juana and her friends in the Trust Bank group. Armed with their new tools, they are poised to step into a brighter and more prosperous future benefitting themselves, their families, and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors! You are very appreciated by Juana and the women of the Flor del Paisaje Trust Bank group!

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of alpaca, wool, and silk thread as well as clothing dye.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 43 years old and a married woman. She has been doing business, purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband, for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of four children. She is working very hard, to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves, to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves, to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Musrat is 27 years old and a married woman. She has been in business owning a beauty parlor for many years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. That is why she has applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR -- to buy hair care products, skin care products, and hair rollers. These will enable her to treat more customers and gain profits with which to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin care products, and hair rollers, which will enable her to treat more customers and gain profits with which to build her own house.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Yenifer Andrea

texts.es: Yennifer es una joven emprendedora que guiada por sus instintos mercantiles hace una año decidió aprovechar el pequeño capital que le entregó su padre e invertirlos en ropa, calzado, perfumes y artículos para el hogar, los cuales comenzó a ofrecer entre sus vecinos, familiares y amigos con muy buenos resultados, pues por su habilidad consiguió obtener un buen margen de ganancia, lo que la motivó a continuar negociando y a la fecha ha logrado consolidar una buena cartera de clientes que le generan un ingreso aceptable. Yennifer trabajo diariamente  de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 mediante visitas a sus clientes; ella está convencida que con un mayor capital podrá ampliar su clientela, e incrementar sus ventas por lo cual está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  su primer Credikiva, recursos que planea invertir en ropa, calzado y perfumes, productos de mayor demanda entre sus clientes. Su sueño de prosperidad es organizar su negocio en un local comercial y a largo plazo adquirir su propio apartamento.
texts.en:
Yennifer is an enterprising young woman who, guided by her marketing instincts, decided to take advantage of a small amount of money her father gave her and invest it in clothing, shoes, perfume and household items. She began to offer them for sale among her neighbors, family members and friends, with very good results.

Because of her skill she was able to achieve a good profit margin, which motivated her to continue with her business. To date she has managed to create a good customer base which generates an acceptable income for her. Jennifer works daily from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 visiting her customers.

She is convinced that with more money to invest she will be able to increase her clientele and sales, which is why she is working on her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest these resources in clothing, shoes and perfumes; the products in greatest demand from her customers.

Her dream of prosperity is to establish her business in a commercial site, and over the long-term to buy her own apartment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and perfume.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling to the neighbors and passersby. She mentioned a major challenge of competition, in her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter. In this way she will get meat to sell. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goats to slaughter, to get meat to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with two children. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a home-based charcoal selling business. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of charcoal to resell. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal.

loans.name: Zilpa

texts.en:
Zilpa is a married woman with three children, all attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not running water.

She has operated a retail shop business for four years to sell wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

She will use the loan to purchase stock goats so that she can sell the meat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  goats.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
It’s rainy season again in the Philippines. This season is difficult for both fishermen and fish vendors, as the scarcity of fish makes prices rise to levels the fish vendors find hard to afford.

Romelia, 37, from Tigbauan, Iloilo owns a fishing boat that her neighbors rent from her. She also sells a variety of fish in the market and runs a general store. Her husband, Bonifacio, helps her in these enterprises. They are blessed with young child who is the source of their inspiration.

In preparation for the rainy season, Romelia wants to have additional capital of 16,000 PHP to buy large quantities and different varieties fish while it’s less expensive. She will also set aside some amount for emergency situations like typhoons when there’s no chance to catch any fish. In those times, she will concentrate on her variety store and plans to add alternative sources like load retailing and mineral water distribution. This way, she can still earn some money even during rainy days and she can still sustain their usual everyday needs. You can be the answer to her prayers through your generous support. Thank you so much in advance.

She would be happy to see her child with a college diploma someday. It’s also her desire to extend help to her beloved siblings. She is a zealous member of CCT where she gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories of their life and businesses.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy larger quantities and different varieties of fish.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is a clever girl. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. She is single and lives with parents. She is a graduator of secondary school #15. She passed the entrance examination for the university and will study pharmaceutical studies to become a pharmacist and open her own pharmacy.

She is an active, well-spoken, dependable, and responsible person. She tries to be helpful and careful to local residents. She needs financial support to pay her higher education costs. She appealed to IMON and KIVA for a a loan to pay for her studies. This loan will help her to come closer to her professional goals.

She awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Wayne

texts.en:
In the Philippines, a small canteen is commonly known as a carenderia. Most of Filipino families eat only home-cooked meals during evenings when all family members are home to take part in the meal. If there is only one or two family members present for dinner, they prefer to buy cooked viand or other food as a matter of convenience and frugality. It is considered a waste of money and time to use cooking gas and food for one or two people since buying cooked rice and viands costs less. This is why Wayne’s carenderia business is considered valuable. His regular customers are his neighbors, students, and working people.

Wayne is 35 years old. He is married to Nerisa, 33, and they have 4 young children. They live in Tigbauan, Iloilo where Wayne runs his carenderia. This has been the family's source of income for almost 7 years. Although the canteen business is quite exhausting since Wayne must wake up very early and works until late at night, he persists because it pays for the family's daily expenses and his children's education.

Due to his family’s growing expenses, he aims to expand his canteen business through additional capital of 15,000 PHP that he will use to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. He works hard in order to support each of his children complete their education. He believes that his children will have a brighter future with college diplomas.

Each week, he meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God. All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of beans to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Hafsa

texts.en:
Hafsa is a married mother of one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for his farm.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman with four children, all attend school. Josphine lives at a rental house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Josphine has operated a home-baed charcoal selling business. She faces challenges of transportation and seasonality in her business.

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatumais a married woman with four children, all attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an home-baed open air food selling business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and potatoes for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a single woman who has no child. She lives at her rental house that has electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a plastics-selling business for the past one year, selling to the neighbors. Linet does not face any challenge in her business. Linet's goal is to hire employees in her business.
With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase more plastic items to resell, like basins, plastic cups, and buckets. She decided to join Yehu to access a loan, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic items to resell, like basins, plastic cups, and buckets.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is a married woman with one school-aged child. She lives at a rental house that has running water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as her greatist monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon for two years. Her potential customers are neighbors and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and learning more hairdressing skills in the future.

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 20,000, she wants to purchase new clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, both attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated a home-based open air food selling business.

She will use 20,000 KES to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Las Palomitas De Palcoco Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PALOMITAS DE PALCOCO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Máxima es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de queso, venta de comida, servicio de construcción. 

El crédito que sacarán beneficiará a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Máxima es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la promoción de la institución, en su comunidad. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas,  lo aprendió hace varios años por iniciativa propia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de mantas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en las ferias 16 de Julio y Palcoco. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association 'Palomitas de Palcoco' will begin the first cycle in Pro Mujer [Pro Woman], as part of the Central Focus of Copacabana. It is made up of 8 members and is run by a directive group of which Maxima is the President. The business carried out by the members of the communal association are varied, and between them they sell blankets, sell cheese, sell food and work in the construction service. 

The credit they are asking for will benefit mirco businesses of which Maxima is a member, she says that it is the first time for Pro Mujer, accepted for the promotion of the institution in her community. At the moment she has a business selling blankets, which she learnt many years ago by her own initiative. 

The credit will be used to increase capital (buy wholesale blankets) which will be bought from the sellers from the cities of El Alto, they will be sold during the festivals of 16th July and Palcoco. This form of work will allow her to generate income to support her family economically, she is already married and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health support which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale blankets

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 49, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has four children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming business, primarily grows rice and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for around twenty years. On average, she is able to make an earning of USD 5.00 a day. In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.  She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina goes fishing to catch and sell fish to the community. She is a 49-year-old married woman with six grown children. She has fished for 10 years and lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She will use the loan to display a variety of stock items, expand her business, and balance her finances. She has requested a loan to buy a fishing net and food for the family.

Saturnina is determined that her fishing business will become successful and would improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and food for the family.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with two children who attend school. They live at their own house that neither has electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a home-based business to sell Khanga ( women's wrap cloth). She is challenged by a lack of capital to expand her business.

She wants to purchase bales of Khangas to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Heidi

texts.en:
Iloilo, just like other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines, was hardly hit by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all businesses in those areas dwindled after the typhoon. Entrepreneurs worked hard in the past years to recover and rehabilitate their businesses. “Sari-sari” or variety stores were not exempted to that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan affected communities almost crushed the variety stores, because the commodities that the people need everyday were supplied to them through relief goods. It was after several months after Haiyan when variety stores rose again. 

Heidi is one of those variety store owners. Not only Haiyan affected her business. Her income also diminishes during school breaks or vacations. Now that the store operation returns to normal, she needs more stock of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages. She implores your kind support to enable her to buy all these needs in the amount of PhP 15,000. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Heidi is married to Romeo, a laborer, and they have children who are the reason for their hard work. She prays for good health, love and unity among her family members. She’s a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a 48-year-old hardworking woman from Barotac Viejo, Iloilo. She’s into buy and sell of dried fish for 11 years now. She buys directly from main producers and suppliers near the seashore so as to avail of lower prices. In this way, she can gain higher profit that helps sustain their usual expenditures. It’s her way of supplementing her husband’s irregular income as a farmer. They have 4 children, one of whom is studying in college. It is indeed pocket-draining that is why the couple works hard to complete their children’s education. 

This rainy season, Elina knows that there are times when dried fish will be scarce. But there are also favorable days when it will be abundant and cheap. She plans to seize those favorable days to buy volume of assorted dried fish. She needs PhP 27,000 additional capital that will keep her business running during rainy season. The income from this will continuously supply their everyday necessities and their children’s educational expenses. 

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion, which she studies. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume of assorted dried fish

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mrs. Mai is 42 years old, she is a hardworking woman. There are five people in her family. The loan can help her to build a sanitation latrine, which can contribute to improve the health for her family as well as environment protection. Husbandry and small business are main income source of her family so she is able to pay the loan monthly .

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en: Seang, in her 34 years of age, is a married woman with three dependent children. Two of her children are in school while the other one is too young for schooling. Earning about 12 USD per day and can save approximately about 5 USD, she and her husband are earning main income for the family through growing rice and additional income through raising pigs. The family’s income has been decreased because she has to sustain her rice business which is growing unhealthily and cure the pigs. She has been with VisionFund for nine times already and the past loans enabled her be better support her family. As the leader of two-member group, she will spend her loan on purchasing organic fertilizer and pig feed for raising pigs. She hopes that both of her businesses will grow and earn her good income so that she can keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to spend on purchasing organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield as well as her income, to keep sending her children to school.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en: Lurdes is 30 years old and married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking of how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $1,000. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, noodles, water, fish, soap, biscuits, candles, coffee, beer and Coca-Cola. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) who offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, cigarettes, sugar, noodles, water, fish, soap, biscuits, candles, coffee, beer and Coca-Cola

loans.name: Hermenegilda

texts.en:
Hermenegilda is taking a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and has three children. She runs a kiosk to generate income for her family.

She will use the loan to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water, soap, sprite, biscuits. and oils. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 300.00. She is a hard working woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt,milk, water, soap, sprite, biscuits, and oils.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: Mrs. Vi is 52 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Husbandry and salary are the main income of her family. With this loan, she is able to build a hygienic latrine to improve her family living standard as well as environment protection.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as noodles, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, water and beer.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. Lucia is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan, because it will lead to improving her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, water and beer.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mrs. Ty is a hardworking woman, 49 years old. She is married  and has three children. She needs loan to build a sanitation latrine to improve health of her family’s member and also for environment protection. Her family’s income is  from husbandry and small business so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a generous boy. He was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1997 and is single and lives with parents. After successful graduation of high school, he passed the entrance examination to university. Recently he is one of active student at class. He likes his future profession. He wants to work at electro energy station “ROGUN” that will ensure residents of Tajikistan, with electricity. He requested a loan to pay his higher education costs. He wishes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness. Loan will help him to get higher education degree.

loans.use: to pay higher education costs.

loans.name: Rodema

texts.en:
Rodema is so thankful that she has received financial support on her transportation livelihood. It is important that she has regular funds to properly maintain her tricycle for safe and efficient service. 

Rodema trusts that she can again request for a 30000 PHP loan to pay for an additional tricycle unit and for the regular maintenance of her present tricycle as well. She needs to increase her service to serve more passengers thus improve her income to meet the growing needs of her family of four. She continues to praise God for your good heart in helping her maintain her business.

Rodema's simple dream is for God to prosper her business and see her children finish their studies. Education is their hope and path to a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Merfilita

texts.en:
Merfilita is 62 years old and widow with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merfilita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 24 years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good, personal care products and other groceries. 

In the future Merfilita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Zalimon

texts.en:
Zalimon is a 28-year-old, married man. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. He deals in produce, plus he farms to supplement his income. Through these activities, he is able to meet his family's expenditures and save some money for his development.

Zalimon dreams of specializing in coffee and becoming a big coffee dealer. He works hard to achieve his dream. If supported with more capital, nothing will be able to limit him from becoming what he wants to be. Now, he requests a loan to buy more coffee, maize, and vanilla for selling.

loans.use: to buy more coffee, maize, and vanilla for selling.

loans.name: Mwanaasha

texts.en:
Mwanaasha is a married woman who has four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock, including sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock, including sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with three children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has no piped water but has electricity. She cites school fees and food being her greatest monthly expenses.

She has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang  is a hardworking woman, 43 years old. She is married and has three children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Esse

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Essé est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants vivant ensemble à Tokoin. Pour soutenir sa famille, Essé vend des produits de beauté en parcourant les quartiers. Essé s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Essé réalise sa rentabilité dans son activité et pour bien satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients, Essé nécessite ce prêt pour commander des chouchous et des barrettes en vue d’agrandir son stock et gagner plus de bénéfices afin d’aider son mari à couvrir les charges du ménage.
texts.en:
Aged 31, Essé is a married woman and mother of two children, living together in Tokoin. To support her family, Essé sells beauty products by walk through the streets in various areas. She stocks up twice a month at the market.

Essé makes a living with her business and in order to satisfy the needs of her clients, she needs this loan to order some chouchous (hair accessories) and barrettes so as to grow her stock and earn more profit to help her husband to cover the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 individual hair accessories and 10 individual barrettes.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida  is 53 years old, married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. They have been doing it together for many years. Over the time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community. She is a responsible mother of 2 children and is liable to provide them with the basic necessities of life. Currently she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR from Kashf foundation  to purchase good quality wood along with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase their production. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Abida  dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along with the packs of polish and nails in larger quantity to increase production.

loans.name: Bintisaidi

texts.en:
Bintisaidi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a soft drink fruit juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits for making fruit juice

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en:
Zaldy is 58 years old with three children, all in school.

Zaldy operates his wholesale-retail soft drinks distribution business in his community to provide for his family as the head of the family. He used to work abroad as a driver but the homesickness for his family made him decide to go home. He decided to retail soft drinks instead with his savings from abroad in the amount of PHP 30,000. He delivers the soft drinks himself using his customized motorcycle.

Zaldy's hard work earns him regular customers and he earns a net of PHP 8,000-10,000 weekly. He also employs one helper to help him deliver the soft drinks to his customers.

Zaldy now wants to expand and wants to deliver in other places in his community but the lack of capital prevents him from doing so.

Zaldy now is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 30,000 to buy cases of soft drinks to deliver and supply his customers.

The loan will enable him to deliver in a much wider area in their community, which can increase his income and gain more customers.

Zaldy is working very hard to provide for his family's daily expenses and for his children's school expenses as he is determined to see his children finish their education.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks to deliver and supply to his customers.

loans.name: Bory's Group

texts.en: Bory’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Bory makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married with six children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity.

Mwanalima operates a coconut business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Mrs. Minh is a hardworking woman, 35 years old. She is married and has one child. Her family’s income is mainly from small business, husbandry and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family’s member. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build the latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is grateful that he has received loans a number of times, and he has promptly repaid all of them. They definitely helped fund the maintenance of his jeepney and ensured safe and efficient service, and thus, continuous income to meet his family's needs.

Ruel trusts that he can obtain a 10,000 PHP loan again, to pay for the annual registration, new tires and fuel for his jeepney. It is important that his jeepney is registered and properly maintained, to ensure steady income to meet his family's needs and fund the education of his children. He is thanking God for faithfully supporting his livelihood.

Ruel dreams of acquiring more jeepneys and giving his family a better quality of life. He aims to send his children to college. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for new tires, fuel, and the annual registration of his jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Alfa Group

texts.en:
Myrna Luz is the featured borrower of Alfa Group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends since they left their hometown in the Philippines to come and work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Myrna Luz is a 46-year-old single lady who is working hard to cover her expenses and needs. She works in cooking and selling Philippine food. She has a good reputation among her customers for her professional skills in this domain. Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary foodstuff to increase her production and satisfy her customers' needs.

Myrna Luz is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Lorna is the lady standing in the middle and Gloria is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy necessary foodstuff to increase her production

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to grow her working capital and buy a big quantity of dried beans for resale so as to earn more money.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 31 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married, very hardworking and experienced farmer, who knows farming seasons and farms different crops according to seasons. This makes him different from other farmers, because he is rarely affected by weather changes, and two, he benefits so much from his crops because of his timing. He now has a very big tomato garden, and since they are scarce at the market this season, he is selling them on a large scale and at good prices. George bought a motorcycle through savings he got from his farming business. He now uses it as a side income project. George desires to build a permanent house for his family, but lacks some money to meet his dream. He is requesting money to buy more construction materials, like cement, sand and others for building.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials, like cement, sand and others for building.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 30 years old. He is very knowledgeable and strategic in his business. He owns a craft shop which has done wonders for him from the time he has operated it. He has been able to buy land and construct his house to a certain level.

He also started a mobile money business through savings he got from the craft shop. These have attracted more customers to him.

Leonard has realized a need to increase the amount of money in his mobile money business to meet his customer's needs. He now requests a loan to deposit money on his mobile money account and increase the float that people will send and withdraw.

loans.use: to deposit  money on his mobile money account and increase the float that people will send and withdraw.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a hard-working widow with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy soap and sugar to sell. She still operates a retail shop for her survival and also practices farming to earn more income to support her family. She faces challenges of inadequate capital and defaulters who buy from her shop on credit.

Her vision is to expand her business into wholesale and to educate all her children.

Scovia needs to take out a loan to buy more soap, sugar, bread and crates of soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, bread and crates of soda to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús se encuentra cosechando café en una apartada zona rural al norte de Nicaragua. Desde pequeño ha estado relacionado a la actividad de café, y por más de 12 años ésta ha sido su principal actividad económica. Vive junto a esposa y sus 6 hijos, a quienes les demuestra el valor de la educación como herramienta para salir adelante.

Sus inicios en este rubro, fueron con una pequeña área, y ahora ha logrado tener 3 manzanas  de café. La administración adecuada de los recursos dice que ha sido clave para esto. Para este ciclo, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos que le permitan continuar mejorando los rendimientos de su café y sus ingresos. 

El sueño de este pequeño productor, es brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna, así como los alimentos y las condiciones necesarias, es por ello que se esfuerza cada día trabajando para alcanzar sus metas.
texts.en:
Jesus harvets coffees trees in a remote, rural zone in the north of Nicaragua. Since he was young he has been involved in the growing of coffee, and for more than 12 years this has been his main economic activity. He lives together with his wife and their 6 children, to whom he shows the value of education as a tool for future improvement. 

He stated in this sector with a small plot, and now he has gained three blocks of land of coffee. The suitable management of the given resources has been key for this. For this harvest, he is asking for a loan to buy supplies which will allow him to continue improving the efficiency of his coffee output and his income. 

The dream of this small scale producer, is to provide his family with a respectable home, with food and the necessary conditions. This why he puts in effort every day working to reach his goals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies which he will use for his coffee plantation for a better harvest

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman who has been blessed with five kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses ae food and school fees.

Bahati has operated a fish-selling business which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Bahati dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish to sell.

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Seisa

texts.en:
Seisa is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at her own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase new clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is grateful that she was repeatedly granted loans to assist her food stall business. Those loans have certainly helped sustain and grow her livelihood. She puts her best efforts into cooking and selling bean curd pudding to make ends meet for her family.

Carol trusts that she can again access a Php 25,000 loan which she will use to buy more bean curd to make her "taho" (soy pudding ). Taho is made of fresh silken tofu, brown sugar syrup and tapioca pearls. It is sold on foot: Carol carries two aluminum buckets of it balanced on her shoulders.

Filipinos are now more health conscious so "taho" has become a favorite snack, not only for its yummy taste but for all the health benefits it offers. As soon as you hear the vendor yelling, “taahooooooo!”, you’ll see people come out of their houses to buy the delicacy. Carol's earnings will surely help cover their needs and fund her children's schooling.

Carol dreams that her business will flourish and her children will to pursue College. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the ingredients to make the bean curd pudding she sells.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace 4 años e inicio con capital propio, vende sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She has been working growing corn for 4 years which she started with her own capital. She sells her product in the area surrounding where she lives and with what she obtains from her sales she manages to pay some of her household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. so she can have higher economic revenue.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Mary Jel

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mary Jel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing retail. Mary Jel is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Mary Jel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has been blessed with six children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over six years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.
With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Buruhani

texts.en:
Buruhani  is a married woman and has been blessed with five children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over ten years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: Maria, tiene 38 años de edad,  reside en una aldea del municipio de el Negrito, Yoro junto a su esposo y 4 hijos.  Ella tiene  4 años de tener su propio negocio de Pulpería donde vende  granos básicos, refrescos, condimentos, golosinas, huevos, embutidos, pollo etc. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de la familia y quiere invertir para aumentar el inventario y sus ventas. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 25,000 lempiras  y lo invertirá en la compra de más producto como granos básicos, azúcar, productos de limpieza, refrescos, carnes, churros, pan, huevos, jugos etc. para surtir y vender. Como meta principal es mejorar el negocio cada día para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Negrito, Yoro together with his partner and their 4 children. 

She has had her own grocery store business for 4 years where she sells basic grains, drinks, condiments, sweets, eggs, cold meats, chicken etc. This business is the main source of family income and she wants to invest to increase the inventory and sales.

The loan which she has asked for is for 25,000 lempiras (1150 USD) and she will invest it in buying more products such as basic grains, sugar, cleaning products, drinks, meats, churros, bread, eggs, fruit juices etc. to stock and sell. 

Her main goal is to improve her business every day to imrpove the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products such as basic grains, sugar, cleaning products, drinks, meats, churros, bread, eggs, fruit juices, to stock her shop and sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married mother of two children. Both of her children attend school. She lives at her own house, which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge, the high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: Shama is 38 years old. She is a responsible mother of four daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six persons. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services to the people, at her own house. She needs to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Shama is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Shama is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for her own work

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Mrs. Toan is 54 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them .Her family’s income is mainly from small business . She is interested to improve the living standard for her family so she really needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 31 years old. She is a responsible mother of two daughters. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of four person. She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides sewing services to the people, at her own house. She likes to stitch ladies dresses in a unique styles and now she also started ladies shawls pico work as well. She needs to purchase a pico machine and a variety of stitching materials for her work, including thread, needles, and cloth. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally.

However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Ghazala is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested. Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new pico machine and a variety of stitching materials for her own sewing work.

loans.name: Haifaa

texts.en:
Haifaa is a 42-year-old married mother of two. Due to the low financial situation of her husband, she started eighteen years ago preparing and selling "Mouneh": Corchorus (a plant used as a vegetable), thyme, etc. at her house to help him in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She has professional skills in this domain for she learned long ago from her parents. She also works as a hairdresser out of her house as a second source of income.

Haifaa is working hard to provide her family with decent living conditions. Today, she lives with her family in a rented house, thus she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start building her own house.

Haifaa hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own beauty salon so as to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to start building her own house

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio owns and operates an internet cafe. He has been operating an internet cafe for 11 years now. He caters to services like chat, web browsing, online games and many others with a fee per hour.

In addition to that, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells goods ranging from soap to toothpaste, powdered soap, canned goods, beverages and assorted groceries. He is a married man and is 65 years of age. He is a resident of the town of Talibon, Bohol.

He has requested a loan to buy supplies like soft drinks and liquor, and tools like mousepads. These essential tools would help Sergio boost his livelihood. These could also attract more buyers to come and generate higher income.

In the future, he would like to successfully manage both of his sources of income to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies like soft drinks and liquor, and tools like mousepads.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 27 years old and married. He has two children and supports two additional dependents. He has been running a motorcycle transportation service business for the past five years. His monthly income is KES 15,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 113,500. He will use it to buy a motocycle for transporting goods from the market, as well as customers from one place to another. He will use the anticipated profit to repay the loan and to pay school fees for his children. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a motor vehicle and to educate his children to higher education.

loans.use: to buy a motocycle for transporting goods from the market, as well as customers from one place to another.
